loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina M. es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, vive en el distrito D. calleria región D. Ucayali, tiene 66 años, madre D. cuatro hijos que son mayores D. edad. Alejandrina tiene un lavadero D. motos y también se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien trabaja con ella. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desD. hace ocho años.  El primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que fue utilizado en la compra D. un tanque D. agua para su lavadero. Ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 800 soles, que será invertido para la compra D. una bomba D. agua para implementar su negocio. La meta D. Alejandrina es  tener un negocio D. golosinas en su casa.
texts.en:
Alejandrina M. is a hardworking and optimistic woman. She lives in the Callería district in the region of Ucayali. She is 66 years old and the mother of four grown children. Alejandrina has a motorcycle washing business and she also sells beauty products. She can count on the support of her husband, who works with her. She has been part of the “Juntas Hasta el Final” [Together until the End] communal bank for eight years. The first loan she received was for PEN 300.00, which she used to buy a water tank for her motorcycle washing business. She now needs a loan of PEN 800.00, which will be used to purchase a water pump for her business. Alejandrina’s goal is to have a business selling sweets from her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for her motorcycle washing business

loans.name: Pascuala Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza es originari de la comunidad de Chuculjuyup del municipio de Totonicapan su Actividad principal es ama de casa con los ingreso y con la colaboracion de su esposo que trabaja como abañil ha sobre salido con su hijos en darles una buena educacion y alimentacion hoy necesita de un credito que lo inveriran en la inscripcion y colegiatura de dos hijas que empiezan su carrera de diversificado en la ciudad de Quetzaltenango por la politicas de los colegios la inscripciones se realizan durante el mes de noviembre y la primera quincena de Diciembre y los cupos son limitados don ellos quieren incribirlo para no tener problema en el futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza is originally from the community of Chuculjuyup in the town of Totonicapan. She is a housewife who generates an income, while her husband works as a bricklayer. They help each other get ahead so that they can provide their children with food and a good education.

Esperanza is requesting a loan so that she can pay the registration fees and tuition for her two daughters, who are starting their general degree program in the city of Quetzaltenango. According to the school policies, registration occurs during the month of November through the 15th of December. Space is limited, so she wants to complete her daughters’ registration so that they will not experience problems in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the education expenses of her two daughters

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao; ella tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada,  tiene 06  hijos, 2 viven con ella, además D. su suegra. Estudió primaria incompleta. 
Luisa trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 03 años; se dedica a la compra y venta D. productos D. la región y D. animales menores.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, no lo invirtió bien ,se lo gasto, pero ahora aprendió a invertir.
Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar una vaca y repuestos D. tractor.
Su visión hacia el futuro es, tener mas capital y que crezca su negocio.
Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el préstamo con bajo interés y las charlas D. capacitación.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” [Breezes of the Blanco River] communal bank, in the Pilcuyo district in the province of El Collao. She is 55 years old, married, and has 6 children, 2 of whom still live with her. Her mother-in-law also lives with her. She finished part of primary school. Luisa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. She buys and sells food products of the region and also small animals. She tells us that her first loan was for PEN 300.00. She didn’t invest it well and spent it, but now she has learned to invest. She is requesting a loan of PEN 3,000.00, which she will use to invest in a cow and repair parts for a tractor. Her vision for the future is to have more capital so that her business can grow. What she most likes about her communal bank are the loan interest loans and the training lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and repair parts for a tractor.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años, es conviviente,  tiene 04 hijos, 02 de ellos están en Tacna y 02 están  estudiando,  ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, se dedica a  la compra y venta de ganado desde que ingreso al Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 con el que compró 02 ovinos porque no alcanzaba para comprar ganado vacuno. Paralelo a ello también realiza actividades agrícolas  para autoconsumo.

Ella solicitará el monto de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, con ello comprará 01 toro para engordarlo en 03 meses para luego venderlo en la feria de ganado.

Indica que en su  Banco Comunal aprende y se olvida de sus tristezas.

Su anhelo es tener su tienda de abarrotes ya que tiene una casa en la plaza del Centro Poblado de López.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the “Jesús de Nazaret” [Jesus of Nazareth] communal bank, in Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children. Two of her children live in Tacna and 2 are studying. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos [Kiva Field Partner] for 3 years. Since joining the communal bank she has been buying and selling livestock. Her first loan was for PEN 300.00 and she bought 2 sheep because she didn’t have enough to buy a cow. Along with this business, she also does agricultural activities for home consumption. She is requesting the amount of PEN 2,000.00, which she will use to buy 1 bull to fatten him up within 3 months so she can then sell him at the cattle market. She says that in her communal bank she learns and she forgets her problems. Her hope is to have a small grocery store because she a house on the plaza in Centro Poblado de López.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  Su conyuge es agricultor.  Él se encuentra en Palpa y vive en la casa de sus padres juntamente con sus hermanas.  Se dedica a la venta de toallas de baño como recorredora por el lugar donde vive. Se inicio en este negocio hace dos años.  Cuenta también con el ingreso de servicio de transporte como un chofer. Cuenta con vehículo propio pero los documentos están a nombre de su conyuge. Solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo y gastos de su casa el cual están construyendo.  Su objetivos son de tener su propia casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a school-age child. Her spouse is a farmer. Sonia and her family live in Palpa in her parents’ house along with her sisters. She sells bath towels as a door-to-door saleswoman and has been in this business for two years. In addition, she also generates income as a driver providing transportation services. Sonia operates her own vehicle, but the registration papers are in her spouse’s name. She is requesting a loan to use as operating capital and to cover her expenses related to the construction of her house. Her objectives are to have her own home and provide a better life for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply operating capital to her two businesses & pay for home construction costs

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora  LUZ MARIA M. V., tiene  50 años, vive en el distrito de  MOCHE provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 3  hijos, todos mayores. 
La socia tiene una tienda donde vende arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras, golosinas, gaseosas, etc. El negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa.
Con su primer credito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró vitrinas y andamios.
Con este crédito de 550 nuevos soles comprará sacos de arroz al por mayor, aceite y cajas de cerveza al por mayor para estar abastecidas por las fiestas de fin de año.
Ella sueña con ampliar su tienda y poder vender todo lo que sus clientes le soliciten para así generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz María Martínez Velásquez is 50 years old and she lives in Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She is a member of the Siempre Adelante II communal bank. She studied through the 5th year of secondary school and she has 3 children, all grown. She has a store where she sells rice, sugar, noodles, vegetable stews, sweets, sodas, etc. The business is located in her house. Her first loan was for PEN 300.00 and she bought vitrine cases and shelving. With this loan of PEN 550.00 she will buy sacks of rice, cooking oil and cases of beer at wholesale prices, so that she will be well-stocked for the end-of-the-year festivities. She dreams of expanding her store and being able to sell everything that her customers request of her so that she can generate a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, cooking oil and cases of beer at wholesale prices

loans.name: Lluri Paquita

texts.es: Lluri R. es una socia activa y perseverante, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 35 años, es madre de un menor, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es docente (profesor). Lluri forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martín de Porres” desde hace cuatro años, ella empezó con un crédito de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en el negocio de venta de repuestos. Actualmente necesita un crédito de 2500 soles que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, labiales, etc. para venderlos a sus clientes. La meta de Lluri es llegar a tener una fuente de soda con una gran variedad de productos que agraden a sus clienntes.
texts.en:
Lluri R. is a very active and determined woman who sells beauty products. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region. She is 35 years old and has a child. She has the support of her husband who is a teacher. Lluri has been a member of the communal bank “Fray Martín de Porres” for four years. She started with a 300 soles loan, which allowed her to start a business selling spare parts. She is now requesting a loan for 2500 soles to buy beauty products (perfumes, creams, lipsticks) to sell to her customers. Lluri’s goal is to have a soda fountain with a wide variety of products that please her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products (perfumes, creams, lipsticks)

loans.name: Jhannet

texts.es: "doña Jhannet tiene 23 años de edad, vive en casa de su cuñada, se encuentra casada con don Edgar,el mismo que trabaja como chofer asalariado, doña Jhannet tiene como actividad principal la venta de CD's y juguetes, el mismo que lo vende en la feria de la 16 de julio, de la ciudad de El Alto, en su puesto fijo. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de juguetes por temporada de navidad, ya que los precios aun se encuentran bajos."
texts.en:
Jhannet is 23 years old and lives in her sister-in-law's house. She is married to Edgar who works as a salaried chauffeur. Jhannet's principal activity is selling CDs and toys from her fixed post at the July 16th Fair in the City of El Alto.

The credit she is soliciting is to buy toys for the Christmas season while prices are still low.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INVEST IN CDs AND TOYS AT WHOLESALE

loans.name: Guadalupe David

texts.es: La familia del señor Guadalupe David  es de 6 integrantes es por ello que el desea construir una recamara mas para vivir mas cómodamente.  El siempre trabajo como ayudante de su hermano en una purificadora de agua, pero ahora el emprende un negocio donde distribuye los envases, tapas y etiquetas para el agua donde le ha ido muy bien. Pero ahora se ve en la necesidad de ampliar más su casa, pues sus hijos están creciendo y desean tener su propio espacio. Para poder realizar el proyecto el necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Sr. Guadalupe David is the head of a family consisting of six members. He wants to build a bedroom so that he can live more comfortably. Guadalupe David works as an assistant at his brother’s water purification business, but he also started a new venture distributing packaging, caps, and labels used for selling bottled water. His side business is doing very well.

Now he needs to make further expansions to his house because his children are growing and need their own space. In order to complete this project, he needs to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to add more space to his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell jewelry, pearls, bracelets, and necklaces

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying, stocking, and selling cooked beans

loans.name: Joyitas De Cosmos Group

texts.es:
Venta de verduras, comida, chuño (papa deshidratada), alimento seco, cosméticos, tejido de prendas de vestir, atención de tienda de barrio  son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Joyitas de Cosmos, que a su vez  pertenecen al Centro Focal Collpani, que se reúnen cada dos semanas. Todas trabajan  con mucho esfuerzo para sacar adelante a sus familias para tener una mejor calidad de vida,  están juntas hace aproximadamente  5 años y les agrada participar de las capacitaciones así como visitar al consultorio llevando a sus hijos para el control de peso y talla.
Todas necesitan acceder al préstamo para incrementar capital de trabajo en su mayoría piensan comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Joyitas de Cosmos” (Jewels of the Cosmos) meet every two weeks at the Collpani Community Center. They have neighborhood shops that offer various products such as vegetables, prepared foods, chuño (dehydrated potatoes), dried foods, cosmetics, and woven clothing. All of them work very hard to succeed so that their families can have a better quality of life. They have worked together as a group for approximately 5 years. They enjoy participating in the training seminars and have also taken advantage of medical services in which they bring their children to the clinic to have their height and weight monitored.

The members need access to a loan so that they can increase their operating capital. The proceeds will be used to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling of cola

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for repairing engines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To refurbish and look after her workshop

loans.name: Marlenis

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Marlenis Rubí tiene 43 años de edad es casada  tiene dos hijos menores de edad, ambos estudian en nivel primario. La señora Rubí se dedica desde hace nueve años a la venta ambulante de cosméticos y prendas de oro y plata laminado.

Sus principales clientes son del sexo femenino a quienes les entrega sus productos al crédito con facilidades de pago, por lo general en dos o tres cuotas quincenales. Este negocio lo realiza por encargo en base a lo que sus clientes le solicitan en ocasiones hace su pedido y en otras veces viaja a la capital. Marlenis ya ha sido beneficiada con dos préstamos anteriores por parte de kiva y ya ha cancelado en tiempo y forma.

Sin embargo por la naturaleza  del negocio tiene que contar con un capital que le permita hacer las compras al contado y entregarlas con facilidades de pago, para este fin es que solicita financiamiento, en este caso requiere comprar oro laminado ya que es el producto que esta teniendo mayor demanda en esta época del año.

Los productos a comprar son los siguientes: 10 pares de Aretes de oro laminado los compra a US 8 dólares cada par, 8 unidades de pulseras de oro laminado las compra a US 20 dólares cada una, 8 unidades de anillos de oro laminado a US 15 dólares cada unidad y 8 unidades de cadenas de oro laminado a US 30 dólares cada unidad.
texts.en:
Marlenis Rubí is 43 years old and married. Her two children are elementary school students. For the past nine years, Marlenis has worked as a door-to-door saleswoman selling cosmetics and both gold and silver plated jewelry.

Her main customers are women. They purchase these products on credit, and then make their payments in two or three installments every two weeks. Most of her time is spent gathering orders from her customers, while at other times, she has to travel to the capital to obtain merchandise. Marlenis is the beneficiary of two previous Kiva loans that were repaid in a timely manner.

Due to the nature of her business, she needs capital to acquire her merchandise with cash and still issue credit to her customers. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan. Marlenis will use the proceeds to acquire gold plated products that are higher in demand during this time of year.

The items she plans to purchase are as follows:

• 10 pairs of gold earrings @ $8 USD/pair • 8 gold bracelets @ $20 USD/each • 8 gold rings @ $15 USD/each • 8 gold chains @ $30 USD/each

(Click HERE and HERE to view the previous loans.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gold plated jewelry to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia, de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos: Nico de 16 y Manuel de 15 años, a quienes desea dar una buena educación. 

Su negocio es la confección de ropa para niños, desde muy joven incursionó en este trabajo y ahora tiene su propio taller de confecciones, donde elabora prendas infantiles, la cuales posteriormente lleva a vender en su puesto, donde son compradas rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es confeccionar ropa para los niños más pequeños, ya que le causan mucha ternura, lleva 5 años realizando este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es el acabado de las prendas, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado. 
Para el futuro, espera comprar más máquinas y aumentar su cantidad de producción.

Delia se encuentra en su sexto préstamo con MFP y está muy decidida en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con sus compañeras. Con el dinero que solicita comprará nuevos materiales para confeccionar una mayor cantidad de prendas infantiles.
texts.en:
Delia, 37, is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her two sons: Nico, who is 16, and Manuel, who is 15. She wants to give them a good education. Her business is making clothing for children. Since she was very young, she has done this work. She now has her own shop to make children's clothing, which she later takes to sell at her stand where they are purchased quickly. What she likes most about her job is making clothing for the smallest children because she feels a lot of tenderness. She has done this work for 5 years and thinks the most difficult part is finishing the clothing because she has to do this with a lot of care. In the future, she hopes to buy more machines to increase her production. Delia is on her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and is very determined to make her payments on time because she wants to be able to receive more credits later on. She participates a lot in her communal bank and is very close with the other members. With the money she is requesting, she will buy new materials to make a larger quantity of children's clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textile materials

loans.name: Noheli

texts.es:
Noheli, de 18 años, es una joven muy alegre y sincera, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Su negocio es la venta de la hoja de coca, esta actividad le ha sido muy rentable y le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse por sí sola. Ella compra la coca al por mayor, ya que le sale más barato, para luego venderla en el pequeño puesto que instala en la puerta de la casa donde vive.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para dedicarse a sus estudios, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que le es muy estresante. 
Noheli espera que con el tiempo su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y desea ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy querida por sus demás compañeras debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los quinientos soles solicitados comprará más bolsas de hoja de coca, ya que últimamente está teniendo mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Noheli, 18, is a very happy and sincere young woman. She lives in a rented house, and what she wants the most is to succeed in life. Her business is selling coca leaves. It has been very profitable, and it has given her the necessary income to support herself on her own. She purchases the coca leaves wholesale because it is cheaper this way and then sells it at a small stand in the door of the house where she lives. What she likes most about her job is that it gives her time to dedicate to her studies. She has had this business for 4 years and she thinks the most difficult part is staying all day at her sales stand because it's very stressful for her. Noheli hopes that her business will grow with time and that she will make more income. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she hopes to be very punctual with her payments. She is very loved at her communal bank by the other members because of the happiness she brings to the group. With the 1500 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy more bags of coca leaves since she has had more demand lately.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her amount of merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

La señora Victoria no tiene estudios y tiene 6 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde desde hace 3 años. Su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales menores como: ovejas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 900.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de dos vacas lecheras.

Su deseo para el futuro es superarse en la venta de animales y aumentar su capital.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización es la puntualidad y las reuniones de capacitación.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Manuela de Hoy II” and lives in the District of Illave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 6 children. Victoria did not attend school. She buys and sells livestock. Victoria began working with Manuela Ramos three years ago and used her first loan of 300 soles to buy sheep. With this loan of 900 soles, Victoria will buy two dairy cows. Her desire for the future is to become successful in selling animals so that she can increase her capital. What she enjoys most about the Manuela Ramos organization are the timeliness of the loans and the training seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El microempresario: José Antonio M. P. tiene 45 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos mayores de edad y actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la universidad. El negocio del señor M. es un taller de reparación y venta de repuestos para bicicletas, este negocio tiene aproximadamente unos  25 años de estar prestando servicios a la población Blufileña.

Una de las ventajas del negocio es que en la ciudad hay una cantidad considerable de bicicletas y solamente existen dos talleres que brindan este servicio. El microempresario M. ya fue beneficiado con un préstamo por parte de kiva, el cual ya cancelo y aprovecha para agradecer a los prestamistas que confiaron en el y le hicieron el préstamo al igual que a kiva y también a ADEPHCA.

Al igual que otros negocios, tanto la venta de repuestos como las reparaciones de bicicletas aumentan ya que muchos jóvenes y adolescentes reciben de regalo una bicicleta para estos días de navidad y requieren este servicio. Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes repuestos: 30 unidades de Tubos de bicicleta Nº 26 y 30 unidades de Tubos de bicicleta Nº 24, los compra a US 2 dólares cada unidad, 60 unidades de llantas de bicicleta Nº 26 y 50 unidades de llantas de bicicleta Nº  24 compra cada unidad a US 3 dólares, 40 unidades de Rin para bicicleta Nº 26 y  30 unidades de Rin para bicicleta Nº 24, los compra a US5 dólares cada unidad.
texts.en:
José Antonio M. P. is 45 years old, married, and the father of two adult children of whom one is a university student. He operates a bicycle repair shop and also sells bicycle parts. His business has been serving the population of Bluefields for approximately 25 years. One of the advantages of his business is that it is only one of two shops in the area to provide repair services to the numerous bicycles that exist within the city. José was the beneficiary of a previous Kiva loan, which has since been repaid. He wants to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders and ADEPHCA for providing that loan. Like other businesses, he sees more activity during the Christmas season. Many young people and teenagers receive bicycles as Christmas presents, so the demand for spare parts and repair services is much higher during this time of the year. José will use this loan to purchase the following parts: • 30 units of bicycle tube #26 @ $2 USD/unit • 30 units of bicycle tube #24 @ $2 USD/unit • 60 units of #26 bicycle wheels @ $3 USD/unit • 50 units of #24 bicycle wheels @ $3 USD/unit • 40 units of #26 bicycle rims @ $5 USD/unit • 30 units of #24 bicycle rims @ $5 USD/unit

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bicycle parts

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 21 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe que tiene que aportar con los gastos de su hogar, es por eso que decidió incursionar en el negocio de la venta de artesanías de barro, las cuales compra de la ciudad de Pucara (distrito de la región Puno), para luego llevarlas a vender a la ciudad de Arequipa, que es donde tiene su puesto de venta.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es participar de las distintas ferias que se llevan a cabo en la ciudad de Arequipa, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las artesanías, ya que son estructuras muy delicadas y corren el riesgo de romperse. Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda muy grande de artesanías donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Victoria con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los setecientos soles solicitados, comprará más artesanías para vender en la ciudad de Arequipa.
texts.en:
Victoria, 21 years old, is a very simple and happy young woman. She lives in her parents’ house and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life.

Although she is still young, she knows that she needs to contribute to the household expenses. This is why she decided to enter the business of selling clay handicrafts, which she purchases from the city of Pucara (district in the Puno region) to then brings them to sell in the city of Arequipa, where she has her sales stand.

What she likes most about her job is participating in the different markets that take place in the city of Arequipa. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and thinks that the most difficult part is transporting the handicrafts, since they have very delicate structures and they run the risk of breaking. With time, she hopes to have a big handicraft store where she can sell more comfortably.

This is Victoria’s fourth loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to make her loan repayments on time and she is prepared to do so. She is a very well-liked member of her communal bank. With the 700 PEN loan, she will purchase more handicrafts to sell in the city of Arequipa.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lindaura

texts.es:
Lindaura P. es una mujer carismática y perseverante, vive en la carretera Federico Basadre -AA.HH Nueva Magdalena, región de Ucayali, tiene 53 años, es madre de cuatro hijos que ya son mayores de edad, es viuda. 
Se dedica a la venta de chupetes (helados de hielo), gelatinas y gaseosas , actividad que realiza en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Del Futuro” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de gaseosas. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar gaseosas, frutas y otros insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes. La meta de Lindaura es tener una bodega bien surtida y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Lindaura P. is a charismatic and persevering woman who lives along the Federico Basadre Highway in the District of Nueva Magdalena, Ucayali Region. She is 53 years old, widowed, and the mother of four adult children.

Lindaura sells popsicles, gelatins, and sodas out of her home. She joined the Communal Bank “Del Futuro” (Of the Future) two years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used the money to buy sodas.

She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy sodas, fruit, and other ingredients for making popsicles. Lindaura’s goal is to open a well-stocked grocery store so that she can continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, fruit, and other ingredients for making popsicles

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Maria Lucila T. tiene 73 años de edad, es madre soltera con 7 hijos, todos adultos, vive con 3 nietos y desde hace 17 años tiene una pulpería que le permite mantener a sus 3 nietos ya que su madre viajo a Costa Rica en búsqueda de trabajo, sin embargo el dinero que le envía no es suficiente para la manutención de sus hijos por lo que doña Maria Lucila tiene que atender su negocio para poder mantener a sus nietos y a ella misma.

Esta pulpería le ha permitido poder tener el sustento diario, esta microempresaria ya fue beneficiada con un préstamo por parte de kiva, el cual cancelo en tiempo y forma y del cual se encuentra agradecida con los prestamistas por ese apoyo. Esta señora no puede leer ni escribir sin embargo es ayudada por sus nietos en el negocio.

Esta microempresaria esta solicitando se le preste para comprar los siguientes productos: 2 quintales de Arroz americano, cada quintal le cuesta US 40 dólares,1 quintal de  frijoles que lo compra a US 40 dólares, 90 libras de  carne de res a US 1.30 dólares cada libra, 100 libras de carne de pollo a US 1.45 dólares cada libra, 2 quintales de azúcar a US 30.50 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de harina a US  40 dólares cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US  35 dólares  cada bidón, 2 cajas de leche la Lechera a US 40 dólares cada caja y  3 cajillas de huevos a US 9 dólares cada cajilla.
texts.en:
Maria Lucila T., 73, is a single mother of 7 adult children. Three grandchildren live with her and she has had a small grocery store for the last 17 years which allows her to support her three grandchildren since their mother went to Costa Rica to work. However, the money she sends home isn't sufficient to support her children so Maria Lucila has to tend to her store to support herself and her grandchildren. The store has produced enough for her daily support. She has already benefitted from a previous Kiva loan which she repaid on time; she is grateful to the lenders for this help. She can neither read nor write but her grandchildren help her out in the store. She is requesting funding to buy the following products: 2 quintales of American rice (a quintal is a weight measurement equivalent to 46 kilograms) at 40 US dollars each, 1 quintal of beans at 40 dollars US each, 90 pounds of beef at 1.30 dollars US each, 100 pounds of chicken at 1.45 US dollars each, 2 quintales of sugar at 30.50 dollars US each, 2 quintales of flour at 40 dollars US each, 2 bidones (a large jar) of oil at 35 dollars US each, 2 cases of La Lechera evaporated milk at 40 dollars US each, and 3 cases of eggs at 9 dollars US each.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy American rice, beans, beef, chicken, sugar, flour, oil. La Lechera condensed milk, eggs.

loans.name: Berita

texts.es:
Berita Dávila es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 35 años, es madre de dos menores, ella se dedica a la venta de menús (alimentos), cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es motocarrista (transportista). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace tres años.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 200 soles, que invirtió para comprar utensilios, platos, vasos, para su restaurante. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2500 soles, una parte será utilizado para la compra de mesas para dar mejor atención a sus clientes, y la otra parte se invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocar. La meta de Berita es tener una tienda de repuestos y accesorios para motos y motocar.
texts.en:
Berita Davila is a dynamic and collaborative member. She is 35 years old, the mother of two children and lives in the Calleria district, Ucayali area. She is dedicated to her restaurant business with the support of her husband who is a taxi driver.

Mrs. Dávila is a member of the Community Bank "Las Divinas" since three years ago; the first loan she received was for 200 soles, which she invested in the purchase of utensils, plates and glasses for her restaurant. She is asking for a loan of $875, which will be invested in the purchase of tables to offer a better service to her clients, and the maintenance of her husband’s motorcar. Berita's goal is to have a spare parts shop for motorcycles and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital and Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Marilu Dolores

texts.es:
La socia MARILU DOLORES pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos; dos mujeres y un varón. Los hijos mayores estudian en el colegio en el nivel secundario y el menor en el nivel primario. Ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella trabaja por las mañanas como auxiliar en un jardín y por las tardes alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de leña y madera. Nuestra socia viaja los fines de semana a las ciudades de Chicheros y Anta para cotizar el precio de la leña y madera para luego comprar. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y leña así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marilu Dolores is a member of the Communal Bank “Vilcanota”. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children (two daughters and a son). The two older children attend high school while the youngest one is in elementary school. She and her family live in the province of Urubamba, which is located north of the city of Cusco.

Marilu works in the mornings as an assistant gardener. In the afternoons, she divides her time between her household activities and selling firewood and lumber. Marilu travels on the weekends to the cities of Chicheros and Anta to negotiate the price of firewood and lumber for subsequent purchase. She has been in this business for a number of years and has done very well thanks to all of her efforts. Marilu is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants to succeed for the sake of her children. She is requesting this loan in order to buy lumber and firewood as a way of generating more income. This will enable her to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Marilu is grateful for this opportunity and promises to submit her payments on the scheduled due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood & lumber

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Leonardo L. le está haciendo falta la barda trasera de la casa, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Solicita el préstamo ya que desea la seguridad de sus tres pequeños hijos. 
El señor Leonardo es empleado de una  compañía de trasportes en el departamento de chofer de un camión, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito ya que los gastos familiares los se encargara su esposa la señora Rosalía García con las ganancias que obtiene en la venta de comida en una escuela. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Rosalía ya que el señor Leonardo se encontraba en su trabaja el día de la visita.
texts.en:
At the home of Sr. Leonardo L., there is no fence at the back of the house. He does not have the money at the moment to buy the materials needed to complete this improvement. Therefore, he is requesting a loan so that he can provide security for his three small children.

Sr. Leonardo is employed as a truck driver for a transportation company. His salary will be used to repay this loan. His wife, Sra. Rosalía García, already covers the family expenses from her earnings selling food at a school.

Sra. Rosalía is the person who appears in the photo, since Sr. Leonardo was at work on the day of our visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the installation of a fence behind the house

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María Martínez es una persona que vive sola, ya que sus hijos todos están en estados unidos, pero es muy trabajadora que lucha día con día para salir adelante, es muy emprendedora y por lo mismo estableció su negocio propio de nombre “Abarrotes El Gallo” desde hace 2 años, cuenta con su propia clientela, por el buen trato que se les brinda; su  proveedor de abarrotes le ofrece una mercancía a un precio mas bajo ya que se lo manejaría por mayoreo y por ello esta tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María Martínez lives by herself since her children are in the United States. She is a hardworking woman who struggles day after day to get ahead. Two years ago, María became an entrepreneur when she established her own business called “Abarrotes El Gallo”. She has her own customers and provides them with good service.

María is requesting this loan because her grocery distributor supplies her with merchandise at a lower price because it is sold at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at wholesale

loans.name: Rocio Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Rocío Esmeralda C. es madre soltera, su hijo esta estudiando medicina en una ciudad cercana, ella estableció su negocio propio de nombre “Ciber-Barato” con una antigüedad de 3 años. Ella esta tramitando este crédito para la reparación y compra de piezas de las computadoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Rocio Esmeralda C. is a single mother. Her son is studying medicine in a nearby city. Three years ago, she established her own business called “Ciber-Barato” (Cyber Cheap). Rocio is requesting this loan so that she can buy spare computer parts for offering repair services.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts so that she can offer computer repair services

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis Antonio Gómez  es Soltero tiene a su cargo sus dos Hijos, el ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante seis años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 7 créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para  Mejoramiento de vivienda cambio del sistema eléctrico, con el fin de darle una mejor seguridad  a la viviendo.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Antonio Gómez is single and cares for his two children. He has worked with Ceprodel for six years and in this time he has managed to improve his living conditions with the seven credits he has had. The requested credit will go towards making improvements to his home by replacing his electricity system with the goal of making his home more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Isidro Perfecto

texts.es:
Don Isidro V. es un señor de 57 años de edad, tienes dos hijos, ambos estan casados. Su actividad principal es la venta de chifles, negocio que lo inicio hace dos años. Actualmente tiene cinco personas que lo ayudan en la preparación de los chifles y su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 7h00 a 17h00.

Con el prestamo le gustaria comprar una maquina electrica para hacer chifles con el proposito de incrementar sus ventas, para lo cual ha pensado en alquilar un local en una avenida principal de su vencindario. Su sueño es superar la venta de cinco mil fundas de chifle mensuales que actualmente vende y contratar dos personas mas que lo ayuden. Con las ganancias de la venta de chifles planea construir una parte de la losa de su casa.
texts.en:
Isidro V. is 57 years old. He has two children, both married. His main business is the sale of fried plantain chips, which he started two years ago. Currently he has five people who help him make the chips and his work schedule is Monday through Friday, 7:00am to 5:00pm. With his loan he would like to buy an electric machine to make the plantain chips, with the goal of increasing his sales. To do this, he has thought of renting a store space on a main street in his neighborhood. His dream is to sell more than five thousands bags of chips each month. He currently employs two people who help him with sales. With the earnings from the sale of his chips, he plans to pour part of the cement floor for his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric machine to make plantain chips

loans.name: Daysi Rosalvina

texts.es:
La socia DAYSI pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos; una mujer y un varón. Ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su tienda donde vende zapatos. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos para niños, damas y caballeros así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Daysi belongs to the communal bank, "Vilcanota." She is 33, married, and has two children, one boy and one girl. They live in the Urubamba province, which is located to the north of the city of Cusco. She alternates her time between her home and her store where she sells shoes. She has done this for several years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she has put into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to take good care of her children. She needs a loan to buy merchandise like shoes for children, women, and men so she can increase her capital and to have more income and to give her children a better quality of life. She is thankful for the opportunity that is being offered to her and she promises to comply with her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like shoes for children, women, and men to be able to increase her capital

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es: L. señora Bertha Alicia T. es casada y se dedica a L. venta D. Tupper Ware y venta D. ropa usada, desD. hace 3 años el negocio esta dando ganancias, por L. gran dedicación y esfuerzo, los productos y el buen trato que le brinda a sus clientes, elL. esta tramitando este crédito para L. construcción D. una barda para el frente D. su vivienda y obtener una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Señora Bertha Alicia T. is married and makes a living by selling Tupperware and used clothing. She has earned a profit with this business for three years because of her dedication, effort, products, and the good treatment she offers to her customers. She is applying for this credit so she can build a wall in front of her home for better security.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia, de 19 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe que tiene que ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, es por eso que con todos los ahorros que tenía, y con ayuda de sus padres, pudo comprar un auto, que ha puesto a trabajar en la empresa de taxis “Guerreros”, donde ella es la encargada de la central. Ella recibe las llamadas de los usuarios y apoya a los chóferes de los taxis a ubicar las calles que les solicitan sus pasajeros.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es escuchar las cosas que dicen los conductores, ya que eso la distrae mucho, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día atendiendo en la central. 
Para más adelante, espera poder comprar otro taxi para que sea incluido en la empresa de taxis y obtenga más ganancias.

Este es el primer préstamo de Delia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en las reuniones. Con los ochocientos soles solicitados hará arreglar su taxi, pues está empezando a fallar.
texts.en:
Delia, 19, is a very happy and unassuming young woman. She lives in her parent’s house. What she wishes for most of all is to have a better quality of life. Even though she is still young, she knows that she needs to help her parents with the household expenses. That is why bought a car with all of her savings and help from her father. She has put it to work in the Guerreros taxi company, where she is in charge of the center. She takes the calls from the users and supports the drivers by locating the streets that the passengers ask for. What she likes most about her work is listening to the things the drivers say. It is very entertaining. She has been doing this for two years. The most difficult thing is having to stay all day taking care of the center. Later she hopes to be able to buy another taxi to be included in the taxi business in order to get more earnings. This is Delia’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. In her communal bank she is a very responsible member. She is always up to date on all of the agreements reached in the meetings. She will use the 800 PEN that she is asking for to fix her taxi as it is starting to have problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her car

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía es una mujer de 47 años, muy amorosa con su familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo de 35 y sus 2 hijas: Yesica de 13 y Nelida de 8, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En San Antonio de Putina (provincia de la región de Puno), se encuentra el centro poblado “La Mina Rinconada” (poblado predominantemente minero), es aquí donde Epifanía tiene su tienda, donde vende toda clase de productos. Pero últimamente está teniendo problemas para cubrir la demanda de productos que le hacen, ya que el incremento de la población a hecho que la mercadería que lleva no le alcance.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frió que hace en el pueblo. Para el futuro, espera incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que trae, ya que desea que su tienda se convierta en la más importante de la mina La Rinconada.

Este es el primer préstamo de Epifanía con MFP y está dispuesta a ahorrar para poder pagar sus cuotas, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una de las socias más alegres y responsables. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para llevar a vender a la mina La Rinconada.
texts.en:
Epifanía is a 47 year old woman who is very loving with her family. She lives in her own house with her 35 year old husband and their two daughters. Yesica is 13, and Nelida is 8. The children are the motivation for all of their efforts. In San Antonio de Putina (a province in the Puno region) you will find La Mina Rinconada (predominantly populated by miners) town center. That is where Epifanía has her store, where she sells all types of products. Recently she has been having problems meeting the demand for products. The increase in the population has made her supply of merchandise insufficient. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers. She has been doing this for four years. The most difficult thing is having to put up with the intense cold in the town. In the future she hopes to increase the amount of merchandise she has. She wishes to turn her store into the most important one in the La Rinconada mine. This is Epifanía’s first loan with MFP. She is prepared to save to be able to make her payments. She does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is one of the happiest and most responsible members. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy more merchandise to sell in the La Rinconada mine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 18 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una habitación alquilada junto a su querido hijo, José de 1 año, a quien desea dar una buena vida.

El negocio al que Flor se dedica es la venta de salchipollo (comida hecha a base de tallarín, papas fritas y pollo) y salchipapa (comida hecha a base de papas fritas y salchichas cortadas en rodajas). Ella es una vendedora muy amable y convincente, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes quienes prefieren comprarle a ella por el delicioso sabor que le pone a sus platillos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva un año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace por las noches en las calles de Juliaca. Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y pueda alquilar una tienda donde pueda vender sus platillos con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es primer préstamo de Flor con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes, además de nuevos platitos y cubiertos para servir sus deliciosas salchipapas y salchimotes.
texts.en:
Flor, 18, is a very cheerful and hard-working young woman. She lives in a rented room with her beloved, 1-year-old son, José, for whom she wants to provide a good life. Flor sells salchipollo (a dish based on pasta, fried potatoes and chicken) and salchipapa (a dish based on fried potatoes and sliced frankfurters. She is a very kind and convincing seller so she has a lot of customers who prefer to buy from her because of the delicious flavor she imparts to her dishes. What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers. She has been in this line of work for a year and feels that the most difficult thing about is having to put up with the intense cold at night in Juliaca's streets. For later in the future she hopes her business will grow and she can set up an eatery where she can sell her dishes with less stress. This is Flor's first loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with her repayments. She is a very respected member of her communal bank because of the level of maturity she exhibits. With the 1000 soles requested she will buy more ingredients as well as new dishes and cutlery to serve her delicious salchipapas and salchimotes (a dish based on fried corn, chicken and sausage).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
La socia NERI pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, ella es madre y padre para sus tres hijos. Los hijos mayores estudian en la Universidad Nacional de San António Abad del Cusco las carreras profesionales de Administración de Empresas y Turismo y el menor estudia en el colegio y tiene nueve años. Los hijos mayores viven en la provincia de Cusco y la socia con el menor viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de secretaria en la UGEL de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para la alimentación, habitación, libros, pasajes, vestimenta y educación de sus hijos que estudian en la universidad. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
NERI, 33, is a member of the "Vilcanota" communal bank. She is a single mother and must be both mother and father to her three sons. The older sons study at the San António Abad del Cusco National University majoring in Business Administration and Tourism, respectively. The youngest son is in school; he is 9 years old. The older sons live in Cusco province and Neri lives with her youngest son in the province of Urubamba, which is north of the city of Cusco. Neri alternates her domestic chores with her work as school secretary at Urubamba's UGEL (Local Peruvian public school). She has been employed here for several years now and does very well thanks to all the effort she puts into work. Neri is a hard-working, enterprising woman that wants to see her children get ahead. She needs financing to pay for her sons' university expenses like room and board, books, transportation costs, clothing, and fees. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room and board, books, travel expenses, clothing and school fees for her sons that are in university.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 20 años, es un joven muy tranquilo y trabajador, vive en una habitación alquilada y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Aunque todavía es muy joven, Jaime ha decidido apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, es por eso que incursionó en la venta de ropa de segunda mano, la cual vende en la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde es muy conocido por los pantalones de buena calidad que vende.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva un año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los fardos de ropa desde la ciudad de Desaguadero (Provincia de Puno), ya que el viaje es muy largo y cansado. 
Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Jaime con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socio muy respetado por el orden que le pone al grupo. Con los seiscientos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Jaime, 20, is a very serene, hard-working young man. He lives in a rented room and his greatest wish is to get ahead in life. Although still very young, Jaime has decided to help his parents with household expenses by selling second-hand clothing in Juliaca's Sunday market where he is very well known for the quality of the pants he sells. What he likes most about his job is chatting with his customers. He has been involved with this activity for a year and feels that the most difficult aspect of the job is transporting the heavy bundles of clothes from the city of Desaguadero (Puno province) because the trip is long and very tiring. With time, he hopes his business will grow and produce better earnings. This is Jaime's first loan with MFP and he pledges to be very punctual with his repayments. He is a very respected member of his communal bank because of the order he imposes on the group. With the 600 soles requested he will buy more merchandise to better sock his sales stand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 28 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a sus 2 hijas: Katia de 7 y Maria de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de cerveza, su puesto está ubicado en el centro minero “La Rinconada”, y todos los fines de semana traslada muchas cajas de cerveza para renovar las que han sido consumidas durante la semana. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por eso sus clientes la prefieren antes que a la competencia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las cajas de cerveza desde la ciudad de Juliaca hasta la mina, ya que es un viaje muy largo y cansado. 
Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda, donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo de Luz con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y colaboradora. Con los mil soles que solicita comprará más cajas de cerveza, ya que se ha incrementado la demanda.
texts.en:
Luz, 28, is a very loving mother. She lives in one of her family member's homes with her two daughters: Katia, who is 7, and Maria, who is 5. They are the motive for all of her efforts. She has a business selling beer. Her stand is located in the mining center called, "La Rinconada." Every weekend, she moves many boxes of beer to renew what has been consumed during the week. She is a very happy and charismatic saleswoman. This is why her customers prefer her over her competition. What she likes the most about her job is talking with her customers since this makes her long work days more enjoyable. She has done this work for 2 years and she thinks the most difficult part about it is transporting the boxes of beer from the city of Juliaca to the mine. It is a long and tiring trip. In the future, she hopes to have a store where she can offer her customers better service. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows that she has to make her payments on time and is willing to do this. She is a very happy and collaborative member of her communal bank. With the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy more boxes of beer since her demand has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her amount of merchandise

loans.name: Concha Group

texts.es:
María José C. Araica, Esperanza G. y Dinora H. formaron al grupo Concha. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y con visión a pesar de sus limitaciones.

El negocio de la señora María José C. Araica consiste en reciclar papel, botellas y latas. Ella llego tan sólo a cursar  primer grado de primaria  pero tiene una conciencia ecologista muy alta y trabaja arduamente para que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y sueñas con verlos con una carrera. 

Dinora H. tiene una fritanga, que es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena.

Esperanza de los Ángeles G. comercializa de forma ambulante gran variedad de productos como cosas de horna, prensa pelos, cosméticos, colas, fantasía, lápices etc.
texts.en:
María José C. Araica, Esperanza G., and Dinora H. form the Concha Group. They are hard-working and enterprising women with a vision in spite of their limitations. María José C. Araica’s business is recycling paper, bottles, and cans. She only went to first grade, but she is very ecologically conscientious, and she works very hard so that her children are able to complete their education. She dreams of seeing them have careers. Dinora H. has a “fritanga”, which is a restaurant popular for excellent food in Nicaragua. It consists of selling fried foods, which are prepared solely to put on the grill. It is generally purchased for dinner. Esperanza de los Ángeles G. is a street vendor. She sells a great variety of products like decorations, hair clips, cosmetics, hair accessories, costume jewelry, and lipsticks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To recycle paper, bottles, and cans

loans.name: Guayacan Group

texts.es:
Marisela del Socorro M. Chavarría, María Dolores G. y Silvia Lorena B. Gonzales integran al grupo Guayacan. Ellas son tres féminas emprendedoras, luchadoras y trabajadoras.
La señora Marisela del Socorro Chavarría tiene ocho años de comercializar de manera ambulante  cosméticos, cremas y perfumes además de tener su propio taller de costura.

De la misma manera María Dolores G. Carballo vende en las calles de Managua cosméticos y ropa interior y Silvia Lorena B. Gonzales distribuye ropa y cosméticos.

Ellas desde muy tempranas horas se preparan para salir y regresan hasta ya muy tarde a sus casas rendidas por las caminatas por el sol y el calor incesante de Nicaragua. Pero al ver a sus hijos saben que es por su bienestar que lo hacen y por ellas mismas.
texts.en:
Marisela del Socorro M. Chavarría, María Dolores G. and Silvia Lorena B. Gonzales make up the group Guayacan. They are three female entrepreneurs, fighters, and hard workers. Miss Marisela del Socorro M. Chavarría has been selling cosmetics, creams, and perfumes door-to-door for eight years in addition to having her own sewing shop. In the same way María Dolores G. Carballo sells cosmetics and underwear on the streets of Managua and Silvia Lorena B. Gonzales distributes clothing and cosmetics. From the early hours of the day the women prepare themselves to go out and work and they return to their houses exhausted from the long walks in the sun and the incessant heat of Nicaragua. But upon seeing their children, they know that what they do is for their wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as makeup and lipstick

loans.name: Manuel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Ángel N. y su esposa la señora Mayra Patricia Sandoval son padres de tres pequeños hijos.
Tiene poco tiempo que adquirieron su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le está haciendo falta algunos detalles, pero el desea  poner las protecciones para más seguridad. En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el sé dedica a la herrería y  se encargara de  realizar las protecciones en horario adicional a su trabajo, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder abitar el patrimonio de su familia. 
Don Manuel Ángel es empleado de una taller de soldaduras en el departamento de diseño con una parte de este ingreso pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel Ángel N. and his wife, señora Mayra Patricia Sandoval, are the parents of three children. A little while ago, they acquired their house through a government credit, but it is lacking some finishing touches. He hopes to put protection on the doors and windows to have more security. Right now he doesn't have the money to buy the material. Since he does iron work, he will take care of putting the protection on in addition to his usual work. This is why he is requesting a loan to be able live in their family's asset. Don Manuel Ángel is an employee in a welding shop in the design department. He will pay back the credit with part of his income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put protecion on the windows and doors of his home

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
La señora LIGIA MARIA S. A. tiene a su cargo sus dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar, ella es madre soltera, ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante seis años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 7 créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que reside, con el fin de darle un mejor estilo de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Señora Ligia Maria S. A. cares for her two children who are school-aged. She is a single mother and has worked with Ceprodel for six years. In this time, she has managed to improve her living conditions with the seven credits she has had with them. She will invest the requested credit in the purchase of construction materials to replace the roof on her home where she lives. Her goal is to give her family a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to replace the roof on the house where she lives

loans.name: Las Del Barrio Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las del Barrio” está conformado por cinco mujeres muy valiosas, trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras. Una de ellas es   Suyen Q. quien vende cosméticos y cajetas de leche, de coco y piñonate.

Karla C. tiene una fritanga. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena. 

 Jaqueline del Socorro G. desde muy temprano sale a vender ropa de todo tipo, Tania Ninoska tiene su propio taller de costura donde confecciona trajes de gala y ropa de camas y Araely Galeno hace y vende tortillas y productos lácteos como cuajadas, queso, crema….etc.
texts.en:
The group, "Las del Barrio," is made up of five very valuable, hard-working, enterprising, and motivated women. One of them is Suyen Q., who sells cosmetics and milk and coconut candies and pastries. Karla C. sells fried food, which she prepares by putting them on the grill. Usually people buy this food for dinner. Jaqueline del Socorro G. sells all sorts of clothing starting very early in the morning. Tania Ninoska has her own sewing shop where she makes formal suits and linens. Araely Galeno makes and sells tortillas and dairy products like curd, cheese, cream, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics like foundations, lipsticks, and blush

loans.name: Esa

texts.en: Mrs. Esa P. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, is married, and is blessed with five adult children. Esa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years, earning 1,800 PHP net monthly income. In 2006, Esa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Esa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El socio DOMINGO pertenece al banco comunal “VILCANOTA”. 

El socio, tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos tres son varones y dos son mujeres. Los hijos ya son independientes.   


El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, el tiene una pequeña empresa de Imprenta. Ya son veinte y siete años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestro socio es una persona responsable, trabajadora y emprendedora. El socio requiere el préstamo para la comprar insumos y materiales para imprenta como tintes, papel, etc.  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
. DOMINGO, 65, is a member of the "VILCANOTA" communal bank. He is married and has five children: three boys and two girls. All the children are independent. He lives in Urubamba province which is north of the city of Cusco. He has had a small print shop for 27 years and has done very well by it thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He is a responsible, hard-working and enterprising person. He needs financing to buy supplies and materials for his print shop such as dyes, paper, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity afforded by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy print shop supplies like inks, paper, etc.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Mrs. Cristy O. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, is married, and is blessed with two infant children. Cristy owns and operates a business selling of RTW's (Ready-To-Wear clothes) in the local community. In 2006, Cristy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used for house extension. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for house extension

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca D. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a business planting and harvesting cassava for sale, earning an income of 3,000 Php more or less. Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her cassava plantation

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa P. is from the village of Guinabot. She is 28 years old. Marisa is married and has one young child. To make a living, Marisa sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and food snacks in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500 PHP from PMPC. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Marisa's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ketty Gouvani

texts.es:
Ketty Gouvani M. S., comenzo hace 12 años vendiendo ceramicas, sus ventas disminuyeron en un 90%, lo cual la obligo a cambiar de actividad, como la venta de frutas, pues su familia tiene en el campo cultivos de naranja, mandarina, banano y platano. Por ejemeplo ella invierte US$ 100 en frutas y obtiene como ganancia US$ 80. Su esposo es chofer y le ayuda con las ventas en el sector donde vive. Ketty tiene dos hijos de 18 y 13 años respectivamente.
 
Con el prestamo planea comprar semillas para cultivar arroz, maiz y compar naranaja, mandarina, banano y platanos. Cuando tiene tiempo libre se dedica a realizar ciertas ceremicas.
texts.en:
Ketty Gouvani M. Sánchez began selling ceramics 12 years ago. Her sales went down by 90%, which caused her to have to change her business to fruit sales. In the countryside her family has oranges, tangerines, bananas, and plantains. For example, she pays $100 for fruit and then makes a profit of $80. Her husband is a driver and he helps her with sales in the neighborhood where they live. With the loan she plans to buy seeds to plant rice and corn and to buy oranges, tangerines, bananas, and plantains. When she has free time she makes a few types of ceramics.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, insecticides, and fruits

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia MARUJA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de frazadas que son traídos de la ciudad de Marangani de la provincia de Sicuani. Nuestra socia por las mañanas trabaja de secretaria en la UGEL de Urubamba y por las tardes alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de frazadas. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como frazadas así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARUJA, 44, is a member of the "Vilcanota" communal bank. She is married and has two children. She and her children live in Urubamba province, which is located north of the city of Cusco. She has a small shop where she sells blankets that come from the city of Marangani, Sicuani province. During the mornings she is employed at Urubamba's UGEL (Local Peruvian public shool) and during afternoons she alternates her household chores with blanket sales. She has been in this line of work for several years now and has done very well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising mother that wants to see her children get ahead. She requires financing to buy merchandise like blankets to increase her stock inventory so that her earnings will be increased and thus provide a better quality of life for her children.
