The members of the Gouye Gui Group are some very dynamic women, whose business is buying and selling fish. Most of their husbands are fishermen and when they come back from the sea they give some of the caught fish to the wives so that they can manage the daily household. The women use their revenue to reinforce their business, buying other fish products, so that they can achieve some independence from their husbands.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fishing

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru: Курбонов Собир проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 23 года. Разведен, детей не имеет. Собир более 3 лет предоставляет услугу маршрутного такси. В данный момент он купил автомашину, но денег не хватило и поэтому Собир просит кредит для доплаты и ремонта купленной автомашины.
texts.en:
K. Sobir lives in Dushanbe City. He's twenty-three years old, divorced and has no children. Sobir has been a taxi driver for more than three years. He recently bought a new car, but did not have enough money, so he is asking for a loan to complete his payment and repair the car he purchased.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete a payment and repair a car

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Буриев Хуршед проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 21 год. Холост. Хуршед более 3 лет занимается перевозками, т.е. предоставляет услуги маршрутного такси по городу Душанбе. Кредит просит для ремонта своей автомашины, т.к. этот вид услуги является единственным источником дохода. На полученную прибыль хочет сыграть свою свадьбу.
texts.en:
Hurshed B. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 21 years old. Unmarried. For over 3 years Hurshed has been in the transportation business, i.e. he provides minibus taxi services in Dushanbe. He is requesting the loan to fix his minibus, as the taxi service is his only source of income. With the profits he makes he wants to have a wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Mariam S., age 35, is a widow with two children, ages 17 and 11 years old. She has a small charcoal store, retail shop and video showplace. She opened the business in 2008 and works long daily hours from 6 am until 10 pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $113.

This will be Mariam’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to open the retail shop and the video showplace businesses, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes to get a loan to open a cafe and start selling milk and bites.

Mariam will share this loan with her 15 member group, "Sarafina". They hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. In the photo, Mariam is third from the right in an orange dress with shining beads in her hair.

loans.use: To open a cafe and start selling milk and bites

loans.name: Phang

texts.en: Phang S. was born in 1959 and is a good mother to six children. Three of them are married and live independently and the other three are single. To help support the family, almost all of the children are working in a variety of occupations. Phang S. is a rice trader who earns around $3.50 a day to manage her family. She always buys rice in bulk from farmers who bring their rice to sell directly to her at her house. Her husband plants rice as well as raises pig at home. This rice-harvesting season, Phang S. is applying for a loan as capital to order mature rice to sell and raise her income.

loans.use: To order rice to sell

loans.name: Nao

texts.en: Mr. Nao K., 50, is a low-income ox-trader living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He always leaves home to buy oxen at reasonable prices from rural farmers and sells out after he fattens them for a week or a month. Nao K. is married and has three school-aged children. The children also work on the farm, while his wife stays at home to cultivate a rice crop. Nao K. would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to buy more oxen during the time when oxen command the cheapest price. He will sell them for a profit when the price is the highest.

loans.use: To buy more oxen

loans.name: Phân

texts.en: Mr. Phân S. was married years ago and his marriage has resulted in three children who are employed at different jobs. He has been working in construction since 2007. Phân S. has the skills to build local houses by hand using wooden housing materials. His wife has been cultivating a rice crop for years. Phân S. built his new house years ago, but his house is still not complete due to a lack of money.  He is, therefore, applying for a US$700 loan from HKL to be used to finish building his new house.

loans.use: To finish building his new house

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van S. A. is a military policeman who has been working since 2004. He now cares for a lovely young child who is enrolled in primary school. To help be responsible for their family, his wife works as a garment worker.  Van S. A. and his family face difficulties with their living situation, because their existing house is too old and often breaks down. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to pay a bill for repairing his old house.

loans.use: To pay a bill for repairing his house

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S. is a married man who has been working as a trailer-taxi driver for five years. He typically makes around $5 a day to help support his family’s daily living expenses. His wife works sewing clothes for a factory and also stays at home to either do housework or take care of children. This couple has two kids who are employed in the garment industry. Phan S. is taking out his first loan to pay the cost of having a new electricity line installed and repair his old bathroom.

loans.use: To have a new electricity line installed and to repair his old bathroom

loans.name: Lina

texts.pt:
Lina nasceu em Gaza tem 47 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 27 aos 12 anos, os três mais novos é que vão a Escola. Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue por mês poupar 1.500.00MT.
 Lina sai de Gaza para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Swazilândia com o seu irmão mais velho este que era trabalhador dos Regis to civil naquele distrito. Chegado a Namaacha ingressa a Escola, no mesmo ano fica grávida do seu esposo e teve que interromper os estudos porque na altura era proibido estudar nesse estado. Casa se com o seu marido e cinco dias depois este abandona­a emigrando se para a África do Sul, deixou uma carta que só foi descoberta 6 meses depois alegando que ia a procura de emprego ate então. A vida fica difícil ela pede ajuda ao irmão e este arranja um emprego para ela no Regis to Civil como servente onde trabalha durante 5 anos. Após findar o contracto, junta se com o actual marido este que passou a vier com ela em sua casa. Com o fundo colectado no serviço ela inicia o seu próprio negócio de venda de capulanas adquirida em maputo e revendia na swazilândia. O seu negócio foi crescendo e já não conseguia satisfazer a necessidades dos clientes, então aproxima a hluvuku e kiva solicitando um empréstimo pela quarta vez para aumentar o stock de mercadoria. Hoje tem como melhor produto (lençóis, mantas, duvetes e cortinas) adquirido a 400.00MT, a 500.00MT, a 350.00MT e revende a 1000.00MT, a 1250.00MT, e a 600mt consecutivamente. Tem tido um lucro mensal de 8.000.00MT. 

Este é o quarto empréstimo de lina na hluvuku e segundo com kiva. o  primeiro de 11.000.00MT foi para comprar diversos tipos de roupas tais como (blusas, lençóis, duvetes, mantas, calças e cortinas),o segundo de 15.500.00MT foi para aumentar o volume de mercadoria, o terceiro de 20.000.00MT foi usado para ampliar  a obra da  sua cozinha que já esta quase concluída. Estes 25.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume dos seus negócios. Está construindo boutique, pois a idade já não ajuda para fazer entraga domiciliaria.
texts.en:
Lina was born in Gaza and is 47. She lives with her husband and her four children whose ages range between 12 and 27. The three youngest go to school. She isn't responsible financially for anyone else and saves 1,500 meticais a month.

Lina left Gaza for the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland with her oldest brother, who was working for the registry office in that district. When she arrived to Namaacha, she enrolled in school. In that same year, she became pregnant and had to stop studying because at that time it wasn't allowed to go to school while pregnant. She got married, and five days later, her husband abandoned her and left for South Africa. He left a letter that she only discovered 6 months later claiming that he was going to look for a job. Her life was difficult, so she asked her brother for help, and he got her a job at the registry office where she worked for 5 years. After she finished her contract, she married her current husband who now lives with her in her home. With the money she made from her job, she started her own business selling capulanas (robes/dresses) which she acquired in Maputo and resold in Swaziland. Her business has grown and she can't satisfy her customers' demand anymore. She is turning to Hluvuku and Kiva for her fourth loan so she can increase her stock of merchandise. Today she has better products (sheets, blankets, duvets, pants, and curtains). She buys these items for 400, 500, and 350 meticais and resells them for 1,000, 1250, and 600 meticais. She makes a monthly profit of 8,000 meticais.

This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. Her first one was for 11,000 meticais to buy various types of clothing like blouses, sheets, duvets, blankets, pants, and curtains). Her second one was for 15,500 meticais to increase her volume of merchandise. Her third was for 20,000 meticais to expand her kitchen, which is now complete. This one is for 25,000 meticais, which she will use to increase the volume of her business. She is building a boutique because at her age she doesn't want to make deliveries to people's homes anymore.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell clothing and other textiles

loans.name: Salome

texts.pt:
Salomé nasceu em Gaza tem 44 anos de idade, é solteira mãe de 2 filhas com idades compreendidas entre os 23 aos 25 anos, nenhuma das duas encontra se a estudar, pois trabalham todas juntas. Para alêm das suas filhas responsabiliza se pelos seus 4 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Salomé estudou ate a 4ª classe porque onde frequentava só terminava naquele nível de escolaridade, então seu professor leva a ela alegando que ia arranjar uma vaga numa outra Escola e este abusa dela (estupro) e a engravida. Salomé fica desesperada com a situação e a sua mãe manda lhe embora de casa. Sai de Gaza para vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Swazilândia com sua amiga a procura de emprego. Chegado a Namaacha começa a trabalhar no Governo do Distrito como servente, mas devido à doença do século (SIDA) ela teve que abandonar o emprego porque a descriminavam no seu sector de trabalho. Os anos foram passando Salomé começa a trabalhar com plantas de varias espécies tais como, (azaléias, antores e catos), pois são fáceis de multiplicar e ela tem muito jeito para jardinagem e cultiva um lindo jardim em sua casa. Hoje é uma das mais famosas da região, vendendo flores ate para pessoas da capital Maputo ganhando por mês aproximadamente 8.000.00MT porque para além de vender ela tem contratos de jardinagem com proprietários de quintas na vila e na cidade de Maputo. Por mês consegue poupar uma média de 2.000.00MT.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Salome na Hluvuku e Kiva. O primeiro de  15.000.00MT foi usado para comprar plantas e pesticidas para melhorar a sua coleção de flores,este segundo de 10.000.00MT será usado para aumentar as plantas e a multiplicação das outras. Esta confiante que vai melhorar muito no seu negócio e deste modo reembolsar sem nenhum problema, pois conta com ajuda das suas duas filhas.
texts.en:
Salome was born in Gaza she is 44 years old and is single, she has 2 daughters who are 23 and 25 years old, neither of them are studying, because they work together. Besides her daughters Salome supports her grandchildren who live with her. Salome studied until the 4th grade because at her school that was the last grade available, then her teacher took her saying they were going to get a space available at another school and he abused of her (raped her) and she got pregnant. Salome was desperate with the situation and her mother sends her away. She left Gaza to live in Namaacha at the frontier with Swazilandia with a friend to try to get a job. When she arrived to Namaacha she started working at the Government District as a maid, but due to the illness of the century (AIDS) she had to leave the job because she was discriminated at her work place. With time Salomen started working with plants several species like (azaleas, antores and catos), because they are easy to multiply and she has a very good hand for gardening, she has a beautiful garden. Today she is one of the most famous gardeners in the region, she sells flowers even for people in the capital and is able to get an income of 2.000MT. This is the second loan for Salome from Hluvuku and Kiva. The first one of 15.000MT was used to buy plants and pesticides to improve her flower collection, this second loan for 10.000MT is to increase the plants and produce more. She is confident she will improve a lot her business and this way she will pay without any problem because she counts with her daughters help.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sales of plants and flowers and gardening

loans.name: Ka

texts.en: Ka N., 34, is a married woman and the mother of four school-aged children. To earn a living, she retails fish that she buys in bulk and normally earns $4 per day. Ka N. and her husband always quickly wake up in the morning to go where there are many fishermen, to buy fish, and then bring them to sell at retail at the market. Ka N. said that she faces a big problem with transportation because her vehicle has broken down, which affects her ability to transport her fish to the market. Therefore, she decided to look for a loan to buy a new vehicle to replace the old broken one.

loans.use: To replace a broken vehicle

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.pt:
Olímpia J. nasceu na Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da suazilândia tem 35 anos de idade, é viúva mãe de uma rapariga de 23 anos de idade já casada. Para alêm da sua filha responsabiliza se pela sua neta e pelas suas 2 sobrinhas que vivem com ela em sua casa. Consegue por mês poupar 1.000.00MT.

Olímpia J. quando perde o pai teve que emigrar para a África do Sul devido à guerra, inicia com os estudos e faz a 5ª classe. Anos depois teve que regressar a sua terra natal e recomeça de novo com os estudos e quando frequentava a 7ª classe esta fica grávida e consequentemente seu marido perde a vida e isso causa um conflito familiar devido à herança ela decide voltar para casa dos pais.  Começa a praticar pequenos negócios com o fundo da indminizaçao do seu falecido esposo vendendo tomate na esquina perto da sua casa no período da manhã e no período da tarde ia a Escola. 
Através do pequeno negócio consegue reabilitar a casa da sua mãe e constrói a sua própria casa e pequeno estabelecimento comercial no mesmo quintal onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tais como (arroz, cebola, batata, amendoim, sapatos e chinelos) adquiridos na suazilândia gastando uma média de 5.000.00MT em cada viagem e tendo de lucro no valor de 8.000.00MT.


Este é o quarto empréstimo de Olímpia na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. O primeiro de 5.000.00MT foi usado para concluir mínimas partes da barraca, o segundo de 10.000.00MT para manter o volume dos seus produtos, o terceiro de 15.000.00MT para aumentar o stock dos produtos e este quarto de 20.000.00MT serão usados para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir uma boutique para venda de sapatos e chinelos separando com os produtos comestíveis.
texts.en:
Olimpia J. was born in the village of Namaacha in the frontier with Suazailandia, she is 35 years old and is a widow, she has a daughter who is already 23 years old and is married. Besides her family, she supports her granddaughter and two nieces who live with her at home. She gets an income of 1.000MT Whem Olimpia J. lost her father she had to move to South Africa due to war, she studied until the 5th grade. Years later she had to go back to her hometown and started studying again and when she was on the 7th grade she got pregnant, soon after her husband lost his life which created a family conflict due to the inheritance, so she decided to return to her parents house. She started a small business with the indemnity money of her late husband, selling tomatoes in the corner of her house in the morning and at he school in the afternoon. Because of her small business she was able to re-built her mother's house and to build her own and a small commercial store where she sells other products of first necessity like (rice, onion, potatoes, peanuts, shoes and sandals) that she buys in Suazilandia, she spends an average of 5.000MT on each trip and is able to get an income of 8.000MT. This is her 4th loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. The first was for 5,000MT and it was used to finish few places in her house, the second for 10.000MT was used to keep the volume of her products, the third of 15.000MT was to increase her stock of merchandise and the 4th of 20.000MT will be use for the same. She is confident she will be able to pay before the due date and will be able to request another loan to build a boutique to sell shoes and sandals separate from the grocery products.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell sandals, rice, flour, peanuts and other grocery products

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.pt:
Erasmo nasceu na vila de namaacha na fronteira da suazilandia tem 32 anos de idade vive maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 6 a 9 anos, todos vão à escola. Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue por mês poupar 2.000.00MT, porque conta com ajuda de 4 empregados.

Erasmo apos concluir o ensino médio (12 classe) não consegue ingressar na faculdade e com ajuda do seu pai que é um grande agricultor, deu lhe uma parte de terra e ele inicia com a pratica de agricultura. A primeira cultura lançada foi o morango, mas porque ele tinha falta de um sistema de rega (gota a gota) que facilita nos regadios para a diversificação das culturas, ele aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00MT para aumentar o volume de produção de mais culturas.

Anos depois sai da casa dos seus pais alegando que vivia longe da sua machamba e que sofria roubos frequentes, então passa a viver numa vivenda abandonada que foi dos seus avos. Tem como melhor produto o (feijão verde, repolho, tomate e pepinos) gastando uma media de 35.000.00MT e tendo de lucro 50.000.00MT quando tem vendido a kilo e de 65.000.00MT quando tem vendido a grosso, pois não tem muitos gastos e assegura que as culturas cheguem a bom estado.   

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Erasmo na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva, o primeiro de 25.000.00MT foi usado para comprar um sistema de rega gota a gota e sementes para a machamba, o segundo de 45.000.00MT foi usado para aplicar na machamba, mas não teve muito sucesso devido à falta de água e estes 25.000.00MT serão usados para o mesmo fim, está confiante que vai pagar antes do prazo determinado e pedir um outro empréstimo para construção de um armazém de luz difusa para armazenamento da semente da batata para fornecer semente ao nível do distrito.
texts.en:
Erasmo was born in the village of Nammacha in the frontier of Suazilandia, he is 32 years old and lives with his wife and they have two children who are 6 and 9 years old, they all go to school. He is not responsible for anyone besides her family and gets an income of 2.000MT because he has the help of four employees. After finishing middle school (12 grade) Erasmo wasn't able to get into college and with his father's help who is a great farmer, and gave Erasmo a piece of his land, he started farming. His first produce was strawberry but because he didn't have any irrigation system (drop by drop) which enables diversification of produce, he contacted Hluvuku requesting a loan for 25.000MT to increase the volume of production. Years later this is his 3rd loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva, his first of 25.000MT was used to buy an irrigation system drop by drop for seeds of his farm, the second of 45.000MT was used for the farm, but wasn't very successful due to the lack of water and this new one for 25.000MT will be used for the same, he is confident he will be able to pay in the determined period of time and request another loan to build a warehouse of diffuse light to store potatoes seeds to provide seeds at district level.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production of strawberry and other produce

loans.name: Lep

texts.en: Lep A., 47, is a married woman and the mother of a child who is newly married and has started a new home. To help feed the family, Lep A. owns a medium boat that she uses to transport a few grocery items to sell to people who live along the river. Her husband helps her sell the inventory. To earn extra income, Lep A. will be using her loan to buy a larger amount of fresh fish, which she will turn into fish paste and sell. This will provide her with more income and a comfortable living.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to make fish paste

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida R. manages her “ balut” (chicken embryo vending business) in the village of Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. She is married to Eduardo R., and having six children to support. All of her children are presently enrolled in a public school in their village. Being a supportive mother, she needs to work hard in order to sustain their family needs especially in providing the daily allowances and tuition fees of their children.

From her experiences, she knows that sending her children in school is difficult if she doesn’t have an extra source of income. For over three years, she has been engaged in selling balut and she earns an income of PHP 1,000 a week. This business helps her provide her children’s tuition payments during their examinations. When she needs financial assistance, she goes house to house to sell balut in order to sustain the needs of her family.

At present she has insufficient funds for maintaining her vending business. She is now asking from the KIVA lenders the loan amount of 7,000 PHP to buy more items to sell and to run her business to become productive and also to uplift their living condition.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Gertrudis Ramona

texts.es: La señora Gertrudis Ramona  tiene 53 años, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad. Ella tiene 21 años de dedicarse a la venta de pan, los cuales vende por encargos de forma ambulante. Ella empezó hace mucho tiempo con este negocio, sin embargo en ese tiempo era con capital ajeno, después se fue haciendo su propio negocio con capital propia y hasta los momentos logro trabajar por cuenta propia. Su negocio nace debido a la necesidad de empleo que actualmente acoge a nuestro país. Ahora cuenta con una gran variedad de clientes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de leña, azúcar, aceite, huevo,  ya que actualmente tiene bastantes pedidos que le permitirán incrementar sus ganancias. Su sueño siempre ha sido mejorar su nivel de vida y de los familiares que con ella conviven.
texts.en:
Gertrudis Ramona is 53, single, and has two grown children. For 21 years she has been selling bread. She sells orders door-to-door. She started this business a long time ago. At that time she used other people’s capital, and then she was making her own business with her own capital. She has now been able to work for herself. Her business was born out of the need to work, which is currently well received in our country. She now has a great variety of customers. The loan is to buy firewood, sugar, oil, and eggs. She now has plenty of orders, which will allow her to increase her earnings. Her dream has always been to improve the quality of life for the family that lives with her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Meth

texts.en: Mrs. Meth S., 42, sells dried fish and earns about $4 a day. She is a widow who takes care of four children, one of whom contributes about $2 a day to the family by working in the garment factory. The rest of the children are students and they help her in make the dried fish. She now lives with her children in the Bei Village in the Chrung Chumres I Sangkat in Phnom Penh City. Because of her business, she can help her children go to school and pay her family’s living expenses. She now needs her second loan of $1000 to buy a new motorcycle to replace a broken one. With a new motorbike, she will upgrade her business transportation to be more efficient.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to replace a broken one

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia G. is from the village of Divisoria. She is 48 years old, is widowed, and has three adult children. Nelia owns and operates a business making and selling food. She has been engaged in her business for over a year. Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Baby Consolacion

texts.en:
Baby Consolacion D. V., from the village of Divisoria, is 44 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Baby Consolacion owns and operates a recycling business whose income derives primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Engaged in her business for a year, she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Baby Consolacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 10000 PHP, her fourth, to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients consists mainly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana tiene 43 años de edad, es casada vive con su hijos en su casa de sus padres. Ella tiene amplia experiencia en el negocio de alquiler de mototaxis, su esposo de Ana se encuentra en el extranjero el cual le envía remesas para los gastos de la manutención y de educación de sus hijos, la cual le permitio comprar una mototaxi con ahorros producto de las remesas, ahora posee 3 unidades. Ana no tiene su vivienda ya que se destruyo con el terremoto  por ese motivo es que se encuentra viviendo en casa de sus padres.Ana destina todos los ingresos tanto de alquiler de sus mototaxis y remesas para la educación de sus hijas las cuales se encuentran en la universidad y el menor en primaria, Ana sueña con ver graduarse a sus hijas y así también su menor hijo y poder construir su casa y así poder brindarle seguridad y bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and married; she lives with her children in her parents' house. She has extensive experience in the business of renting moto-taxis (motorcycles with an attached cab for passengers). Ana's husband is currently abroad, and he sends remittances to pay the expenses of maintaining and educating his children. Thanks to the savings from these funds, Ana was able to buy a moto-taxi, and she now has 3 vehicles. She is not able to live in her own house, since it was destroyed by an earthquake, and that is why she is currently living in her parents' home. Ana dedicates all of her available income, both from the remittances and the rental of her moto-taxis, to her children's education; her daughters are university students, and her youngest son is in primary school. Ana dreams of seeing her daughters and her youngest son graduate, and she also dreams of being able to rebuild her house and thus provide security and well-being to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her home

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita C., from the village of Divisoria, is 48 years old, widowed, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a business venture whose income derives primarily from vending food. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 9000 PHP, her ninth, to purchase additional products to sell and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mainly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sop

texts.en: Sop L. has a recycling business and earns an average of $3 each day to help cover her family’s living expenses. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with two teenage children. One of her daughters helps support the family by selling a few cakes. Sop L. is married to Sman Yass, 49 years of age, who earns a living selling ice-cream for pupils. Sop L. requests a loan to allow her husband to buy more equipment for his ice-cream business.

loans.use: To buy equipment for an ice-cream business

loans.name: Lourdes Eugenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Ana se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca, está integrado  por mujeres de varias edades pero todas ellas con un fin común que es sobresalir con su familia, así tenemos a la señora Lourdes Gañan que  fue socia hace cuatro años pero se retiro porque estuvo con planes de viajar al exterior que se canceló por varios motivos y con los créditos obtenidos logró pagar sus deudas, regresó luego de tres años a su banco comunal y hace dos años  es socia activa del mismo, ella  vive en el barrio Los Laureles en la parroquia Santa Ana, tiene 25 años está casada y es  madre de dos niños de   7 y 1 año, su hijo mayor estudia en la escuela Alfonso María Borrero en su comunidad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y con el esfuerzo conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

Lourdes trabaja desde hace cuatro meses de lunes a viernes en el bar de la escuela de Santa Bárbara, y en su restaurant la tarde de viernes y todo el sábado y domingo desde hace dos meses en un local arrendado en el sector Bella Unión, además se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, los pollos los consume en su propio negocio y para la venta a sus vecinos de la comunidad.

Nuestra socia está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en su restaurant en la compra de ollas grandes,  vajilla y una cocina ya que todo el menaje de cocina es prestado por su mamá.

Su meta es llegar agrandar su restaurant y ponerse una sucursal.
texts.en:
The Santa Ana Communal Bank was established in the city of Cuena and is composed of women of various ages with a common goal of helping their families succeed. Lourdes Gañan was a member of this group but left four years ago because she had intentions to travel abroad. However, her plans were canceled and she used her loans to pay off debts that she acquired. Three years ago, she returned to the Communal Bank and has been active member for the past two years. Lourdes lives in the neighborhood of Los Laureles in the Santa Ana Parrish. She is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children (ages 7 and 1). Her oldest child attends the Alfonso María Borrero School in the community. Her husband works as a bricklayer and together they built their own home.

Four months ago, Lourdes started working Monday through Friday at a school snack bar in Santa Bárbara. She established her restaurant two months ago and is open Friday evenings and all day Saturday and Sunday. It is located in a rented facility in the Bella Unión district. Lourdes also raises chickens and pigs. The chickens are consumed in her business and also sold to neighbors in the community.

Lourdes is requesting a new loan to purchase pots, dishes, and a stove for her restaurant. Her mother has already provided her with kitchenware. Her goal is to expand her business and open a second location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pots, dishes, and a stove

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia SONIA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 32 años de edad, es soletera, no tiene hijos. La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia es docente del nivel primario de la escuela “Palcaraqui” de Urubamba. Ella tiene un pequeña negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Nuestra socia ofrece los productos de belleza de casa en casa llevando a la mano el catalogo de los productos de belleza. Ella inicio su negocio ofreciendo a sus amigas y parientes y con el transcurrir de los años su negocio empezó a crecer. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere progresar y ser actualizando como profesora. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como  aretes, collares, pulseras, ropa para estas fiestas navideñas así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Member Sonia belongs to the community bank “Vilcanota”. The member is 32 years old, single, and without children. The member lives in the province of Urubamba which is located north of the city of Cusco. She is a primary level teacher at the “Palcaraqui” school of Urubamba. She has a small business selling beauty products. Our member offers beauty products door-to-door carrying a catalog of the beauty products. She started her business offering to her friends and relatives and with the passing of years her business started to grow. It has been several years that she’s worked and she is very grateful for all the effort that she puts in her work. Our member is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who wants to progress and become a professor. She needs the loan to buy merchandise such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and clothing for Christmas parties. Then she will be able to increase her business capital and have a bigger income and a better quality of life. She finds herself very thankful for the opportunity presented by means of this method and for her part she promises to complete her payment corresponding to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and clothing for Christmas parties

loans.name: Elizabeth Macedonia

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 31 años de edad, es casada vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Ella tiene amplia experiencia en el negocio de alquiler de mototaxis, Elizabeth comenzó con una unidad la cual compro con ahorros, ahora posee 2 unidades de las cuales una de ellas la maneja su esposo. Elizabeth con los ingresos que tiene por el alquiler de las mototaxis construyo una parte de su casa la cual se destruyo con el terremoto. Ella ahorra al máximo el dinero que obtiene de las mototaxis, el cual le ayuda para la educación de hijo. El sueño a futuro de Elizabeth es que su hijo logre terminar sus estudios en la universidad y poder culminar con la construccion de su casa. Solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para una de las motos y para el registro de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 31 years old. She is married and lives in her own home along with her son. She has extensive experience in the business of renting moto-taxis (motorcycles with an attached cab for passengers). Elizabeth began with one vehicle, which she purchased from her savings. She now has two vehicles, one of which is driven by her husband. With the income she receives from her moto-taxi business, she has rebuilt part of her home, which was destroyed by an earthquake. She saves as much money as possible from her earnings from the moto-taxis, which helps her pay for her son's education. Elizabeth's dream for the future is that her son will be able to complete his studies with a university degree and that she will be able to finish rebuilding her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase tires for one of the moto-taxis and to register her vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her vehicles and paying vehicle registration fees

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is a 36-year-old married woman with three school-age children, living in the village of San Manuel. To make a living, Julieta operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector; indeed, she operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling chicharron to the local community, using her tricycle for transportation. Julieta has been engaged in her business for several years, and she explains that she earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.

Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services so that she would be able to engage in business activities. In turn, she hoped to improve her living situation. Julieta is now requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP ($250), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches, covering the Central and Northeastern areas, and its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products for resale purposes

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
S. was born in 1986 and is a married mother blessed with a young child. She currently works sewing clothes in a factory and gets a stable salary of $90 a month. She was busy with her job when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

As another income source, S.’s husband has the skill of making wooden statues by hand and has been a local statue carver for years. S. saw that her husband’s carving business has provided her family with much income, so she hopes to upgrade this business to be more efficient by using a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To upgrade her husband's carving business

loans.name: Aurelia Robertina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Santa Ana se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia del mismo nombre, esta localidad se encuentra a 18km de la ciudad de Cuenca siendo su principal actividad económica la agricultura, dentro de sus atractivos turísticos tenemos el cerro de Mama  Tepal  que constituye un excelente mirador natural con una vista panorámica de sus alrededores, de la ciudad de Cuenca, parte de Azogues y de los ríos Quingeo y Chordeleg, su gente  cálida y siempre amable reciben al turista nacional y extranjero haciéndolo sentir como en casa. 

La señora Aurelia F. es socia activa del banco comunal Santa Ana,  tiene 60 años y vive en la parroquia del mismo nombre de su banco comunal  junto a su esposo,  sus tres hijos son adultos  y tienen su propia familia,  viven en la misma casa pero en diferentes departamentos  fruto del esfuerzo y sacrificio de todos los miembros de la familia, su cónyuge es negociante de ganado.

 Aurelia se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, sacrifica cerdos  para preparar sus ricos platos típicos como el  chancho ornado, sancocho, morcillas, etc., lleva veinte años en éste  negocio y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero siempre tiene un poco de ganancias, también cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su casa.

Trabaja con los préstamos que la fundación  otorga desde hace diez años invirtiendo en sus negocios, el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de canchos para engordarlos y sacrificarlos para la elaboración de sus platos.

Su meta es  ayudar a sus hijos que se establezcan económicamente y no tengan que pasar necesidades.
texts.en:
The Santa Ana Communal Bank is located in the parish of the same name. The town is 18km from the city of Cuenca. The main economic activity is agriculture. This area is known for its tourist attractions, such as Tepal Mama Hill, which has an excellent natural vantage point. There are also panoramic views of the city of Cuenca and part of Azogues, as well as of the Quingeo and Chordeleg Rivers. The people welcome both foreign and domestics tourists. Their warmth and friendliness allow visitors to feel at home.

Sra. Aurelia F. is an active member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She is 60 years old and lives in Santa Ana Parish with her husband. Their three children are adults with their own families. They all live under the same roof but assume different responsibilities and make sacrifices for the other family members. Her husband works as a cattle dealer.

Aurelia prepares and sells food. She butchers her own pigs for making savory dishes such as roasted pork, sancocho, blood sausage, etc. Aurelia has been in this business for 20 years and says that there are both good days and bad, but she always manages to earn a little bit of profit. She also operates a small grocery store inside her home.

Aurelia has been working with the Foundation for 10 years and used her loans to invest in her businesses. This new loan from Fundación ESPOIR will be used to purchase pigs for fattening and slaughter. The meat will be used in the preparation of her dishes. Her goal is to help her children establish themselves financially so that they lack nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs for use in her dishes

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora B. and her husband, who are blessed with four children, live in the village of Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. Leonora is engaged in the business of selling kitchen utensils. She explains that most of her customers are her neighbors and friends. In addition, Leonora raises and breeds pigs behind their backyard. Her husband, meanwhile, is a local tricycle driver in their village.

She is thankful because their businesses generate sufficient income to be able to support their everyday lives, but she really wants to expand her business. Thus, she decided to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225) from KIVA lenders, the proceeds of which she will use to buy more pillow cases and kitchen utensils to sell. She also plans to use a portion of the loan proceeds to purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.use: To expand her businesses by purchasing additional goods (for her sales business) and feed (for her pig-breeding business)

loans.name: Soy Nica Group

texts.es:
María Yolanda C., Luz Argentina y María Auxiliadora C.  conforman al grupo Soy Nica, cuyo nombre eligieron por estar orgullosas de su nacionalidad y del país tan bello en el que viven.
La señora C. tiene su propio taller de costura donde confecciona trajes para cualquier ocasión. En esta época del año ella tiene gran de manda por las festividades desde trajes de noche hasta uniformes es por esta razón que necesita con urgencia contar con capital para comprar los materiales como tela, hilos y zíper etc. 
María Auxiliadora C. tiene desde hace diez años su pulpería la cual en estos años ha ido creciendo. Mientras su compañera  Luz Argentina M. vende cosméticos desde hace seis años y desea a provechar está época que es cuando suben las ventas por las promociones y el ambiente de fiesta.
texts.en:
María Yolanda C., Luz Argentina, and María Auxiliadora C. make up the Soy Nica Group, whose name they chose because they are proud of their nationality and of the beautiful country in which they live.

Mrs. C. has her own seamstress shop where she makes dresses for all occasions. At this time of year there is great demand due to the festivities, for anything from evening dresses to uniforms. This is why she urgently needs to count on capital to buy materials such as cloth, thread, zippers, etc.

María Auxiliadora has for the last 10 years, operated a grocery store, which has grown lately. Meanwhile, her companion Luz Argentina has sold cosmetics for the last 6 years and wishes to take advantage of this season when sales increase, due to promotions and the festive atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SEWING SUPPLIES, GROCERIES, AND COSMETICS

loans.name: Pius Okoth

texts.en:
Pius Okoth is a 36-year-old married man and father of three children. He is married to Lucy, who is 32 years old. To earn a living, he is a poultry farmer, and he has been in this business for the last seven years, rearing predominantly broilers. In addition, he serves as a community nurse in a nearby medical clinic. He explains that he used his savings from the community nursing job to start his poultry business. His clients are cafe operators in Kisumu City, with whom he has signed contracts to supply them with poultry, thereby ensuring a steady market (and demand) for his poultry meat.

He is now seeking a second loan from KADET, the proceeds of which he plans to use to purchase additional chicks for rearing and to purchase poultry feed. He learned about KADET from a friend, who was an existing client. He aspires to further diversify his income sources by venturing into horticulture; you see, he lives next to a river, which he intends to use for irrigation.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. Specifically, KADET provides financial services to thereby improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additonal chicks and feed

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the village of San Manuel. She is 42 years old. Delia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Delia operates her husband's furniture manufacturing business.  They sell general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand their product offerings. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve their business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee is requesting its third loan. This group is made up of very hard working women, many of whom are single mothers. 

In this group, the loans are used for the individual businesses of the members which include: the recycling of paper; selling coal and plastics; buying ingredients for baked goods and pastries, such as the Paraguayan national “empanada”; fruits and vegetables to sell in their stores; the sale of cosmetics such as lipsticks, creams, shampoos and deodorants; the sale of candy; the sale of fabric for tailoring clothing, bedsheets and towels, skirts and shorts; the sale of herbs and remedies; and the sale of sausages and sweetmeats. 

One of the women in this committee, Juliana P., is 48 years old and has a remarkably inspiring story of her entrepreneurial success. She has three children, and is a single mother. She buys charcoal, and every morning loads it up on her cart to deliver around her area. She comes back home at lunch and then sets out in the afternoon to pick up recycling and sort it to sell. She is very patient and works hard to make a living to support her children.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: P. has been married for years and is blessed with two kids. P. is a garment factory worker who gets a salary of $7 each month. Her husband, Khun Samphors, 38 years old, drives a motorbike taxi. Recently, P.’s husband hasn't been able to earn as much income as before, because his taxi is too old and not attractive to the customer. Because of that, P. is requesting a loan of $1000 for her husband to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel G. de 43 años está casada con el señor Jorge Isacc Morales él es policía y su salario no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos. Es entonces que ella decide abrir su propio negocio y empieza a  vender ropa de esta manera contribuye en el hogar y es más independiente.  
Isabel invertirá el crédito la compra de mercadería de ropa tanto en trajes, pantalones, camisas, ropa de niño, ropa interior etc.
texts.en:
Isabel G. is 43 years old and married. Her husband, Jorge Isacc Morales, is a policeman and his salary is not sufficient to cover the expenses. This is why Isabel has decided to open her own business and begin to sell clothes to contribute to the household and to be more independent.

Isabel will invest this loan in buying clothes such as dresses, pants, shirts, children's clothes, underwear etc. for merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn R. is from the village of San Manuel. She is 39 years old. Jenelyn is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Jenelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store which sells chicharon (crispy pork snacks) to the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

Jenelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia CRISTINA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y es padre y madre para su hijo. La socia y su hijo viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de snack. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar  adelante a su hijo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, regalos para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the communal bank “Vilcanota”.

Cristina is 55 years old and is a single mother, so she acts as the father and mother for her son. She and her son live in the province of Urubamba which is located to the north of the city of Cusco. She has a small snack shop. She has already worked for several years and she has done very well thanks to all the effort she has put into her work. Cristina is a working mother and an enterprising woman who wants to keep going for her son. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as candies, cookies, sodas, and gifts for this Christmas holiday. In this way she will be able to increase her business' capital and have a bigger income so she can give her son a better quality of life.

Cristina is thankful for the opportunity provided through this loan and she promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as candies, cookies, sodas, and gifts for this Christmas holiday

loans.name: Martha Argentina

texts.es:
Martha Argentina S. de 58 años tiene desde 2002 una librería la cual ha ido surtiendo con la variedad de productos escolares como cuadernos, hojas de construcción, cartulinas, tijeras, lápices, lapiceros, borradores, tajadores, marcadores, colores, tarjetas y calcomanías entre otras cosas. 
Este modesto negocio es el único de su tipo en el barrio lo que le ayudado a su crecimiento además que la atención y los materias que comercializa.
texts.en:
Martha Argentina S. is 58 years old. Since 2002 she has had a bookshop which has been supplied with a variety of school products such as notebooks, construction paper, cards, scissors, mechanical pencils, erasers, pencil sharpeners, markers, crayons, and decals among other things.

This modest business is the only one of its kind in the neighborhood which is helping it grow with the attention and the materials she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and stationery

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion A. is from the village of San Manuel. She is 44 years old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Concepcion owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately $85 a month from this activity.

Concepcion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 9th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby chicks to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas operates a tricycle in his village in Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao, City. His transportation business enables him to earn a daily income to support his family, especially in providing the educational needs of his children. They live in a simple community where farming is the major source of income for most of the residents. 

Tomas would like to borrow 4,000 PHP. He intends to use it for the maintenance of his motorcycle, to create a safer operation, because it is their only source of income. Tomas believes that the loan will help his family financially. He strives very hard in order to uplift their family from their poor living situation to a more progressive life.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada vive con su esposo, sus hijos que ya no se encuentran viviendo con ellos. Juana tiene mas D. 6 años dedicandose a la venta D. pescados en un mercado D. la ciudad D. Ica, los cuales ofrece en un puesto propio. Lo adquirió con los ahorros producto D. la ventas y esfuerzo diario. En los años que lleva trabajando, Juana ya es muy conocida por muchísimas personas que acuden a su puesto D. venta por el buen trato que les brinda. Juana tiene el anhelo D. construir su casa por eso es que el poco dinero que le queda lo invierte en la compra D. materiales D. construcción. Por este motivo es que Juana solicita el crédito para invertir un su negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old and married. Her children no longer live at home. She has been selling fish from her own vending post at the Ica city market for the past 6 years. With her savings, she acquires inventory to sell every day. In all the years she has been working, Juana has become widely recognized for the excellent service she provides to the multitudes of people who visit her market stall.

She hopes to build a house, but she has little money available to purchase construction materials. For this reason, Juana is requesting a loan to invest in her business so that she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional capital to invest in her business

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita B. is from the village of San Luis Cauayan City. She is 42 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Emelita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 every four months from this activity.

Emelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Jamileth H., Ángela G. y Karla L. conforman al grupo Esperezan. Ellas eligieron este nombre porque aseguran que la esperanza es lo último que se pierde y ellas tienen muchos deseos, sueños y metas por cumplir.
La señora Jamileth H. tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de fresco, helado, choco bananos y cosméticos especialmente perfumes.  Mientras Ángela G. tiene una abarrotería en el mercado Oriental  y Karla Antonia L. vende gaseosas, jugos naturales, chiverías, cigarros y recargas claro y movistar    
Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios poder ver lo crecer y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jamileth H., Ángela G., and Karla L. make up the group “Esperanza” (Hope). They chose this name because hope is the last thing to die since they have many desires, dreams, and goals to accomplish.

Sra. Jamileth H. has a small business selling soft drinks, ice cream, chocolate-covered bananas, and cosmetics, especially perfumes. Meanwhile, Ángela G. has a grocery store at the Eastern Market. Karla Antonia L. sells sodas, natural juices, yogurts, cigarettes, and rechargeable phone cards with the Claro and Movistar cellular providers.

They are requesting a loan to invest in their businesses so that they can increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.en: The Jazmin committee is in its second cycle. It is maD. up of very hardworking women, many of whom are single mothers. In this group, the loans are used for the individual businesses of the members, which incluD.: the recycling of paper, coal and plastics, buying ingredients for baked goods and pastries, such as the Paraguayan national “empanada”, selling fruits and vegetables, or cosmetics such as lipsticks, creams, shampoos and deodorants, or candy, or fabric for tailoring clothing, or bedsheets and towels, or skirts and shorts, or herbs and remedies, or sausages and sweetmeats. They work hard to help each other and support one another, and organize food fairs and raffles to raise money.

loans.use: capital for various businesses

loans.name: Bilma Raquel

texts.es:
Bilma M. tiene 27 años es una de las socias jóvenes del banco comunal Santa Ana en la ciudad de Cuenca, vive en el barrio los Laureles en la  parroquia Santa Ana junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, ellos  estudian en la escuela La Consolación en la parroquia El Valle, su esposo trabaja como chofer de su propio bus, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada por su cuñada.

Bilma trabaja como consultora de belleza de las líneas Yanbal hace un año y Avon hace dos,  también se dedica  a la cría  de  chanchos y pollos que los vende a sus vecinos de la comunidad y sobre todo en  época de fiestas, nos comenta que le va bien en  sus negocios por lo que sabe administrar.


Lleva cinco años  trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación que le han beneficiado mucho para  comprar sus  animales y productos de belleza para incrementar su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir  en la compra  perfumes, cremas y más cosméticos para la época navideña así como alimentopara sus animales como maíz, afrecho, balanceado y vitaminas para su crecimiento.

Su gran  sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Bilma M. is 27 years old and one of the young members of the Santa Ana Communal Bank in the city of Cuenca. She lives in the Los Laureles neighborhood in Santa Ana Parrish with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 8. They are students at La Consolación School in El Valle Parrish. Her husband works as a bus driver with his own vehicle. They do not own a home, but they currently live in a house provided by her sister.

Bilma works as a beauty consultant and has been selling the Yanbal line of products for one year, and Avon products for two years. She also raises pigs and chickens to sell to neighbors in the community, especially during the holidays. Bilma says that all of her businesses have been doing well because she knows how to manage them.

She has been working with the Foundation for five years and has greatly benefited from the loans, which she used to buy animals and beauty products to grow her business. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, Bilma will purchase perfumes, crèmes, and additional cosmetics for the Christmas season. In addition, she will buy products to promote the growth of her animals such as corn, bran, nutritional feed, and vitamins. Her greatest dream is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell for Christmas & food for her animals

loans.name: Superación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Superación está conformado por Lucia H. quien desde hace cinco años vende cosméticos de forma ambulante, Xochil B. comercializa ropa y Meyling M. que distribuye ropa y cosméticos en empresas.
	
Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras de gran capacidad y con muchos deseos de auto superarse. Estas necesitan dinero para mejorar sus negocios, aumentar su productividad y generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The group “Superación” has three members. Lucia H. has been selling cosmetics door-to-door for five years. Xochil B. sells clothing. Meyling M. is a clothing and cosmetics distributor. These hardworking women have great ability and desire to overcome any obstacle. They are in need of a loan so that they can improve their businesses, increase their productivity, and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: María Milagros

texts.es:
La señora María Milagros T. R. es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y con deseos de seguir adelante. Ella tiene una pequeña miscelánea donde vende desde granos básicos, reposterías, refrescos, ropa, adornos hasta recargas y teléfonos.
Ella invertirá el préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería y nuevos productos de demanda.
texts.en:
Sra. María Milagros T. R. is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has the desire to succeed. She has a small general store where she sells basic grains, pastries, soft drinks, clothing, ornaments, mobile phones, and phone chargers.

She is requesting a loan so that she can acquire more merchandise and new products that are in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Miguel Alberto

texts.es: Miguel tiene 51 años D. edad, es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Miguel tiene amplia experiencia en L. apicultura (venta D. miel D. abeja). Miguel trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa L. cual le ayuda en el negocio, Miguel ofrece sus productos en su domicilio y en algunos clientes que tiene por L. zona. Miguel aprovecha cada cliente nuevo que llega a su negocio brindándole un buen producto y haciéndole conocer las bondades D. L. miel D. abeja, por eso es que cada vez llegan más clientes a su negocio. Miguel sueña con seguir construyendo su casa y que su hija concluya sus estudios universitarios. Miguel solicita el crédito para invertir en unas nuevas colmenas.
texts.en:
Miguel is 51 years old and lives with his wife and children. He has extensive experience as a beekeeper and in marketing his honey. His wife helps him with the business. Miguel sells his products from home and directly to some of his customers in the area. When new customers come by his business, Miguel takes the opportunity to proviD. them with a good product and educate them about the benefits of honey. As a result, he has more customers who return with repeat business. He dreams of continuing the construction of his house and seeing his daughter finish her university studies. Miguel is requesting a loan to invest in new beehives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in new beehives

loans.name: Cruz Mayita

texts.es:
Cruz Mayita Peñafiel forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Claveles que se reúnen en Portoviejo, Provincia de Manabí, aquí encontramos mujeres de diferentes edades juntas han  formado una gran confraternidad  y se apoyan para  que todas las socias  queden bien con los pagos a la Fundación Espoir.

Conversar con la señora Cruz fue muy agradable, ella está dedicada al comercio desde hace ocho  años  tiene un negocio de comida rápida  en un área recreativa  y muy concurrida  por grandes y chicos en la ciudad de Portoviejo;  Cruz se ha enfrentado a grandes desafíos en la vida pero ha logrado cosas buenas, todas las mañana se despierta muy optimista con el objetivo que le va ir bien en su negocio. Nuestra socia está casada desde hace algunos años y cuenta con el cariño de sus 9 hijos, el esposo se dedica a otra actividad pero le  acompaña y ayuda en el negocio.
 
La jornada empieza desde muy temprano en casa de Cruz  pues tiene que preparar los alimentos para tener todo listo  a las  cuatro e instalarse en su carreta  para atender a los clientes que llegan al lugar a saborear sus delicias como son las  empanadas y corviches elaborados a  base de verde, queso y pollo,  ella no descansa hasta terminar con todo lo preparado para esa tarde y noche por lo que regresa a su hogar a partir de las 8 de la noche. Este negocio es la pasión de Cruz no ha pensado cambiarlo y muchos menos dejarlo, con el ha logrado  dar estudio y estabilidad a su familia.

En esta ocasión Cruz está solicitando un crédito con el que va a  comprar sillas, mesas y productos como queso, plátanos y más para la elaboración de sus delicias.
texts.en:
Cruz Mayita Peñafiel is part of the communal bank, Los Clavelas, that meets in Portoviejo, Manabí Province. Here, we find women of all ages who together have formed a sisterhood and support network so that all the members meet their payments to the Fundación Espoir.

Speaking with Cruz was very pleasant. She has worked for eight years in a business selling fast food in a recreational area that is popular for both old and young in the city of Portoviejo. Cruz has met with great obstacles in her life, but has achieved good things. Every morning, she wakes up optimistic with the motivation to do well with her business. Our member has been married for many years and provides care for her 9 children. Her husband works in another job, but he helps with the business.

The day starts very early in Cruz’s house. She has to prepare the meals to have everything ready at four and prepare her cart to attend to customers who come there to savor her delicious foods such as empanadas and corviches made with green plantains, cheese and chicken. She doesn’t rest until she has finished all the preparation for the afternoon and night, when she returns home after 8pm. This business is Cruz’s passion. She has never considered changing it or leaving it. That which she earns gives her family stability and pays their studies.

Today, Cruz is asking for a loan with which she will buy chairs, tables and products such as cheese, plantains, and more to make her delicious offerings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables and products such as cheese, plantains, and more ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Mirando Al Futuro Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Villa Adela, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Mirando al Futuro,  con diez integrantes, desarrollan su reunión elaborando el reglamento interno se su grupo, liderizadas por su mesa directiva (presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas). Ellas se agruparon por vecinas y amigas que viven alrededor del Centro Focal por la necesidad de contar con mayor  capital de trabajo que les permita incrementar sus productos, todas tienen sus propios negocios, en un 50% tienen negocios de venta de comida, un 40% venden cosméticos y un 10% vende artículos de construcción, repostería y tapicería. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y seguir dando fuerza a sus negocios, sobre todo en esta época que el nivel de demanda ha subido por las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
The Community Association Mirando al Futuro is located in one of the Focal Centers of Pro Mujer Villa Adela. There are 10 members that hold their meetings according to the internal by-laws of their group. They are led by their board (president, treasurer and minutes secretary). They formed the group with neighbors and friends that live near the Focal Center. They needed to have greater working capital which would allow them to increase their products. They all have their own businesses. Fifty percent have businesses selling food, 40% sell cosmetics and 10% sell building materials, baked goods and upholstery. All of them need the loan to purchase goods and continue to strengthen their businesses, especially at this time when the level of demand has risen because of the new year holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE PRODUCTS FOR DIVERSE BUSINESSES

loans.name: Ingrid Sarai

texts.es: Ingrid  es madre soltera de 2 niños: el mayor de 5 añitos y el menor de 2 añitos de edad, vive en casa de su anciana madre, la cual la ayuda con el cuido de los niños cuando ella anda trabajando, esta solicitando su primer crédito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es terminar de repellar la casa,  Ingrid todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para dejar lavada la ropa de sus dos hijos y el desayuno hecho, es importante  mencionar que Ingrid desde muy pequeña  a trabajado y  a apoyado a su mamá,  son una familia  que profesan la religión  católica, es una Joven con mucha responsabilidad, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por los pobladores de su  barrio,  su sueño es tener trabajo para sacar a sus hijos adelante  para que a su familia no le falte nada y salud.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a single mother of two young children, ages 5 and 2. She lives with her elderly mother who looks after her children while she is at work.

Ingrid is requesting a home improvement loan so that she can finish plastering the walls of her house. Every morning, she wakes up early to wash clothes and prepare breakfast for her two children. It is important to mention that Ingrid has been working since she was a young girl in order to support her mother. She grew up in a Catholic family, so as a young woman she learned how to be responsible, honest, and hardworking. Ingrid is well-known among the residents of her neighborhood. Her dream is to have good health and a job in which she can succeed on behalf of her family so that they lack nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Avaroa Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Villa Adela, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Avaroa, con ocho integrantes, desarrollan su reunión elaborando el reglamento interno se su grupo, liderizadas por su mesa directiva (presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas). Se agruparon por vecinas y amigas que viven alrededor del Centro Focal por la necesidad de contar con mayor  capital de trabajo que les permita adquirir mercadería en negocios de comercialización y materia prima en negocios de producción, así 3 integrantes se dedican al tejido de prendas de vestir y 5 a negocios de compra y venta de muebles metálicos, plásticos, chinelas y frutas.
texts.en:
In one of Pro Mujer's towns, Villa Adela, is the Communal Bank “Avoroa”, which has 8 members. They are developing their group by having meetings where they make rules and are lead by their board (president, treasurer, and secretary). They came together as neighbors and friends who all lived around the center of town where they can get the most working capital and raw materials for their businesses. Three members are weavers and five are merchants who buy and sell metal furniture, plastics, slippers, and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Rebeca Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia YOLANDA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 34 años D. edad, es divorciada tiene dos hijos y es padre y madre para sus hijos. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia D. Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda D. venta D. celulares y una librería. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la librería papel D. regalo, peluches y tarjetas naviD.ñas y para la tienda D. celulares accesorios para celulares alusivos a la navidad, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Vilcanota”. She is 34 years old and divorced, so she has to be both mother and father to her two children. Yolanda lives in the province of Urubamba, which is north of the city of Cusco. She has a bookstore and a small shop where she sells mobile phones.
