Yolanda has been in business for a number of years and has done well thanks to all of her efforts. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants to succeed for the sake of her children.

Yolanda is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her bookstore such as gift wrapping paper, stuffed toys, and Christmas cards. For her mobile phone shop, she will purchase phone accessories that are difficult to find during Christmas. The increased business capital will help her generate more income so that she can proviD. her children with a better quality of life.

Yolanda is grateful for this opportunity and promises to submit her payments on the scheduled due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire merchandise for her bookstore & mobile phone shop

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La Sra. Matías O. Diana tiene 44 años de edad, su casa es de material noble en la parte de adelante con techo de caña ubicada en el Centro Poblado Rosario de Yauca del caserio de Lujaraja. Su actividad es la venta de ropa, plástico y/u otro, desde hace 3 años, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio, también recorre la zona de Santiago, Pachacutec y Pueblo nuevo. sus ventas son al contado y a crédito a personal de fundos.Es madre soltera y una mujer emprendedora.Su sueño es llegar a ser una gran empresaria en la venta de ropa, juguetes, plásticos, etc.
Su negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos que le permite educar a sus 4 hijos, comprar sus bienes y construir su casita que fue afectada por el terremoto del 2007. Solicita crédito para invertir en ropa, juguetes y plástico; para la temporada de navidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Diana Matías O. is 44 years old and lives in a house built of solid materials, including a roof made of reeds. Her home is located in the central village of Rosario de Yauca in the region of Lujaraja. Diana has been selling clothing, plastics, and other items for three years. She operates her business out of her home, but she also travels to Santiago, Pachacutec, and Pueblo Nuevo. Her sales are made on a cash or credit basis. She is a single mother and enterprising woman. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur selling clothes, toys, plastics, and other products.

Her business is the main source of income for educating her four children. She purchased her own property and constructed a house that was affected by the 2007 earthquake. Diana is requesting a loan to buy clothing, toys, and plastics to sell for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire merchandise to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Chispitas De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
Claudia B. integrante de la Asociación Comunal Chispitas de Panamericana, vende comida, específicamente rellenos hace 6 años, negocio que aprendió de su madre, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos que le permitan elaborar los rellenos como harina, papa, arroz al por mayor, así sus costos serán menores, además Claudia es madre de un niño a quien tiene que alimentar, vestir y proteger, también le gusta las capacitaciones y visitar al consultorio de Pro Mujer.
Las demás integrantes de Chispitas de Panamericana  en su mayoría tienen negocios de comercialización como la venta de dulces, pollo, tarjetas, ropa de bebe y atención de cafetería. Requieren del préstamo para comprar productos y ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia B. is a member of the communal bank “Chispitas de Panamericana.” She sells food, specifically rellenos (stuffed food), and has done this for 6 years. Claudia learned this business from her mother and now needs a loan so she can buy the ingredients for the rellenos like wholesale flour, potatoes, and rice. Buying wholesale will reduce her expenses. Claudia is also the mother of a son she needs to feed, cloth, and protect. And Claudia also likes the trainings and consultations she has with Pro Mujer. The women who are members of Chispitas de Panamericana mostly have commercial businesses like selling sweets, chickens, cards, baby clothing, and working in cafeterias. They need loans to be able to buy products to sell to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Saka

texts.en:
Saka is 60 years old and married with twelve children, four of whom are attending school. He runs a bookshop where he also sells stationery, printing, bookbinding, and photocopying services. He's been in business for twelve years and has two employees. He also has a business providing electrical installations and selling spare auto parts. He says that he sells to schools, companies, and local residents and that business is good.

Saka successfully repaid a previous loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu and has requested this loan of Kes 40,000 to increase his stock of books.

Saka describes himself as hardworking and enthusiastic and says that Faulu's financial assistance has really boosted his business. In the future, he hopes to help settle his children in business enterprises and also to open branches of his own business for his children.

loans.use: To add to his stock of books

loans.name: Amig Chaco Group

texts.es: Martha M. integrante del grupo  Amig Chaco que pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani, se dedica al tejido de ropa de bebe y niño hasta los 5 años, en sus inicios ella tejía  a mano y con el pasar del tiempo se compró una máquina y su producción ha incrementado, Martha estima que por las fiestas de fin de año la compra de ropa se incrementará por lo que necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la lana, ella compra los insumos de la 16 de Julio y vende sus productos también el la 16 de Julio, sus clientes son señoras que tienen lugares  de venta fijo, es decir, ella entrega al por mayor y son otras personas las que venden por unidad, Martha tiene 5 hijos a los cuales cuida y protege. Otro ejemplo es  Evelyn L. con solo 19 años ella estudia  y  costura ropa como faldas y con el apoyo de su madre los vende en Desaguadero, los Yungas y Santa Cruz, ella es soltera y desea seguir estudiando y ampliar el negocio, por lo que necesita el préstamo para comprar tela. Las demás integrantes del grupo también necesitan el préstamo para comprar productos.
texts.en:
Martha M. is a member of the Amig Chaco group, which belongs to the Collpani community center. She knits clothes for babies and children up to 5 years old. When she started, she knit by hand. As time passed, she bought a machine and her production has increased. Martha estimates that the purchase of clothes for the end of the year festivities will increase, and she needs a loan to buy the raw material like wool. She buys her supplies at the 16 de Julio (a fair), and also sells her products at the 16 de Julio. Her customers are women who have fixed sales places. That means that she sells wholesale, and the other people sell by the unit. Martha has five children that she takes care of and protects. Another example is Evelyn L., who is only 19. She goes to school and she makes clothes like skirts. With her mother’s help, she sells them in Desaguadero, Los Yungas, and Santa Cruz. She is single, and she wants to continue studying and expanding her business. She needs a loan to buy fabric. The other members of the group also need the loan to buy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material (wool, fabric) and products

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia YOVANA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La socia vive en la provincia de Cusco y viene a las reuniones de este banco comunal. Ella es de profesión contadora pública y también tiene su stand de venta de ropa en el mercado “Pacifico del Sur” en la ciudad de Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una mujer joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante su profesión. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender mercadería como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio entonces tener mejores ingresos y darse una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Vilcanota communal bank.

She is 29 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives in the province of Cusco and attends the communal bank meetings. She is a public accountant and also has a clothing sales stand at the “Pacífico del Sur” market in the city of Cusco. She has been working for several years and she has done well, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Yovana is a hardworking and enterprising young woman who wants to get ahead in her profession. She needs a loan to purchase and sell merchandise such as clothing for men, women, and children for Christmas festivities. This way, she can increase business capital and have better earnings and a better quality of life.

Yovana is grateful for the opportunity provided to her by the communal bank and she promises to make her loan payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhcase and sell merchandise such as clothing for men, women, and children for Christmas festivities

loans.name: Yevgen

texts.en:
Yevgen is single. He is an entrepreneur from Khoost where he sells sports and tourism equipment in one of the local malls called “Senator”. His vending location is known for good quality, durable equipment.

As tourism is quite popular in this part of the country, known for its mountains and picturesque nature, Yevgen’s merchandise is always in high demand. He has been in the trade for two years. Presently, he has 3,500 Grivnyas of monthly net profit.

Yevgen is seeking a 6,500 Grivnya loan to increase his working capital. He is hoping to become a successful businessman one day. We believe his optimism, hard work, and good potential will help him achieve his goals and succeed in his endeavors.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 33 years old and married with three sons aged 7, 10, and 11. His wife is his partner in his business, a retail shop selling sugar, flour, fat, soap, and other items. He's been in this business since 1999 and also has a taxi business. Before starting his shop, he was a construction worker.

Thomas has successfully repaid two previous loans from Faulu and has requested this loan of Kes 80,000 to purchase bales of sugar and flour and crates of soft drinks.

Thomas describes himself as a hardworking entrepreneur and says that he has been able to expand his business to two shops since he joined Faulu. His hope for the future is to further expand his business into wholesale supply so that he can provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour and crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with three grown children. He owns a service station in the small town of Mikhailovka, Eastern Ukraine. His business is flourishing as there are many drivers who bring their vehicles to him for repairs and maintenance work. Yuryi has been in this business for over twelve years and his gross income is about 20,000 Grivnyas a month.

Yuryi is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to invest in his business development. All of his children actively help him with this business. This enterprise can be characterized as consistent and sustainable. We believe the current loan will benefit it and stimulate its further growth.

loans.use: To invest in his business development

loans.name: Los Jazmines Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LOS JAZMI.” se encuentra ubicada en la parte alta de Huaycán distrito de Ate departamento de Lima, vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 5 meses, la alcancía comunal está  conformada por 11 socios quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades como: producción, comercio y  servicio, la cual está representada por: 
M. Medina, actualmente asume el cargo de Tesorera, desde hace 5 meses, tiene 49 años, madre soltera con 4 hijos. M. se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo desde hace 1 año y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprar muebles para su casa, su nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de artefactos y como todo pequeño empresario tiene muchos sueños, uno de ellos es poner una gran bodega.
R. M. Arony, actualmente asume el cargo de Secretaria, desde hace 5 meses, tiene 23 años, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 1 año y 9 meses. R. en un inicio se dedicó a la venta de ropa, pero como para éste rubro se necesitaba una mayor inversión y no contaba con ello, decidió cambiar de rubro y dedicarse a la venta de salchipollo, ya que tenía demasiadas necesidades que cubrir y por ende la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos, se encuentra en este negocio desde hace 5 años y su reciente préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra de ropa para campaña navideña. R. como toda mujer emprendeD. sueña tener una  tienda de ropa y que su tienda sea reconocida por toda la clientela.
texts.en:
The alcancia commual bank “LOS JAZMI.” is located in the high part of the Huayan district of Ate, in the department of Lima. For the last 5 months, the alcancia communal bank has been working with EDASPROSPO-Prosperidad and is made up of 11 members. They work in different types of jobs such as: production, commerce and services, represented by: M. Medina, has been serving for the past 5 months as the Treasurer. She is 49, and a single mother with 4 children. M. has been working for a year selling beauty products from a catalog. With the effort she has put into her work she has been able to buy furniture for her house. She will invest her new loan into buying fixtures. Like all small entrepreneurs, she has many dreams: one of them is to set up a big grocery store. R. M. Arony has been the Secretary for the past 5 months. She is 23, and in a common-law-marriage. She has 1 son, aged 1 year and 9 months. In the beginning R. worked selling clothes, but for this type of product she needed a big investment and she didn’t have it. She decided to change the type of product and work selling salchipollo(French fries with shredded chicken-typical food of Peru) since she already had too many necessities to cover and therefore needed to make more money. For the last 5 years she has been doing this work, and will invest her next loan was in buying clothing for the Christmas season. R., as with all women entrepreneurs, dreams of having her own clothing store and that her store would be popular with all the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of clothing for the Christmas season

loans.name: Maria Zonia

texts.es:
La socia ZONIA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada tiene tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón. Los hijos estudian en la Universidad y en el colegio. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella es profesora del nivel primario en el colegio de Huayllabamba distrito de la provincia de Urubamba y también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta productos de belleza. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender mercadería como aretes, perfumes, anillos para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
ZONIA, 45, is a member of the "Vilcanota" communal bank. She is married and has three children; two girls and one boy. The children are all students; both at university and at school. She and her children live in Urubamba province which is located north of the city of Cusco. She is an elementary school teacher in Huayllabamba primary school in Urubamba province. She also has a small business selling beauty supplies. She has had this line of work for several years now and has done very well thanks to the great effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising mom that wants to see her children get ahead in life. She needs financing to buy stock items like earrings, perfumes, and rings to have on offer during this Christmas season so that her sales will increase and thus be able to offer her children a better quality of life. She is happy for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Nay Ruth

texts.es:
La socia NAY RUTH pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija de 10 meses de nacida. La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia por las mañanas trabaja de secretaria en la UGEL (Unidad de Gestión Educativa Local) de Urubamba y por las tardes atiende a su pequeña hijita.  Ya son varios años que trabaja como secretaria y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere casar a adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para el gasto familiar, ella quiere comprar pañales, comida y medicamentos para su bebe.   

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nay Ruth is a member of the village bank Vilcanota. She is 28 years old and lives her her partner. She also has a 10 month old daughter. She lives in the Urubamba province, which is located north of Cusco. In the mornings, Nay Ruth works as a secretary at UGEL, the Local Education Management Unit of Urubamba. In the afternoons she looks after her young daughter. She has worked for several years as a secretary and thanks to the high level of commitment she places on this work, has done very well. She is a hard-working, busy, young mother who wants to marry and move her family forward. She would like to request a loan for household expenses such as diapers, food and medicine for her daughter. She is very grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan and has promised to complete her repayments in accordance with the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Household Expenses including diapers, food and medicine

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es:
Marjorie B. C., tiene la edad de 25 años, es casada, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 5 años. El crédito lo quiere para asistir una plantación de Ayote que tiene con su familia.El darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo va a permitirle tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos.El esposo de doña Marjorie es quien está más al pendiente del cultivo del ayote, pero ella lo ayuda, sobre todo cuando es tiempo de cosecha.
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le dieron.
Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos y a toda su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Marjorie B. C. is 25, married, and has one child. He is 5 years old, and he is her greatest priority. The loan that she wants is to help with the squash planting that she does with her family. It is to give the crop adequate maintenance, which will allow her to have better production. This way she will have greater income. Majorie’s husband is the one who is more involved with the squash crop, but she helps him, especially at harvest time. This is the first time she has had a loan with Fudecosur, and she is very happy with the simplicity of the loan. In the future she hopes to give her children and her whole family a better quality of life and economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help with squash planting

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan P. G., tiene la edad de 45 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 17,20,24 y 25 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para asistir 2 hectáreas de café veranero que posee.El darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo va a permitir un buen desarrollo y así tener una mayor producción y por ende mayores ingresos económicos.Don Juan también se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos y tubérculos.
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos y esposa una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Juan P. G. is 45, married, and has four children who are his greatest priority. They are 17, 20, 24, and 25. The loan that he wants is for two hectares of summer coffee that he has. It is to give the crop adequate maintenance, which will allow for good development and greater production. This will bring greater income. Juan also grows basic grains and tubers. This is his first loan with Fudecosur. He is very happy with the simplicity of the loan. In the future he hopes to give his children and his wife a better quality of life and greater economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help with 2 hectares of summer coffee

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es:
Los socios D. L. alcancía  comunal “Somos Impacto 2006”, está conformada por 11 socios, L. cual se encuentra ubicada en L. parte baja D. Huaycán, distrito D. Ate departamento D. Lima, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: venta D. golosinas, ropa, comida y otros a L. confección D. ropa (polo y buzos).
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 4 años, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta L. señora Margarita S. P., conviviente, con 5 hijos, D. los cuales 2 son dependientes. Margarita se dedica a L. confección D. carteras en tejido a macramé, lana y otros, para después venderlos en los mercados y según pedidos, elL. para perfeccionar sus productos participo en talleres D. tejido, con el cual realiza lindos modelos D. cartera. Margarita   con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo apoya a su esposo (quien es pintor D. carros), en los gastos en el hogar, y en los estudios D. sus 2 hijos.
Margarita anheL. en el futuro establecer una tienda y aprovechara  L. campaña naviD.ña, para L. compra D. materiales: macramé, lana, accesorios y adornos  naviD.ños, para poder incrementar sus ganancias, para así seguir mejorando   educación D. sus hijos.
Nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo que nos brindan mediante los préstamos y nos comprometemos a cumplir con el pago D. las cuotas en el pL. establecido.
texts.en:
The "Somos Impacto 2006" communal bank, located in the lower part of Huaycán, Ate district, Lima department, is maD. up of 11 members who are involved in various commercial activities like: sale of sweets, clothing, food; others make clothing (polo shirts and sweatshirts). They have collaborated with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the last 4 years. Currently, the group president is Margarita S. P.. She lives with her life partner and has five children, two of whom are still dependent on her. Margarita makes purses on order out of macramé, wool and other materials for sale in the market. To perfect her technique, she attended various workshops where she learned to make pretty purses. Margarita, thanks to her work effort, is a help to her husband (who is an automobile painter) with household expenses and in paying for her two children's education. Margarita hopes in the future to have a store and will take advantage of the Christmas shopping season to buy supplies: macramé, wool, accessories and Christmas decorations to improver her earnings and be able to improve her children's education. Our members appreciate the help given by these loans and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for Christmas shopping season.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 15 años vende golosinas y bebidas en el paradero principal de una empresa de transporte de pasajeros. Para ella trabajar así le parece muy rentable porque cada día puede ver los ingresos de sus ventas, por lo que ha adquirido la habilidad de administrar sus ganancias adecuadamente para incrementar su mercadería. 
Adicionalmente, también cría animales en su casa, pero afortunadamente para esta labor cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos.

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes de su banco comunal que promueve el cumplimiento puntual de los pagos y es un ejemplo para los demás. En esta ocasión utilizará el dinero que solicita en la compra de más golosinas, y con otra parte hará arreglar las ventanas de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Amelia, 49, lives with her husband and their three children in her own house. For 15 years she has been selling sweets and drinks at the main stop of a passenger transportation business. Working like this is very profitable for her because each day she can see the income from her sales. She has acquired the ability to administer her earnings adequately to increase her merchandise. She also raises animals at her house. Fortunately, she has help doing this work from her husband and children. This is her ninth opportunity to have a loan with MFP. She is one of the members of her communal bank who promotes making payments on time, and she is an example for the rest. This time she will use the money she is asking for to buy more sweets. She will use the other part of the money to fix the windows in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 42 años, vive con una de sus hijas en una casa  alquilada.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos alimenticios como también artículos para el hogar. Este negocio lo desarrolla mediante viajes que realiza a otras ciudades, preferentemente los fines de semana, pues los otros días se dedica al abastecimiento de su mercadería en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad.
Adicionalmente, Delia teje a palito prendas que sus vecinas le encargan y eso le brinda un ingreso adicional para su hogar. Delia disfruta de su trabajo, especialmente de viajar, por ello desea que su mercadería aumentes para que sus ganancias sean más rentables.

Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y es muy puntual y responsable con sus pagos. En esta ocasión el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is 42 years old and lives with one of her daughters in a rented house. For the past 4 years, she has been selling various food products and products for the home. She is increasing her business by traveling to other cities on the weekends. During the week, she is busy supplying merchandise to the large market in her city.

Additionally, Delia knits clothing items for her neighbors who order them, bringing in some extra income. She enjoys her work, especially the traveling, and this is why she wants to increase her inventory to make the business more profitable.

This is Delia’s third loan with MFD. She is a member of a communal bank and is very punctual and responsible with her payments. On this occasion, the loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres.
Desde hace 10 años trabaja de manera independiente, generándose sus propios recursos. Su negocio es la crianza de pollos y la venta de licores, especialmente durante los fines de semana en las fiestas de su pueblo.
El resto de la semana, Elba se dedica a su granja de pollos, a los cuales alimenta con maíz que ella misma cosecha de sus tierras de cultivo, Elba siembre sólo para su consumo personal. 
Para el futuro, ella está planeando emprender otro negocio, es sería la venta de diversos productos según la demanda de la temporada. 

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, ella es una miembro activa de su banco comunal, y en esta ocasión renueva su compromiso de responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero  que ahora solicita lo usará para dos propósitos: para la compra de un suplemento alimenticio para sus pollos, y con la otra parte comprará flores para vender durante la festividad por el día de los muertos, cuando la gente visita los cementerios.
texts.en:
Elba is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in the house she inherited from her parents. She has worked independently for 10 years and is able to generate her own resources. Her businesses include raising chickens and selling liquor, especially on the weekends for all of the village parties.

During most of the week, Elba spends her time on her chicken farm. She feeds her birds corn that she grows herself. Any crop that she raises is strictly for personal consumption. In the future, she plans to start yet another business selling different products based on the season.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Elba is an active member of her Communal Bank and renews her commitment to be responsible with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used for two purposes. First, she will purchase nutritional supplements for her chickens. Secondly, she will use part of the proceeds to buy flowers to sell for the Día de Los Muertos festivities for when people visit the cemetaries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional supplements for her chickens & flowers for her new business

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Manuela M. es una dama con amplia experiencia en la elaboración de alimentos porque tiene su propio negocio de venta de comida en el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega donde a diario sus clientes le visitan para adquirir los alimentos.
Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y buscar la manera de cómo mejorar sus condiciones en el negocio.  Es importante destacar que ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos y continuar comercializándolos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Manuela M. is a woman who has extensive experience preparing food. She has her own business selling prepared dishes at El Bisne Market in the department of Chinandenga where her customers visit whenever they are in need of a meal.

Manuela has developed into an extremely hard worker and is looking for ways to improve the condition of her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and continue selling them from her vending post.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 43 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su madre en una casa arrendada.
Hace 3 años y medio decidió abrir su propio negocio y debido a su buena sazón eligió tener un restaurante, el cual implementó en su vivienda.
Para ella, la ubicación de su casa es muy favorable porque está en una de las principales calles de su localidad, lo que garantiza sus ventas. Elizabeth ofrece comida para el almuerzo y también para la cena. Su empieza muy temprano con la compra de los comestibles para las comidas que ha de preparar, al medio día es cuando tiene más clientes y necesita ayuda, por lo que sus hijos y su madre se encargan de atender a los comensales. 
Elizabeth está planeando también ofrecer desayunos, para lo será necesario mayor capital de trabajo. 

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y se siente a muy gusto de pertenecer a su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor y algunos utensilios para su cocina.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old. She lives with her two children and her mother in a rented house.

Three and a half years ago, Elizabeth decided to open a restaurant inside of her home. It has a favorable location because her house is on one of the main city streets, which guarantees that she will be able to make sales. Elizabeth offers food for both lunch and dinner. Her day starts very early when she has to purchase groceries for the meals she has to prepare. By noon, when she has the most customers, her mother and children are available to help attend to diners. Elizabeth also plans to offer breakfast, but she needs additional working capital to do this.

This is her third loan with MFP. Elizabeth enjoys being part of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy groceries in bulk as well as some kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries & kitchen utensils

loans.name: Melida Francisca

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Melida C. es propietaria de su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos tales como perfumes, colonias, talcos, cremas, entre otros siendo exhibidos en una vitrina que ella compró para mejorar su negocio. 
Es importante destacar que ella es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo al que tiene que mantener y pagarle sus estudios. 
El crédito lo solicita para la compra de los cosméticos con el fin de venderlos y así adquirir los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, Sra. Melida C. is the owner of a cosmetics business in which she sells perfumes, colognes, talcum powders, crèmes, and other products. Her merchandise is kept in a display cabinet that she bought to improve her business.

It is important to note that Melida is a single mother of a child for whom she has to support and pay school fees. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics to sell so that she can generate income to maintain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Melvin Leonel

texts.es:
Muy esforzadamente, en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Melvin C. se dedica a trabajar en su panadería donde elabora todo tipo de pan ya sea simple y dulce y ofrecido desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana buscando la manera de lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes.
Como todo padre responsable, se esfuerza diariamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos que dependen de él.
El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar el pan y así continuar produciendo un pan de alta calidad que sea de mucho agrado para sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandenga, Sr. Melvin C. works hard at his bakery producing all kinds of bread and simple sweets to begin offering in the early morning hours. He is always looking for ways to satisfy his customers.

Like any responsible father, Melvin strives every day to maintain his household and support his two small children who are dependent on him. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients so that he can continue making the high quality bread that brings great pleasure to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Formando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “FORMANDO UN FUTURO”

Formando un Futuro es un grupo que vive en San Juan D. Lurigancho conformado por personas que han sobresalido D. problemas tan grandes como el abandono.
Caso D. L. señora Hilaria D. 55 años, que ha sabido reponerse D. grandes golpes D. L. vida, 
ElL. fue abandonada D. muy pequeña y tuvo que andar por las calles pidiendo algo que comer, hasta que conoció a una señora que se encariñó con elL. y L. ayudo, alimento y vistió pero Hilaria igual tenia que trabajar, Hilaria creció a base D. trabajo y a sus catorce años ya tenía trabajos más fuertes, uno D. ellos fue en un restaurante donD. tenia el empleo D. lava platos, a los quince año conoció a quien seria su pareja y padre se sus 2 hijas, él trabajaba en L. municipalidad D. recogedor D. basura, empleo que a L. justas alcanzaba para comer.
Pasaron los años y cuando L. mayor D. sus hijas tuvo 12 y L. menor 6, Hilaria sufrió otro abandono D. parte D. su pareja, él L. abandonó a su suerte, con sus 2 hijas, estonces Hilaria tenía que ser padre y madre, comenzó a trabajar nuevamente, inició vendiendo caramelos, después vendió chupetes, helados, luego comida, menús y en las noches vendía golosinas, galletas, en una canasta D. manera ambulante.
Después D. 25 años su ex-pareja, padre D. sus hijas D. Hilaria, volvió, pero solo por estar lisiado, sus hijas independizadas tomaron este hecho D. forma indiferente ya que tenían sus propias familias, ahora L. pareja D. Hilaria ayuda en lo que pueD., cuidando el negocio, etc. 
En L. actualidad Hilaria tiene un kiosco con permiso D. L. municipalidad donD. venD. golosinas, dulces, bebidas, etc., también tiene un carrito D. helados Donofrio, y un locutorio ambulante.
ElL. es una mujer fuerte que tiene sueños como los D. muchas mujeres en este sociedad, elL. nos comenta con una sonrisa: “Mi sueño es tener mi casa terminada y una bodega en elL., para poder trabajar sin necesidad D. salir D. mi casa pues lo que mas me gusta es el trabajo y si el trabajo esta en casa mejor para mi”
texts.en:
Formando un Futuro (Forming a Future) is a group that lives in San Juan D. Lurigancho and is maD. up of persons who have overcome problems as big as abandonment. For example: Hilaria, 55, has learned to overcome heavy blows in life. She was abandoned as a very young girl and had to roam the streets begging for food until she met a woman who became fond of her and helped her with food and clothing. Still, Hilaria had to work. Hilaria grew based on toil and, by the age of 14, had exacting jobs. One of them was as a dishwasher in a restaurant. At 15, she met the man who would become her partner and father of her two daughters. He was employed as a municipal trash collector, a job that barely earned him enough income to eat. Years passed and when their eldest daughter was 12 years old and the youngest was 6, Hilaria suffered another abandonment; this time by her partner. He abandoned her to her fate, with two daughters. Hilaria now had to be both mother and father and started working again. She began selling candy, then popsicles and ice-cream. Later it was food, prepared meals and at night, sweets and cookies that she peddled from a basket that she carried through the streets. After 25 years, her ex-partner and father of their daughters, returned but only because he was crippled. Their daughters were unaffected by this turn of events because they were independent by this time with families of their own. Now, Hilaria's partner helps out with what he can, like tending to the business, etc. Currently, Hilaria has a small kiosk which the city allows her to use to sell sweets, candies, beverages, etc. and she also has a small ice-cream vending cart for Donofrio brand items and she has traveling phone booths. She is a strong woman who has dreams like so many other women in this society. She tells us with a smile "my dream is to finish my home and to have a store in it so that I can work without having to leave my house because what I most enjoy is work and, if I could work from home, that would be even better for me"

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mercedes Liseth

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Mercedes Córdoba posee su propia pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos como comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, galletas, golosinas, pan, entre otros y también vende aceite y plátanos. De igual manera, ella vende productos como jabones, papel higienico, ase, pasta de dientes y otros.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para la pulpería y de esta manera continuar en su actividad buscando la manera de satisfacer las necesidades de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, Sra. Mercedes Córdoba has her own grocery store where she offers all types of food products such as rice, sugar, cookies, candy, bread, cooking oil, and bananas. In addition, she sells products such as soap, toilet paper, cleaning products, toothpaste, and other items.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products for her grocery store so that she can continue her business. Mercedes looks for ways to satisfy all of her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 40 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa D. unos familiares.
DesD. hace más D. 2 años se dedica a criar animales, tales como: cerdos, ovejas, cuyes y pollos. Para ello adecuó un espacio en su vivienda para albergar a estos animales, a los que alimenta con la alfalfa que cosecha en sus tierras, D. esta manera tiene a sus animales en buen estado D. salud comiendo pasto fresco. Cada 15 días lleva a sus animales a las ferias ganaderas D. su localidad para su comercialización o en algunos casos sus clientes la buscan en su misma casa.
Adicionalmente, en sus tierras D. cultivo siembra papa, maíz y alcachofa, siendo la venta D. estos productos, un ingreso económico muy importante para su familia.
Elsa desea tener un establo más granD. y mejor implementado para que sus animales tengan mejores condiciones D. vida y eso se traduzca en mayores ganancias para ella.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasmada con la experiencia D. ser parte D. un banco comunal, pues es novedad para ella; por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. abono para sus siembras D. alcachofa.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and lives with her three children in the house of one of her relatives. For more than two years, she has been raising animals such as pigs, sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens. She converted a space in her home in order to house these animals. Elsa keeps them healthy by feeding them fresh grass and alfalfa that she grows herself. Every 15 days, she takes her animals to the local livestock fairs to sell. In some cases, customers will come to her house to buy the animals.

In addition to raising animals, Elsa grows potatoes, corn, and artichokes. Selling these products provides important income for her family. She wants to build a larger stable so that her animals will have better living conditions, which translates into increased revenues for her.

This is her first loan with MFP. Elsa is excited about being part of a Communal Bank because this is a new experience for her. She promises to make her payments on time. The money she requested will be used to purchase fertilizer for her crop of artichokes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Celsa Arelis

texts.es: La señora Celsa B. se dedica a la venta de bebidas como jugos y gaseosas en el departamento de Chinandega en el mercado El Bisne donde diariamente ofrece sus bebidas en la terminal de buses con el propósito de buscar la manera de cómo mejorar las condiciones de su actividad y llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por su hijo ya que ella es madre soltera y debe brindarle las condiciones para que este pequeño estudie. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de las bebidas para continuar comercializándolas en su localidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Celsa B. sells beverages, such as juices and sodas, from El Bisne Market in the department of Chinandega. She offers her products daily at the bus terminal as a means of improving her living conditions and maintaining her household. Celsa is a single mother with a young son. She wants to provide the conditions necessary for him to study. This loan will be used to purchase beverages so that she can continue selling them from her vending location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia.
Hace 5 años decidió, junto con su esposo, tener un negocio propio donde toda la familia trabaje en unión. Con la experiencia de su esposo en la elaboración de panes implementaron una pequeña panadería. Allí trabaja diariamente desde la madrugada para que posteriormente, Gladys se encargue de repartir sus panes a todas las tiendas y bodegas de su localidad.
En consecuencia de su buena administración de las ganancias, en poco tiempo lograron adquirir una batidora y mesas amplias para las bandejas.
Durante todo este tiempo, Gladys ha visto cómo el arduo trabajo de toda su familia ha dado muy bueno frutos, por lo que su deseo es tener una panadería más grande, donde no solo se produzca panes, sino también pasteles y bizcochos. 

Es la 7ma oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy bien de ser parte de su banco comunal, pues es un grupo muy unido y responsable. Con el dinero que ahora solicita invertirá en la ampliación de la infraestructura de su taller de panadería, el cual está ubicado en su misma casa.
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and their six children.

Five years ago, Gladys and her husband decided to start their own business in which the entire family could work together. With her husband’s experience in making bread, they decided to open a small bakery. He begins work every day at dawn, while Gladys is in charge of distributing the bread to all of the shops and grocery stores in the area. As a result of her fine management of the profits, she has been able to acquire within a short amount of time a mixer and large tables for holding bread trays. After seeing all of the hard work her family has accomplished, Gladys wants to expand her bakery so that they can produce pastries and cakes in addition to bread.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Gladys says it feels good to be a member of her Communal Bank because it is a responsible and close-knit group. The money she requested will be used to expand the infrastructure of her bakery, which is located inside of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the size of her bakery

loans.name: Rosa Paula

texts.es:
La señora ROSA PAULA V. S., tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella. ROSA  se dedica a la confección  de ropa de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.
Su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó  en la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, elástico, blondas, etc. 
Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará telas, hilos, blondas, hilos de bordar para confeccionar manteles y servilletas navideñas.
ROSA sueña con asociarse con una amiga y tener un pequeño taller de costuras.
texts.en:
Rosa Paula V. S. is 49 years old and lives in the Porvenir district of Trujillo province, in the Department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Semillitas Creativas [Creative Seeds] Communal Bank. Rosa has completed her studies through the fifth year of secondary school, and she has four children, who are all grown and none of whom are economically dependent on her. She currently works making clothing for men, women and children. Her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles was used to purchase fabrics, threads, zippers, elastic, lace and other materials. With this loan for 500 soles, she will purchase fabrics, thread, lace and embroidery thread for creating Christmas tablecloths and napkins. Rosa dreams of partnering with a friend to open a small dressmaking workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics, thread, lace and embroidery thread

loans.name: Claudia Guissel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Claudia T. se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera ya que tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de alimentos que son preparados por ella misma para ser ofrecidos en su localidad.
Ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace cuatro años y ha buscado la manera de cómo salir adelante desarrollándose en la venta de los alimentos. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de la materia prima como lo es la compra de los frijoles por quintal y el aceite para dar lugar a la preparación de los alimentos.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, Sra. Claudia T. is known for being an excellent cook. She has a small business selling prepared dishes to the local residents.

Claudia has been engaged in this activity for four years and has looked for ways to develop her food business and move it forward. This loan will be used to buy ingredients such as beans by the quintal (46 kg.) and cooking oil for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Helvia

texts.es:
Helvia tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años en la casa de su madre.
Desde hace 8 mese implementó una tienda en su vivienda, pues notó que era una buena oportunidad debido a que está ubicada en una zona céntrica de su localidad. Desde ese entonces ya ha visto el fruto de su trabajo, pues tanto ella y sus hijos se encargan de atender a los clientes que acuden a consumir los productos comestibles que expende. De preferencia atiende en las mañanas, pues por las tardes se dedica a las tareas domésticas y a la atención de sus hijos. Con este negocio Helvia se siente muy satisfecha y en crecimiento personal constante.
Ahora, ella se ha proyectado a seguir adelante con su negocio hasta lograr ser una distribuidora de alimentos a gran escala.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda, en esta ocasión para la campaña navideña se abastecerá de “panetones” (queque típico navideño).
texts.en:
Helvia is 45 years old. She lives in her mother’s house with her two children, aged 6 and 14. Eight months ago, she started a store in her house, as she noticed that it was in a good central location.

Since that time, she has seen the fruits of her labor. She and her children attend to the customers who come in for the foods that they sell. She only works in the mornings, as in the afternoons she is busy with housework and care of the children. She is very satisfied with the business, and feels constant personal growth. She plans to pursue this business until it becomes a large-scale food distribution.

This is Helvia’s third loan with MFP, and she is happy to be part of a communal bank. The money from this loan will be used to buy more merchandise for her store, especially “panetones,” traditional Christmas cakes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal CAMINANDO JUNTOS se encuentra ubicada en L. zona alta D. Huaycán, departamento D. Lima, actualmente está conformado por diez socios, quienes se desempeñan en diferentes actividades como producción, comercio y servicio, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- prosperidad desD. hace cuatro meses y esta representada por:
Sabina: entusiasta y emprendedora D. 46 años, conviviente con cuatro hijos, actualmente sigue asumiendo el cargo D. presidenta D. L. alcancía.
Sabina se dedica a L. venta D. menús para  fábricas textiles las cuales están ubicadas a 40 minutos D. su domicilio, gracias al perseverante esfuerzo que pone día a día en su labor ha logrado obtener bienes para su hogar y apoyar a su cónyuge con los estudios D. sus hijos. Con el reciente préstamo Sabina comprara panetones para venderlos en esta campaña naviD.ña.
Ruth Enriqueta: luchadora y emprendedora D. 36 años D. edad con tres hijos D. 7, 10 y 16 años,  actualmente continua en el cargo D. secretaria, anteriormente se dedicaba a L. venta D. habas y maní, pero con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado establecer una bodega en su domicilio,  también realiza manualidades como confección D. polos y bordados. Con el préstamo recibido Ruth lo utilizara en L. ampliación D. su hogar y surtir  su pequeña bodega.
Maylen Evelyn: quien sigue asumiendo  el cargo D. tesorera desD. hace cuatro meses, es una joven emprendedora, conviviente D. 24 años con un hijo D. 1 año por el cual lucha día a día. 
ElL. es una experta dibujante  realiza pancartas, dibujos para colegios y nidos, empezó en este pequeño negocio con L. ayuda D. su tía quien es profesora. El reciente préstamo lo invertirá en L. compra D. colores y demás materiales para seguir realizando sus dibujos y así ayudar a su familia y a su pequeño niño.
texts.en:
The "Caminando Juntos" [Walking Together] Communal Bank is located in the high zone of Huaycán, in the Department of Lima. It currently includes ten members who work in a range of fields, including production, traD. and services. They have worked with the Edaprospo Prosperity organization for the past four months, and they are represented by: Sabina M. Castañeda: an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial woman of 46 who lives with her partner and four children. She is currently taking on the position of president of the communal bank. Sabina works selling meals at textile factories which are located 40 minutes from her home. Thanks to the dedicated efforts she puts into her work day after day, she has been able to obtain goods for her home and help her partner with their children's educational expenses. With this loan, Sabina will purchase traditional cakes to sell during the Christmas season. Ruth Enriqueta: a determined and entrepreneurial woman, 36 years old, with three children aged 7, 10 and 16. She is currently continuing in her position as secretary. She previously worked selling beans and peanuts, but with the effort she has put into her work, she has been able to open a small shop in her home. She also creates handmaD. goods such as shirts and embroidered items. Ruth will use this loan to expand her home and to stock her small store. Maylen Evelyn: who continues to occupy the position of treasurer, as she has for the past four months. She is a young entrepreneur, 24 years old, who lives with her partner and her 1-year-old child, for whom she works hard each day. She is an expert at drawing and creates placards and drawings for schools and day care centers. She began this small business with the help of her aunt, who is a teacher. She will invest the funds from the current loan in purchasing art supplies to continue producing her drawings and thus helping her family and her small child.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and supplies

loans.name: La Estrella Flat Group

texts.es:
UBICADO A 38KM DE LA CIUDAD DE CUAUTLA SE ENCUENTRA EL MUNICIPIO DE TEPALCINGO PERTENECIENTE AL ESTADO DE MORELOS.
LA FORMA MAS FACIL PARA LLEGAR ES POR LA CARRETERA DE CUAUTLA - IZUCAR DE MATAMOROS LLEGANDO AL CRUCERO DE 4 CAMINOS SE ENCUENTRA UNA DESVIACION A LA DERECHA QUE ES LA CARRETERA CUAUTLA - AXOCHIAPAN Y A 14 KM DE AHI SE ENCUENTRA  TEPALCINGO.

EN ESTE POBLADO SE  ENCUENTRA EL GS LA ESTRELLA FLAT EL CUAL ESTA EN SU PRIMER CICLO YA QUE ANTES  DOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO FORMABAN PARTE DE UNA UDE PERO DEVIDO A ALGUNOS ATRASOS QUE HUBO EN EL GRUPO SE DESHIZO VAN EN EL CUARTO PAGO Y HASTA EL DIA DE HOY SE HAN DISTINGUIDO POR SU PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS.
LA ACTIVIDAD QUE MAS ABUNDA EN TEPALCINGO ES EL COMERCIO Y DE AHI LA AGRICULTURA Y POR ULTIMO LA GANADERIA.
DENTRO DE ESTE GS SE ENCUENTRA LA SRA. MARICELA T. N. LA CUAL CUENTA CON 49 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTA EN UNION LIBRE TUVO CUATRO HIJOS PERO NADAMAS TIENE TRES YA QUE UNO FALLECIO AL NACER ELLA HA FORMADO PARTE DE FUNDACON REALIDAD DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE ANTERIORMENTE ESTABA TRABAJANDO CON UNA UDE QUE SE LLAMABA AKASIA PERO HUBO MUCHAS INTEGRANTES QUE SE ATRASARON  SI PAGARON PERO TUVIMOS QUE ANDARLAS CORRETEANDO LAS SRAS. QUE ERAN PUNTUALES PERDIERON SU BONOFICACION Y SE DECISO EL GRUPO DE AHI LE OFRECIMOS OTRA METDOLOGIA A LA SRA. MARICELA DE FORMAR UN GS DE 5 PERSONAS LE INTERESO Y BUSCO MAS GENTE TODAS CON UN NEGOCIO LA SRA MARICELA VENDE POLLO, REFRESCO, HUEVO, CLARASOL, ETC. LA SRA.MARIA DE LOS ANGELES M. VENDE REFRESCO, ADRIANA BETZABEL VENDE COLCHAS, MARIA C. L. VENDE BISUTERIA, JENY VENDE ROPA.
EL CRDITO DE LA SRA MARICELA FUE DE $6000 Y LO VA A UTILIZAR EN COMPRAR PAN, POLLO, HUEVO, REFRESCO, CLARASOL, ETC. VENDE EN SU DOMICILIO EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA  EN CALLE AQUILES SERDAN CON ESQUINA TEZOZOMO S/N DE LA COL. BUENOS AIRES YA QUE NOS COMENTA QUE EN TEPALCINGO LA MAYORIA SON BARRIOS PERO BUENOS AIRES ES COL. YA QUE LA TIENEN CATALOGADA COMO ZONA DE MARGINACION.
EL SUEÑO MAS GRANDE QUE ELLA TIENE ES LLEGAR A TENER SU TIENDA QUE COMO HACE YA  MAS DE 5 AÑOS LA TENIA PERO DEVIDO A LOS PROBLEMAS LA DEJO VENIR ABAJO Y VENDIO TODO SUS ANAQUELES, MOSTRADORES ETC. Y AHORA QUE VENDE PERO EN UNAS MESITAS EN SU CASA QUIERE VOLVER A RETOMAR SU TIENDA COMO ANTES PARA QUE DE AHI MISMO  PUEDA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO Y ASUS HIJOS A SALIR ADELANTE Y SER ALGUIEN EN LA VIDA.
NOS COMENTA QUE LE VA BIEN EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE NO HAY TIENDAS CERCA DE AHI Y APARTE POR EL BUEN TRATO QUE LES DA ATIENDE A MAS DE 100 PERSONAS AL DIA COMO VA SACANDO SUS GANANCIAS LAS VA REINVIRTIENDO CADA 3ER DIA EN EL REFRESCO Y DIARIO EN EL POLLO.

POR ULTIMO AGRADECE A LA EMPRESA POR A VER CONFIADO EN ELLAS A PESAR DE LO QUE YA HABIA PASADO CON EL GRUPO ANTERIOR Y DICE QUE ESPERA SEGUIR DURANTE UN TIEMPO PARA PODER HACER REALIDAD SU SUEÑO DE TENER SU TIENDA Y DICE  "NO LES VOY A FALLAR"
A KIVA GRACIAS POR CONFIAR EN LA EMPRESA DE FUNDACION REALIDAD YA QUE ES UNA EMPRESA QUE CUMPLE LO QUE PROMETE Y ESTOY SEGURA QUE NO LES VA A FALLAR.
texts.en:
Telpalcino is in the state of Morelos 38 kilometers from the city of Cuautla. The easiest way to reach it is via the Cuautla-Izucar de Matamoros highway. Arriving at the 4 Caminos intersection, there is a detour to the right which is the Cuautla-Axochiapan highway. 14 Kilometers from there is Tepalcingo. The La Estrella Flat communal bank is located in this town. It is in its first loan cycle since two of its members used to be part of a different group but, due to some delays, the group fell apart. As of today, they are on their fourth repayment and they have been noted for the punctuality in their repayments. The most common activity in Tepalcingo is commerce, then agriculture, and in third place, cattle raising. One of the members of this group is Maricela T. N., 49, who is in a common law relationship. She had 4 children but one died at birth so she only has three. She has been a member of Fundacion Realidad for about 2 years. Prior to this she was working with a group called Akasia but many of its members fell behind in their payments; they paid, but we had to be chasing after them to do so. As a result, the punctual members lost their benefits and the group fell apart. Maricela was offered a different method: to form a new group of 5 members. She was very interested and found other people who had businesses. Maricela sells chicken, eggs, clarasol (a laundry product), etc. Maria de los Angeles M. sells soft-drinks, Adriana Betzabel sells bedspreads, Maria C. L. sells costume jewelry, Jeny sells clothes. Maricela’s loan was for $6000 which she will use to buy bread, chicken, eggs, soft-drinks, clarasol, etc. She sells from her home which is located on Aquiles Serdan steet at the corner of Tezozomo, in Buenos Aires neighborood. She tells us that almost all of Tepalcingo is made up of poor neighborhoods but Buenos Aires is a nicer area. Her greatest dream is to have her own store like she had almost 5 years ago but, due to problems, had to let it go; she sold off all her diplay cases, shelving, etc. and now she uses little tables at her home to display her wares. She would like to recover her store the way it used to be so that she can help her husband and her children to get ahead and be someone in life. She tells us that she does well in her store since there are no others nearby. Besides, the good customer service she provides brings more than 100 persons daily to her store and this is how she makes her profits which she reinvests every third day in soft-drinks and daily in chicken. Lastly, she is grateful for the confidence placed in her despite what had happened with the previous group and she hopes to continue forward for a time to see her dreams come true and have her store. She states: “I will not let you down.” She thanks Kiva for trusting Fundacion Realidad because they do what they say they will and she’s sure they won’t let Kiva down.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, chicken, egs, oil, clarasol (a laundry product), etc.

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Blanca M. desde muy temprano inicia su venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma y comercializados en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde varias personas le compran por prepararlos con altas normas de higiene y por su puesto con muy buen sabor.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cuatro años y hoy en día está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar ofreciéndolos en su localidad en su localidad y así generar ingresos para suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca M. begins selling meals she prepares early in the day in the central market of Chinandega. Here various costumers buy her meals because she has high sanitary regulations and good tasting food. She has been dedicated to this job for four years and today is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make her meals and continue offering them in her locale and make more profits to provide her household with necessary amenities.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials to prepare meals.

loans.name: Carla Mayela

texts.es:
La señora Carla Pastrana tiene su propio tramo en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde vende todo tipo de carteras, falas y billeteras ofreciéndolas a los clientes que visitan el mercado y habiendo mejorado poco a poco a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo.
Ella se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora ya que desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ya está atendiendo su negocio. El crédito que ella solicita es para utilizarlo en la compra de las carteras, fajas y billeteras para continuar vendiéndolas y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Carla Pastrana has a sales stall in Chinandega's Central Market where she sells all kinds of purses, wallets and belts to customers who visit the market daily to do their shopping. As time has gone by, her business has improved bit by bit. She is very hard-working and is at the helm of her business from very early in the morning. The financing she is asking for is to buy purses, belts and wallets to increase her stock inventory so that sales will contine to allow her to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy purses, belts and wallets.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia N. es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 23 años, es madre de un hijo. Julia se dedica a la venta de pollos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja independientemente. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martin de Porres” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de pollos para vender en el mercado. Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1400 soles que será utilizado en la compra de alimentos balanceados para pollos y luego estos venderlos en el mercado bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa en las fiestas navideñas. La meta de Julia es tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Julia N. is a very dynamic, hard-working entrepreneur who sells chickens. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region. She is 23 years old and has one child. She has the support of her husband who is self-employed. She has been a member of the communal bank “Fray Martin de Porres” for two years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy chickens to sell at the market. She is now requesting a loan of 1400 soles to buy balanced food for the chickens so she can then sell them at the Bellavista Christmas market in the city of Pucallpa. Julia’s goal is to have a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced food for chickens.

loans.name: Virgen De Los Angeles De Huayllacocha Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Virgen D. los Angeles D. Huayllacocha, are clients of Asociación Arariwa. This communal bank consists of 15 members in Huayllacocha, a rural town 50 minutes from Cusco. All of the group members live in Huayllacocha. Most are involved in one or more of the following activities: growing crops for their small farms, purchasing goods such as barley, corn, potatoes, and fava beans, and traveling to nearby towns and commercial hubs to sell these grains and food products in marketplaces. Some are also involved in the milling and processing of grain products to sell. 

Zoila is the president of the group. She is 60-years old, widowed, and has three adult children who are married and live on their own. Zoila makes a living selling jora, the fermented corn used to make a traditional Andean corn drink called chicha. She sells jora in the marketplace of Izcuchaca, a nearby transportation and commerce hub about a 20-minute drive from her rural town of Huayllacocha. In addition to selling jora, Zoila buys fava beans, barley, and wheat from local farms to sell in the markets. 

She will use this loan to buy dried corn so that she can sell greater quantities of jora and other grain products in the marketplace. 

(SABINA and MARCELINO are not pictured in the video)

loans.use: Grains and Farm Supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria  es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por sus ideales, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región Ucayali, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo quien es su motivación para salir adelante. Victoria se dedica a la  venta de tablas y listones de madera, este negocio funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas” desde hace nueve años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en carbón para luego  venderlo a sus conocidos. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar madera y venderlo posteriormente a sus clientes. La meta de victoria es tener un local propio para colocar las tablas de madera y seguir progresando, mejorando sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a hard-working woman who fights for her dreams. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 49 and is the single mother of a son who is her motivation to get ahead. Victoria sells wooden tables and bars. She runs this business out of her home. She has been part of the communal bank, "Las Margaritas" (The Daisies) for nine years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to invest in charcoal that she later resold to people she knew. Currently she needs a loan for 2,000 PEN that she will use to buy wood to later sell to her customers. Her goal is to have her own location to put her wooden tables and to keep progressing and improving her economic income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La señora María Estela O. es propietaria de un negocio de venta de carteras, ropa para niños y venta de gaseosas y reposterías ubicada en su establecimiento en el departamento de Chinandega donde a diario es visitada por los clientes para llevar los productos y también para comprar las reposterías y gaseosas para consumirlas.
Ella es una dama comprometida con el bienestar de su hogar y por esta causa trabaja fuertemente para mejorar las condiciones del negocio. El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de los productos y también para la compra de las gaseosas y las reposterías para así continuar comercializándolas en su tramo.
texts.en:
María Estela O. owns a shop in Chinandega department where she sells purses, children's clothing, soft-drinks and pastries. She attends to her customers daily who come to buy her products and consume her soft-drinks and pastries. She is a woman who is committed to her home, motivated to work hard to improve the state of her business. The financing she is asking for will be used to buy merchandise as well as soft-drinks and pastries to continue her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like soft-drinks and pastries.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 59 años de edad, es casada,  tiene 03  hijos, 1 de ellos vive con ella  y 2 tienen pareja con las que viven a parte en Puno e Ilave respectivamente. Tan solo asistió transición.
Feliciana trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde ace 04 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, los cuales compra de los vecinos y los lleva a vender a Ilave.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró 2 chanchos y gallinas.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar 1 torito.
Su visión hacia el futuro es, continuar con su negocio y  seguir trabajando para tener una vejez tranquila.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los préstamos y ahorros.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (White River Breezes) community bank in Pilcuyo district of El Collao province. She is 59 years old, married, and has 3 children. 1 of her children lives with her still and the other 2 are married and live in Puno and Ilave. Being alone has helped the transition. Feliciana has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years. She buys small livestock from neighbors and sells them in Ilave. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought 2 pigs and hens. She is requesting a loan of 1,300 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of a bull. Her vision for the future is to continue her business and keep working so that she will be secure in her old age. What she likes most about her community bank are the loans and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull.

loans.name: Ayda Yolanda

texts.es: Ayda M. es una socia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 38 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad. Ayda se dedica a la venta de lubricantes para cadenas de motos y motocar, su esposo trabaja manejando su motocar, brindando el servicio de movilidad. Ella Integra el Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de lubricantes para motos y motocar. Actualmente Ayda necesita un crédito de 800 soles que utlizará en la compra de repuestos para motocar. La meta de Ayda es seguir trabajando vendiendo sus lubricantes de esa manera seguir progresando en la vida.
texts.en:
Ayda M. is a happy and hardworking member who lives in Pucallpa city in the Ucayali region. She is 38 years old and the mother of 2 young children. Ayda sells motorcycle chain lubricant and her husband works in transportation, driving a motor car taxi. She joined "Las Divinas" (The Divine Ones) community bank last year; her first loan of 300 PEN was invested in the purchase of motorcycle and motor car lubricants. Currently, Ayda needs a loan of 800 PEN that will be used to purchase spare motor car parts. Her goal is to continue selling motor lubricants in order to improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for motor cars.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
En el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Candida D. tiene su propio negocio de venta de especies de toda clase como canela, romero, albahaca, miel, arreglos florales, entre otros.
A pesar de su avanzada edad, ella continúa trabajando buscando la manera de cómo mejorar sus ingresos y así suplir sus necesidades. Ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años y el crédito esta vez lo está solicitando para la compra de los productos de especies con el fin de continuar ofreciéndolos en su establecimiento en el mercado central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Candida D. has a sales stall in Chinandega department's central market where she sells all kinds of spices like: cinnamon, rosemary, basil, honey, floral arrangements, among others. Despite her advanced age, she continues working and looking for ways to improve her earnings so as to meet her basic needs. She has been in this line of work for several years and the financing she is asking for now is to buy spices so that she can continue to offer them in her stall in Chinandega's central market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices.

loans.name: Armida

texts.es:
La señora Armida  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 D. Junio”, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 42 años D. edad y es soltera. Se dedica compra y venta D. ganado.

La señorita Armida estudió primaria completa y  tiene 5 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 1 años atrás, su primer préstamo fue D.  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. ovejas.

Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  D. una vaca lechera.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener 5 vacas lecheras y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su organización son las reuniones y ahorros.
texts.en:
Armida is a member of "24 D. Junio" community bank. She lives in Ilave district in the province of El Collao, Puno department. She is 42 years old and single. She buys and sells livestock. Armida has primary school education. She has 5 children and has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 1 year. Her first loan was 500 PEN and allowed her to buy sheep. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow. Her hope for the future is to have 5 dairy cows and to see her children attain professional careers. What she likes the most about her organization are the meetings and savings accounts.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cow.

loans.name: Katty Tatiana

texts.es: Katty Tatiana es una mujer colabora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es madre de un hijo menor de edad , ella se dedica a la venta de kekes, golosinas, abarrotes y gaseosas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es Topógrafo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Del Futuro” desde hace un  año.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas. En la actualidad Katty necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra de abarrotes en general para luego venderlo. La meta de Katty es surtir mejor su negocio y seguir apoyando a su esposo.
texts.en:
Katty Tatiana is a helpful and persevering woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 20 years old and the mother of one young son. Her business is the sale of cakes, candies, groceries, and soft drinks. She counts on the support of her husband who is a topographer.

Katty has been a member of the “Del Futuro” communal bank for one year. Her first loan, for 300 soles, was used to invest in soft drinks. Now, Katty needs a loan of 1200 soles to invest in general grocery items.

Katty’s goal is to supply her business better and to continue supporting her husband.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general grocery items

loans.name: Etelbina Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Etelbina S. se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos para la respectiva venta siendo comercializados por ella misma en las afueras del mercado central donde busca la manera de cómo vender a diario todo el alimento para generar utilidades para el bienestar de su hogar.
Ella actualmente no posee las condiciones necesarias para desarrollar su negocio por lo que busca la manera de cómo desarrollar su negocio y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y de esta manera comercializarlos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Etelbina S. lives in Chinandega department and works selling meals that she prepares herself outside the city's central market. Her daily task is to sell out all her meals so that she can generate profits for the wellbeing of her home. She currently lacks the resources to develop her business further so she has called upon Ceprodel to request financing to buy ingredients for her meal preparations in order to continue selling in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es:
Liseth C. M., tiene la edad de 32 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 4,11,12 y 13 años respectivamente.
