El crédito lo quiere para la compra de 2 vacas de cría y de leche, esto le ayudará mucho porque va tener leche para el uso familiar y además obtener más ganancias con la venta de crías.El negocio del ganado es un complemento para su familia ya que ella está dedicada también a la agricultura de granos básicos y tuberculos. No es la primera vez que doña Ana Laura se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Liseth C. M., 32, is married and the mother of 4 children, who are her highest priority in life. The children are 4, 11, 12, and 13 years old, respectively. She wants financing to buy two dairy cows to breed and for milk production. This will be a big help because she will be able to have milk for her family's nourishment and will earn even more profits selling any eventual young. The cattle raising is an added benefit for her family since she is also a farmer, growing basic grains and tubers. This isn't Ana Laura's first loan with FUDECOSUR. She states that the loan committee has been very helpful in the past since the help is what has allowed her to succeed in the various projects she has set up for herself. Besides, she is very happy with the loan terms she got. She hopes in the future to provide her family with a better quality of life and better economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For farming and cattle raising.

loans.name: Jairo Ramon

texts.es:
El Señor Jairo Ramón M. Martínez, labora como guarda de seguridad en el mercado Roberto Huembé Managua, el tiene a su cargo cuatros hijos los cuales están en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante tres años, en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 3 financiamiento que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente cliente y puntual en sus pagos.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo y piso de la vivienda en que habita y el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Jairo Ramón M. Martínez is employed as a security guard at the Roberto Huembé Managua market. He is married and the father of four school-age children. He has handled Ceprodel loans for the past three years and has managed in that period of time to improve his home with the three loans from Ceprodel He is an excellent client and punctual with his repayments. The financing requested is to buy building materials and pay for labor costs to replace the roof and floor of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his roof and floor.

loans.name: Deysi Magali

texts.es:
La señora  DEYSI MAGALI A. G., tiene  30 años, vive en el distrito de la MOCHE provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios técnicos en corte y confección, tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a  la confección de ropa en especial de ternos para caballeros.  Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró telas, hilos cierres, blondas, botones, etc. para la confección de sus pedidos.
Con este crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprará telas al por mayor para hacer un pedido de ternos para caballeros que tiene  pendiente.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un  mercado comercial en donde confeccionar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para si poder generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi Magali A. G., 30, lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Siempre Adelante II Communal Bank. She has a technical education in making clothes. She has two children who are economically dependent upon her. She makes clothes; her specialty is men’s suits. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy fabric, needles, zippers, lace, and buttons, etc. to make her orders. She will use this loan for 300 PEN to buy fabric wholesale to make a pending order for men’s suits. She dreams of renting a stand in the commercial market where she could make clothes for women, men, and children in order to generate more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale fabric

loans.name: Las 3 M Group

texts.es:
El Grupo las 3 M está integrado por Blanca F. Montoya, Melania L. y Martha H.. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, con visión y  muy capaces.
La señora L.  desde hace 20 años realiza nacatamales. Esta es una comida típica Nicaragüense que se a acostumbra comer en la cena del sábado o en el desayuno del domingo, acompañado por pan o tortillas y café.
F. Montoya desde hace un año empezó a vender productos Avon de manera ambulante y Martha H. vende tortillas, frijoles y cuajada.
texts.en:
Blanca F. Montoya, Melania L. & Martha H. are the members of the 3M group. They are forward-looking, hard-working, very capable women. Mrs. L. has made nacatamales for the past 20 years. [A nacatamal consists of dough (masa) (made from nixtamalized corn flour, milk and lard mixed with ground potatoes, green peppers, onions, garlic, salt and spice) and a filling (relleno) consisting of pork or chicken, tomatoes, rice, garlic, onions, potatoes, and mint leaves. The filling may also include olives, raisins or fresh chile. It is wrapped in plantain leaves to give it a unique flavor, tied, and then steamed or pressure cooked for several hours]. This typical Nicaraguan dish is usually served, accompanied by tortillas or bread and coffee, for Saturday dinner or Sunday breakfast. F. Montoya began selling Avon products door-to-door last year and Martha H. sells tortillas, beans and cuajada (Cuajada is a soft type of cheese that is maybe similar to feta but much saltier and great to eat with gallo pinto or just beans alone).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raw materials like: pork, rice, potatoes, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Petrona Cecilia

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras es la actividad a la que con mucho ahínco se dedica la señora Petrona E. en el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega ofreciendo chiltomas, tomates, ajos, naranjas, limones, zanahorias, cebollas y camarones.
Gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos, ella ha logrado desarrollar su negocio y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo, poco a poco ha brindado mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
El crédito actualmente lo solicita para la compra de las frutas, verduras y los camarones para continuar ofreciéndolo a los fieles clientes que ella posee en su localidad.
texts.en:
Petrona E. very zealously sells fruits and vegetables in Chinandega's central market. She stocks such items as: peppers, tomatoes, garlic, oranges, lemons, carrots, onions, and shrimp. Thanks to her multiple efforts she has managed to develop her business and, over time, little by little, has been able to provide her family with better living conditions. The financing needed now is to buy fruits, vegetables and shrimp so that she can continue to offer them to her regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and shrimp.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.

La señora Juliana no estudió y tiene 9 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 meses atrás, y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ganado como ovejas.

Su deseo para el futuro es sacar a sus hijos profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las charlas que recibe.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Manuelas de Hoy II Communal Bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 50 and married. She buys and sells livestock. Juliana does not have an education. She has nine children. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years. She used her first loan for 500 PEN to buy livestock. She is asking for a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy livestock like sheep. Her wish for the future is to have her children become professionals. The things she likes most about her organization are the savings and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Elsa Flor

texts.es:
La señora ELSA FLOR V. H., tiene 43 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to  de secundaria, es conviviente y  tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica  a la venta de cenas, salchipapa y salchipollo por las noches en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro papas, pollo, arroz, azúcar, etc. para la preparación de sus cenas y con el próximo crédito de 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará cajas de gaseosas  por mayor, platos descartables, 2 sacos de arroz y 12 botellas de aceite. 
Hace 2 semanas ha dejado de vender porque se encuentra delicada de salud y está en tratamiento médico.
Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Elsa Flor V. H., 43, lives in the Buenos Aires district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras II Communal Bank. She attended high school until the fifth year. She is in a common law marriage, and she has three children who are economically dependent upon her. She sells dinners, “salchipapa” (fried sausage and potato dish), and “salchipollo” (fried sausage, potato, and chicken dish) in the evenings from her home. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought potatoes, chicken, rice, and sugar, etc. for the preparation of her dinners. With the next loan for 1,200 PEN she will buy boxes of soft drinks wholesale, disposable plates, 2 sacks of rice, and 12 bottles of oil. She has stopped selling for two weeks because of her delicate health. She is receiving medical treatment. She dreams of expanding her business and having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy boxes of soft drinks wholesale, disposable plates, 2 sacks of rice, and 12 bottles of oil

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
Ana Laura Quirós M., tiene la edad de 46 años, es casado, y tiene 7 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 11,16,19,20,21,24 y 27 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de 2 novillas.El negocio del ganado es un complemento para su familia ya que ella está en un grupo que se dedica a la producción de café. No es la primera vez que doña Ana Laura se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ana Laura Quirós M., 46, is married and the mother of 7 children, who are the greatest priority in her life. They are 11, 16, 19, 20, 21, 24, and 27 years old, respectively. She needs financing to buy two heifers. The cattle raising business is an addition to her main occupation: she is a member of a coffee-growing group. This isn't Ana Laura's first loan with FUDECOSUR. She states that the credit committee has been of great help to her since the financings allowed her to bring her past projects to fruition; besides, she is very happy with the loan terms she got. She hopes for the future to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life and better economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Julia Lily

texts.es:
La señora Julia P. se ha dedicado a la venta de cunas, hamacas, artesanías, estufas, productos metálicos de uso domestico, almohadas, sombreros y otros productos comercializándolos desde hace quince años siendo este negocio el que le permite adquirir el dinero para mejorar en su negocio.
Actualmente, ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de dichos productos porque le es de mucha necesidad adquirirlos para ofrecerlos en el negocio y así continuar generando utilidades para el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto depende de ella.
texts.en:
Julia P. has sold cribs, hammocks, handicrafts, stoves, metal products for domestic use, pillows, hats and other products for the last 15 years. The sale of these products has allowed her to earn money to improve her business. Currently, she needs financing to buy merchandise because she needs to have them available for sale thus continuing to generate profits in order to support her household that depends on her so much.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
Mayra A. tiene su propio negocio de venta de carne de todo tipo en el mercado central de Chinandega ofertando carne de res y de cerdo a sus clientes que asisten al local para comprarle la carne.
Ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de cerdos para proceder con su destace y extracción de la carne. Por esta razón es que ella solicita el crédito en Ceprodel  para la compra de los cerdos y aprovechar esta oportunidad para ofrecer la carne y así generar ingresos para el  mejoramiento del negocio y por ende de su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra A. sells all kinds of meat in Chinandega's central market; she offers beef and pork to her customers who visit her stall when they come to the market to shop. She needs to buy pigs to butcher and sell the pork meat. She is requesting financing from Ceprodel to buy the pigs and take advantage of this opportunity to offer the meat so that she can generate income for the improvement of the business and thus for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pig to butcher.

loans.name: Las Alondras Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LAS ALONDRAS”  se encuentra ubicada en la parte baja de Huaycán distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima, vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace unos 3 años, la alcancía comunal está conformada por 11 socios quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades como: producción, comercio y  servicio, la cual está representado por: 
Julia S. Tereza M., sigue actualmente asumiendo el cargo de presidenta, tiene 37 años y un  hijo de 15 años.
Julia se dedica  a la venta de ropas importadas según pedidos, su préstamo lo invertirá en compra de ropas  para la campaña navideña, para así cubrir los pedidos solicitados de sus clientes, en el futuro anhela poder hacer crecer  su negocio.
Luz A. J.: actualmente esta asumiendo el cargo de Tesorera, tiene 37 años, es madre soltera con un hijo. 
Luz se dedica a la venta de ropa  según pedidos desde hace 6 años, realiza también servicios de confección, con los cuales a logrado  mejorar su condición de vida, con el  préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  ropas variadas para así cubrir los pedidos solicitados, en el futuro anhela  hacer crecer  su negocio y llegar a  establecer  una  bodega.
Nuria V. A.: actualmente asume el cargo de secretaria, tiene 34 años, conviviente, con 2 hijos. Nuria  y su  esposo se dedican a la venta de repuestos y accesorios para vehículos, con el préstamo realizara la compras para su negocio, con el cual le permitirá cubrir sus necesidades y mejorar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Las Alondras Communal Bank is located in the lower part of Huaycán, in the Ate district, Lima department. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for three years. The communal bank is comprised of 11 members who work in different types of activities like production, commerce, and service. They are represented by: Julia S. Tereza Morial currently continues as the president. She is 37 and has a 15 year old son. She sells imported clothes by orders. She will use her loan to buy clothes for the Christmas season. That way she will cover her customers’ orders. In the future she longs to be able to make her business grow. Luz A. J. is currently the treasurer. She is 37, and she is a single mother with one child. Luz has been selling clothes by order for six years. She also makes clothes. These activities have enabled her to improve her living conditions. She will use the loan to buy various clothes to cover the orders she has received. In the future she wants to make her business grow and establish a convenience store. Nuria V. A. is currently the secretary. She is 34, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Nuria and her husband sell replacement parts and accessories for vehicles. She will use the loan to purchase things for her business. That will allow her to cover their necessities and improve her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Wilmer Zacarías

texts.es: El caballero Wilmer A. posee su propio negocio de venta de ropa desde hace diez años en el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega donde está ubicado. Él ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio porque inició con poca cantidad de ropa pero a medida que vino pasando el tiempo, logró mejorar sus condiciones y hoy en día acude a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa y de esta manera contribuir al bienestar de su negocio y su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Wilmer A. has sold clothes in Chinandega's central market for the last 10 years. He has managed to improve the state of his business because he started out with just a few items of clothing but, as time has passed, has managed to improve. Today, he seeks help from Ceprodel to buy clothing so that he can contribute to the wellbeing of his business and family, which so much needs his support to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anavita

texts.es:
Anavita R. N., tiene la edad de 38 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 13,17 y 19 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  ganado para leche.El negocio del ganado le ayudará a su familia ya que va a poder vender la leche y producir queso para la venta. Es la primera vez doña Anavita se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella tambien trabaja en la agricultura sembrando hortalizas.
Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Anavita R. N. is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are her top priority. Her children are 13, 17 and 19 years old, respectively. She wants to take out a loan to purchase milk cows. This livestock business will help her family since she will be able to sell milk and produce cheese for sale. This is the first time that Anavita has obtained financing with FUDECOSUR. She states that the credit committee has helped her a lot, and they have provided many services. She also works in agriculture planting vegetables. She hopes that as this project grows she will be able to provide a better quality of life and greater economic stability to her family in the future. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of milk cows

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
El Señor Luis Eduardo C. Téllez, labora como encargado del mantenimiento y limpieza en el mercado Roberto Huembé Managua, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar,  es soltero , ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante dos años, en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 2 Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es una persona Trabajadora y es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo C. Téllez is a cleaning and maintenance employee at the Roberto Huembé Managua market. He is a single father of two school-age children. He has had two previous loans with Ceprodel with which he managed to improve his home. He is a hard-working person and an excellent client. The financing requested is to buy building materials to reroof his home so that his children will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials to reroof his house.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
Maricruz M. C., tiene la edad de 37 años, es soltera, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 14,16 y 18 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  cerdos y arreglar la porqueriza de los mismos. Es la primera vez que doña Maricruz se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. Ella tambien trabaja en la agricultura sembrando hortalizas.
Ella espera que con este proyecto pueda crecer y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Maricruz M. C., 37, is a single mother of three children, who are her greatest priority in life. Her children are 14, 16, and 18 years old respectively. She requests funding to buy pigs and to set up the pigsties for them. This is Maricruz's first financing with FUDECOSUR. She states that the credit committee has been much help and have made requesting the loan very easy. She also works farming leafy vegetables. She hopes that this project will grow so that she can offer her children a better quality of life and better economic stability in the future. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es:
Con una alegre sonrisa, la señora Catalina R. atiende su negocio de venta de productos de madera y artesanías tales como hamacas, mesas, sombreros, canastos, entre otros.
Ella a diario vende desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana  y siempre busca la manera de cómo ir superando en su actividad. Es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos artesanales y de madera para ofrecerlo a sus clientes y así continuar generando ingresos para el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
Catalina R.'s cheerful smile is ever-present when she tends to customers in her crafts shop. She sells wood crafts and other crafts like: hammocks, tables, hats, baskets, etc. From very early in the morning she is at her stall and always seeks ways to improve her line of work. For this reason she has called upon Ceprodel to request financing to buy more handicrafts and wooden crafts to offer for sale thereby continuing to generate income to support her humble abode.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood handicrafts and other crafts

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
La señora Gloria M., con gran ahínco se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de frutas como manzanas, bananos, naranjas, jocotes, mangos, melones, entre otros ofrecidos en su establecimiento todas las mañanas desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Ella se ha esforzado grandemente por buscar la manera de salir adelante y así mejorar las condiciones de su actividad.
Ella es madre soltera y con dos hijos a los que debe pagar sus estudios por ser menores de edad, el crédito lo solicita para comprar las frutas y de esta manera continuar vendiéndolas en su localidad en el mercado central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria M. diligently attends to her business selling fruits such as apples, bananas, oranges, jocotes, mangos, and melons. Her establishment is open every morning from the very early hours of the morning. She has worked very hard to look for a way to get ahead and improve the conditions of her business. She is a single mother with two children who must pay for their schooling, since they are minors. She is requesting a loan to buy fruit, so that she can continue her sales from her stall in the central market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es: El señor José Vicente es sastre desde hace veinte años, también tiene una mini librería para poder estar en equilibrio ya que muchas veces el trabajo se le escasea por que hay meses que no tiene mucha costura. El inicio con este trabajo después que tomo un curso y puso un rotulo en su casa en donde ofrecía rápida costura y así fue captando clientela. A si mismo comenzó vendiendo libros y ha agrandado mas. Con este financiamiento desea comprar libros, lapiceros, bolsos, lápiz de colores en cantidad para tener surtido su librería y no comprar más caro los productos en el mes de Enero que se elevan los precios y le saca pocas ganancias. Sus planes es  poder hacer mejoras a su casa como: repellar paredes, embaldosar el piso por que es suelo, para tener una mejor presentación, a si como una mejor higiene al poner el piso. Contento por esta inversión que hará posible el incremento de su negocio.
texts.en:
José Vicente has been a tailor for the last 20 years. He also has a mini-bookstore which helps him break even because often work as a tailor falls off and some months he has little tailoring work to do. He began work as a tailor after taking a course. He hung a small sign in a window in his house offering quick tailoring and began to gather customers. He started selling books the same way and has been growing more. This financing will be used to buy books, mechanical pencils, bags, colored pencils at wholesale to stock his bookstore now and not have to buy product in January when prices go up and his profits are, therefore, lower. His plan is to be able to make improvements to his house like: replaster walls, tile the floor (it's currently dirt) for a better appearance and hygiene. He is happy with this investment that will make possible his business' growth.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma Rubí G., tiene la edad de 47 años, es casada, y no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  ganado para leche.El negocio del ganado le ayudará a su familia ya que va a poder vender la leche y producir queso para la venta.Además, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos y la producción del café. No es la primera vez que doña Irma se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. 
Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Irma Rubí G., 47, is married and has no children. She wants the financing to buy dairy cattle. The cattle-raising business will help her family in that she will be able to sell the milk and make cheese to sell. Besides, she also raises pigs and farms coffee. This is not Irma's first loan with FUDECOSUR. She states that the credit committee has helped her a lot and offered easy payment terms. She hopes this project will grow and that she will reach her goals so that she can offer her family a better quality of life and economic stability in the future. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy heifers.

loans.name: Eufemio Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Eufemio Nicolás O. trabaja de albañil desde joven aprendió el oficio. Cuando se termina el contrato de la obra abecés se le hace difícil trabajar a la semana. Es por eso con ahorros puso una pequeña pulpería para poder mantenerse en los días difíciles, tiene 47 años de edad, su esposa procreo tres hijos y ella lo apoya en la pulpería ambos es superar para poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios y lograr que sean personas con un nivel mejor. Ya que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad para estudiar. Con el crédito anterior compro una computadora para poder apoyar a sus hijos con los trabajos de sus colegios. Con este nuevo financiamiento invertirá en la pulpería el cual comprara arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón de lavar, productos de condimentos, shampoo, gaseosas, golosinas, productos enlatados y una variedad de alimentos que día a día es la alimentación. Su meta es pode seguir trabajando y incrementar la venta. Ya que con el tiempo solo se dedicara al comercio. Da las gracias Afodenic por el financiamiento ya que se hace posible mejorar la vida de muchas familias de recurso económico y social.
texts.en:
Eufemio Nicolás O., 47, has worked as a mason since he learned the skills as a young man. However, when work contracts end, often it is difficult for him to find work that lasts an entire week. For this reason, he used his savings to set up a small grocery store to support himself during off days. His wife helps out in the store. They have three children. Both he and his wife share the goal of helping their children to get an education and seeing that they become adults with a better socio-economic status since they, themselves, didn't have the opportunity to go to school With his previous loan he bought a computer to help his children with their school work. This new loan will be used to buy stock items for his store: rice, beans, sugar, oil, laundry soap, condiments, shampoo, soft-driks, sweets, canned goods, and a variety of food items that are used daily in meal preparation. His goal is to continue working and increase sales because, in time, his only job will commerce. He thanks Afodenic for the financing because it makes it possible for many families of limited social and economic resources to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned goods and others.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 21 años y vive en casa D. sus padres.
Toda su vida ha estado relacionado a las actividades agrícolas, él cultiva principalmente L. alcachofa, que es uno D. los productos más comunes D. su localidad. Diariamente cuida D. sus tierras donD. hace poco sembró también papa, Juan verifica que sus platas estén desarrollándose correctamente y prevenir D. las plagas y enfermedades.
Adicionalmente, cría cuyes, para los cuales acondicionó un espacio D. su vivienda. Juan menciona que sus padres son el principal apoyo que tiene, pero a su vez él también es un importante apoyo para L. economía D. su casa.
Sus planes a futuro son D. seguir dedicándose a L. agricultura, pero utilizando mejores tecnológicas para incrementar su producción.

Esta es L. primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, él es el único varón D. su banco comunal y se ha integrado favorablemente a su grupo, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra D. remedios y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, 21, lives with his parents. All his life he has been involved in farming. His main crop is artichokes, one of the most common products in his location. Every day he cares for his fields where he also planted potatoes a short while ago. Juan insures that his plants are developing correctly and prevents illnesses and pests from attacking. Currently, he also raises guinea pigs, for which he equipped space in his home. Juan states that his parents are his main source of support but that he, too, is an important contributor to the household economy. His future plans are to continue to farm but with better technologies to increase crop yields. This is his first loan with MFP. He is the only male member of his communal bank and he has become well integrated into his group so he pledges to be very responsible with his repayments. The funds requested will be used to buy remedies and fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and medicines for his crops.

loans.name: Lidubina

texts.es:
Lidubina tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años en la casa de sus padres.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la crianza de vacas y toros. Junto a su esposo se encargan de velar por los animales, para que mientras permanezcan en su establo estén saludables. Asimismo, él conoce algunas técnicas para la inseminación de las vacas y así tengan más becerros y produzcan más leche, la cual venden diariamente
Lidubina y su esposo sueñan con tener un terreno propio donde puedan construir su casa y tener un establo más amplio. 

Esta es la tercera vez que ella tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
Lidubina, 24, lives with her husband and 6-year-old son in her parents' house. For the last 6 years she has raised cows and bulls. She and her husband care for the animals so that they will be healthy while they are stabled. Also, he is skilled in certain insemination techniques so the cows will have more calves and produce more milk, which are sold daily. Lidubina and her husband hope to have land of their own where they can build their house and a larger stable. This is her third loan with MFP and she is very happy to be part of a communal bank so she commits, once more, to be punctual with her repayments. The funds requested will be used to buy a cow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 28 años, vive en casa de uno familiares con sus 2 hijos.
Desde hace 6 años trabaja comprando y vendiendo animales, en su casa tiene un establo donde tiene a sus vacas, a las que engorda para ofrecerlas a mayor precio en el mercado ganadero de su localidad. Su metodología de trabajo es muy buena para ella porque recupera lo invertido en la alimentación de los animales y puede tener la disponibilidad de su dinero cuando lo necesite.
Sin embargo, algunas veces el clima lluvioso le impide transportar a sus animales hacia las ferias, pero eso no es un impedimento suficiente para concretar una venta, pues Lourdes de las ingenia siembre para vender sus animales. 
Para el futuro, ella desea tener más capital para que cuando compre animales no sea sólo una cabeza de ganado, sino más de tres.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser  parte integrante de este nuevo banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a trabajar honestamente. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de una vaquillona que hará engordar por 3 meses y posteriormente la revenderá a un precio más elevado.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 28, lives with her two children in relatives' house. For the past 6 years she has raised cattle. She has a stable where she raises her cows fattening them up for later sale at better prices at the local livestock market. Her work methodology is very good because she is able to recoup what she invests in the feed and can have money available when she needs it. Sometimes the rainy weather makes it impossible to transport her animals to market. However, this isn't an insurmountable obstacle because Lourdes always figures out a way to sell her animals. For the future, she would like to have sufficient capital available to buy animals in groups of three or more, not just one at a time. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to be a member of this new communal bank so she commits to work honestly. The funds requested will be used to buy a young heifer which she will fatten for three months to sell later at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Teodora T. se dedica a la venta de plátanos donde los ofrece a diario en su propio establecimiento. 

Es importante destacar que ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 25 largos años y gracias a su disciplina en la actividad es que ha logrado salir adelante mejorando las condiciones. Solicita el crédito para la compra de los plátanos y de esta manera continuar comercializándolos para así llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market of Managua Mrs. María Teodora T. works selling plantains. She sells daily at her own establishment. It is important to mention that she has worked in this field for 25 years and thanks to her discipline she has been able to continue to improve her living condiditons. She applied for the loan to purchase plantains and continue selling them in order to provide sustenance to those in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plantains

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 26 años, vive con su  esposo y su pequeña hija de 2 años en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años que tiene una fábrica de ladrillos donde trabaja con su familia, para ello se asoció con su hermana y su madre para producir en grandes cantidades y luego repartirlas a sus clientes. Las ganancias obtenidas se reparten entre todos, siendo esta actividad la principal fuente de ingresos económicos de Maria y su esposo.

Esta es la 8va oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, siendo reconocida como una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que esta vez solicita lo utilizará en la compra de los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de ladrillos, tales como aserrín y arena.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old. She lives in her house with her husband and two-year old daughter. For five years she has worked making bricks with her family. She partnered with her sister and mother to produce large quantities of bricks and to sell them to clients. They share the earnings equally, and this is the principal income for Maria and her husband. This is the eighth loan that she has had with MFP, and she has been recognized as being very punctual with her payments. The money from this loan will be used to purchase the materials necessary to make bricks like sawdust and sand.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for the production of bricks

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 48 años, vive con su hija de 5 años en la casa que heredó de su madre.
Desde hace 6 años ejerce la profesión de docente y paralelo a ello se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, siendo sus colegas sus principales clientes.
Maura disfruta mucho de su trabajo diario con los niños a quienes enseña, pero también este lugar es el medio para ofrecer sus productos. Ella utiliza el catálogo de la línea cosmética para la que trabaja y luego pacta con cada una de sus clientes el pago al crédito. De esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su pequeña hija. 
Para el futuro, Maura desea vender ropa además de los cosméticos, para ello seguirá trabajando duro para reunir el capital necesario y adquirir una buena cantidad de prendas de vestir. 

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta renovar su crédito y seguir siendo parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Maura is 48 years old and lives with her five-year old daughter in the house that she inherited from her mother. For six years she has worked as a teacher while also selling cosmetics. Her co-workers are her main clients. Maura takes great joy in her daily work with the children that she teaches, and it is also where she can sell her products. She uses a catalogue from a cosmetic line and then allows her clients to pay by credit. This way she earns the money necessary to provide for her young daughter. In the future, Maura wishes to sell clothing as well as cosmetics. With this goal in mind, she will continue to work hard to assemble the necessary capital and acquire a large quantity of clothing. This is the seventh loan she has received from MFP. She is happy to renew her credit and continue being a part of the community bank. The money from this loan will be used to buy more beauty products to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of cosmetic products

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y cuyes. Para la alimentación cuidado de sus animales cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo mayor.
Paralela a esta actividad brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros con un motocarro que logró comprar con los ahorros de su trabajo y a pesar de no ser muy común que una mujer maneje este tipo de vehículos, ella lo hace muy bien y sus clientes le tienen mucha confianza.
Nora disfruta mucho de ambos trabajos porque le permiten ingresos diarios y costear los gastos de su familia. 
Su deseo a futuro es tener más animales, pero de una mejor raza, así como tener casa propia donde pueda implementar un establo más amplio. 

Esta es la primera vez que viene solicitando un crédito con MFP, esta es una experiencia novedosa para ella, así como ser parte de un banco comunal; sin embargo está muy entusiasmada, porque sabe que de esta manera podrá progresar, por lo que se compromete a puntual en todos sus pagos. 

El dinero que solicita le servirá para completar el valor de una vaca más para su establo, siendo el precio total un aproximado de 1500 soles.
texts.en:
Nora is 30, and she lives in a rented house with her husband and 3 children. For the past 4 years she has raised cattle, and guinea pigs. Her oldest son helps her with the feeding of the animals. Besides the animals she has a transport service for passengers with a motorbike that she was able to buy with the savings from her work. Despite the fact that it is not common for a woman to drive this type of vehicle, she does it very well and her customers have a lot of faith in her. Nora enjoys both jobs because they give her daily profits that help her pay for her family’s expenses. Her goal for the future is to have more animals, but of better breeds, as well as to have her own house where she can set up a bigger stable. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from MFP. This is a new experience for her, to be part of a communal bank. Nevertheless she is very enthusiastic, because she knows that in this way she can progress, and she will make her payments on time. The money that she is asking for will help her pay for another cow for her stable, since the price is approximates 1500 soles. de 1500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es: Doña Hilda G.  es una mujer esforzada, madre soltera de dos hijos, ella trabaja en servicios domésticos desde hace ocho años, lo difícil ha sido lograr la confianza de sus patrones, su casa es pequeña y falta repellarla, su piso es de suelo, el baño lo tiene adentro por que no cuenta con más recurso para hacerlo afuera. Su sueldo es poco, con lo que se ayuda es con una pequeña pensión que da el papa de los niños con lo cual paga colegio, agua, luz y con su pago cubre la alimentación. Su objetivo es trabajar hasta cuando sus hijos puedan  sobresalir adelante. Lo que mas desea es poder seguir mejorando su casa, con el crédito anterior logro comprar las puertas para lograr tener mejor seguridad, con este financiamiento quiere  comprar un inodoro, ya que tiene una letrina que esta ya vieja y quiere lograr tener mejor higiene. Lo cual comprara cemento, arena, para hacer sumidero y que se la instalen y poder cada día hacer una vivienda digan para sus hijos. Contenta con la institución por permitir el crédito a mujeres pobres que gracia a su financiamiento ha logrado mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Hilda G. is a hard-working woman, the single mother of two children. She's been working as a domestic worker since she was eight years old. The difficulty has been to gain the confidence of her employers. Her house is small, the walls are unplastered and it has an earthen floor. The bathroom is inside because she doesn't have the means to build one outside. She has her small wages along with a small income she receives from the father of her children with which she pays for school expenses, water and lighting. She uses her wages to pay for food. Her goal is to work until her children are able to make their own way in the world. What she wants most is to be able to continue fixing up her house. With the previous loan she was able to buy the doors in order to have better security. With this loan she wants to buy a toilet, since she now has a latrine which is old and she wants to be able to have better hygiene. She will buy cement and sand to make a drain and to pay to have it installed. And to be able every day to have a dwelling fit for her children. She is pleased with AFODENIC for providing loans to poor women who, thanks to this financing, are able to improve their housing.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her bathroom.

loans.name: Adonis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Adonis Antonio B. G. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Managua, desempeñándose como entrenador de deporte de basketball. Tiene dos años de ser cliente de CEPRODEL en los que ha obtenido 2 créditos, los cuales los ha pagado muy bien.

El señor B. ha utilizado sus préstamos para mejorar su vivienda el primero y el segundo para cubrir los gastos de promoción de su hijo y compra de materiales de construcción como Zinc, Perlin para mejorar parte de la cocina de su casa, la que estaba en mal estado. Es un padre de familia de tres niños menores de edad en edad escolar y casado.
texts.en:
Mr. Adonis B. works for the mayor's office in Managua as a basketball trainer. He has been a client of CEPRODEL for two years, during which time he has obtained two loans and paid them back promptly.

Mr. B. has used his loans to improve his house. With the first and second loans he covered the costs of school promotion for his child and to buy construction materials such as galvanized roofing and rafters to improve part of the kitchen, which was in bad condition.

He is married and the father of 3 school-age children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COSTS OF SCHOOL PROMOTION FOR HIS SON

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 36 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa de uno de sus familiares.
Desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad (comestibles), para ello acondicionó un espacio de su vivienda, donde presta atención durante casi todo el día.
Este negocio es muy cómodo para ella, pues está en su casa y disfruta de la compañía de sus hijos. Rocío siempre está al tanto de todo lo que se necesite para abastecer su tienda con la cantidad necesaria de mercadería, y debido al buen trato que ofrecer ha logrado que su clientela vaya en aumento
Durante estos dos años de trabajo, Rocío ha visto los resultados de su trabajo y ello la anima a seguir invirtiendo en al crecimiento de su tienda. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal y tiene grande expectativas de realizar un trabajo solidario para el progreso de todo el grupo. El dinero que solicita le servirá para comprar más mercadería, especialmente en panetones (queque con pasas y frutas), chocolate para taza y tarros de leche, productos muy demandados en la época navideña que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Rocío, 36, lives with her children in a relative's house. For the last two years she has run a grocery store from a space she equipped in her dwelling. She tends to customers almost the entire day. This line of work is very comfortable for her because she can work from home and enjoy the company of her children. Rocío is always careful to see that her store is stocked with all the merchandise she needs and, thanks to the good customer service she provides, her regular clientele has been steadily growing. During these two years of work she has seen the results of her good work and she is motivated by them to continue investing in her store's growth. This is her first financing with MFP and she is very happy to be part of a comunal bank; she has high expectations of working well in a group so that all the members can progress. The funds requested will be used to buy stock inventory, especially panetones (a traditional cake made with raisins and fruits), hot chocolate mix, jars of milk, and other often requested items for the approaching Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos, mayores de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de néctar, esta actividad lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con algunos trabajadores para desarrollar este negocio que esta creciendo poco a poco. Teresa forma parte del Banco Comunal “ De la Amistad” desde hace once años, tiempo que ha podido superar las dificultades económicas gracias a los préstamos que recibe del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de frutas para vender desde su casa, en la actualidad ella necesita un préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de frutas para vender desde su casa. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será utilizado, una parte  para la compra de frutas, tapas y botellas, otra parte será utilizado para comprar platos vasos descartables  y otros productos de decoración para bufetes. La meta de Teresa es tener una fábrica bien implementada, con equipos modernos para la elaboración de néctar y brindar una oportunidad de trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a dynamic and hard-working member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is a 47 year old single mother of three grown children. She makes nectar in her house. She has some workers to develop this business, which is growing little by little. Teresa has been part of the De la Amistad Communal Bank for eleven years. In that time she has been able to overcome her economic difficulties thanks to the loans from the Manuela Ramos Movement. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy fruit to sell from her house. She currently needs a loan for 3,000 PEN. She will use part of it to buy fruit, tops, and bottles. She will use the other part to buy disposable plates and glasses and other decorative products for buffets. Teresa’s goal is to have a well equipped factory with modern equipment for making nectar. That way she will give other people the opportunity to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, tops, and bottles.  She will use the other part to buy disposable plates and glasses and other decorative products for buffets

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace más de 32 años se dedica a elaborar bellos trajes típicos de su  región, a base de bordados y aplicaciones en telas doradas, hilos de colores y lentejuelas; de esta manera ha conseguido durante estos años sostener a su familia. En la actualidad, uno de sus hijos tiene el mismo interés por el arte que desarrolla y ha aprendido mucho de su padre, siendo su brazo derecho en estas actividades. 
Rolando divide su tiempo para confeccionar estos trajes y para criar a los animales que tiene en su casa, esto con el apoyo de su esposa. 
Sus clientes conocen de la calidad de sus trabajos por lo que siempre acuden a solicitar sus prendas y esto lo motiva para seguir desarrollarse en esta actividad. 

Este es su 14avo crédito con MFP, él es parte de un banco comunal y tiene como virtud la  perseverancia y la responsabilidad, siendo considerado en su grupo como el sostén moral. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales básicos para realizar sus trajes, tales como: hilos, aplicaciones de lentejuelas, pegamento, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rolando is 53 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children in their own house.

For the last 32 years, he has dedicated himself to elaborating beautiful costumes typical of his region, based on embroidery and applications to gold cloth, plus colored thread and spangles. In this manner he has managed to sustain his family all these years. At present, one of his children shares the same interest in the art and has learned much from his father, serving as his right hand in these activities.

Rolando divides his time between making these costumes and raising animals at home, with the help of his wife.

His customers know the quality of his work and for this reason they keep coming back for his costumes. This motivates him to continue advancing his efforts in this activity.

This is his 14th credit with MFP. He belongs to a community bank and due to his perseverance and responsibility, he is considered the moral support of his group. The money he requests now is to buy basic materials for creating his costumes: thread, spangle applications, and glue, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TEXTILES AND MATERIALS FOR COSTUMES

loans.name: Ernesto Jose

texts.es: El señor Ernesto R. es un padre de familia de una niña de 8 años de edad, lo cual junto con su esposa están trabajando para poder terminar de hacer su casa. El trabaja en café soluble  desde de abastecedor de productos en todos los departamentos. Cuando inicio  fue un largo periodo de  prueba hasta que logro quedarse fijo. Su esposa trabaja en zona franca y su hija la cuida un familiar.  Su casa es pequeña ha ido poco a poco le falta repellarla en fino, pintar y ponerle piso. Con este financiamiento lograra hacer un bajarete por que le entra mucho el sol y para poder gozar de una tarde menos calientes. Para construir comprara zinc y perlines, tuvo de hierro  para hacer el comienzo para luego cerrarlo. Agradece ala institución por el financiamiento por que solo a través de los préstamos a plazo se logra las mejoras de construcción debido a que los productos están carros.
texts.en:
Ernesto R. and his wife are parents of an 8-year-old girl. They are both working hard to finish building their house. He works in instant coffee, supplying products to all the departments. When he began, he had to pass a long probation period before being hired permanently. His wife works in a free-zone and a friend babysits their daughter. Their house is very small and has been built bit by bit. It still needs to have the final plaster layer applied, needs to be painted, and lacks a floor. This financing will be used to build a shelter to protect against the sun so that they can enjoy their afternoons with less heat. To build, he needs zinc metal sheeting, metal sheets, metal tubing, etc. to start and then close it up. He is grateful to the institution for the financing because it's only thanks to the long-term loans that one can manage home improvements because building materials are very expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teófila tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 17 en la casa de sus suegros.
Hace 6 años tiene una granja de cuyes; sin embargo, debido a una enfermedad atacó a sus animales y varios de ellos murieron, por lo que dejó de desarrollar esta actividad.
Pero ahora; con la experiencia ganada, una buena capacitación y correcta adecuación del espacio para su granja ha notado las mejoras y el aumento de sus cuyes.
Ahora, Teófila vende sus animalitos cada semana (todos los jueves) en la feria comercial de su localidad y otras veces sus clientes acuden hasta su casa.
Su deseo a futuro es expandir su negocio hasta el punto de poder exportar sus cuyes a otras ciudades.

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella ya conoce bastante el trabajo que se realiza siendo parte de un banco comunal, y en la actualidad enseña a los nuevos integrantes el tipo de trabajo solidario. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará madera y malla metálica para instalar nuevos galpones en su granja.
texts.en:
Teófila, 40, lives with her husband and 17-year-old son in her in-laws' house. She has had a guinea pig farm for the last 6 years. However, an illness attacked her animals and several died so she had to abandon this activity. But now, with the experience gained, with proper training, and the correct adaptation of space for her farm she has noted improvement and increase in the number of her guinea pigs. Now, Teófila sells her animals weekly (every Thursday) in the local commercial market; sometimes her customers come to her house to buy. Her wish for the future is to expand her business to be able to export her guinea pigs to other cities. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is very aware of the work that's done here being a member of a communal bank and she currently trains new members on communal bank methodologies. The funds requested will be used to buy lumber and metal mesh to install new sheds in her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her guinea pig farm.

loans.name: Verónica Margot

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora Verónica Margot R. le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía.
 Tenemos ya más de un año con este negocio en ventas de artículos y ropa usada, lo atendemos toda la familia. 
Estamos  solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía de navidad que nos están ofreciendo a muy buen precio, pero en este momento no contamos con el dinero para la inversión al negocio.
Planean pagar el crédito con las ganancias de negocio ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirán con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo como coordinadora de producción de una fabrica.
texts.en:
The business of Sra. Verónica Margot R. lacks a wide variety of merchandise.

She has been selling used clothing for over a year. Her entire family helps attend to the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season, which she plans to offer at a very good price. At the moment, she does not have the available funds to make this business investment.

Verónica will repay this loan using the profits from her clothing business. Her family expenses are covered by the salary from her job as a production coordinator at a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Bartolo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Bartolo José Hernández A., labora como encargado del mantenimiento y limpieza en el mercado Roberto Huembé Managua, el tiene a su cargo seis  hijos de los cuales cuatros se encuentran en edad escolar,  es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido   en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los  Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para el reforzamiento de las paredes de la vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bartolo José Hernández A. is employed by the maintenance department of the Roberto Huembé Managua market. He is a single father and has six children, four of whom are school-age. He has had loans with Ceprodel for three years and he has used the financing to make home improvements; he has proven to be an excellent client. The financing requested will be used to buy building materials to reenforce the walls of his dwelling so that his children will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 38 años de edad y está casada. Se dedica a  la venta de artesanías.

La señora Rosa estudió primaria completa y  tiene 4 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de lana.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de un toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y los ahorros
texts.en:
Sra, Rosa is a member of the Banco Comunal "24 de Junio" (June 24 Community Bank). She lives in the Ilave district in El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is 38 years old, married and has four children. She earns a living selling crafts. Sra. Rosa is educated to primary school level. For the last year she has worked with the Manuela R. Movement; her first loan was for 300 soles and she used it to buy wool. She is now requesting a loan for 1,500 soles, which she will use to invest in the purchase of a bull. Her wish for the future is to have a store in Ilave where her children can work. The thing that she likes most about the Manuela R. Movement are the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Ana Melva

texts.es:
La señora ANA MELVA R. G., tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos  de los cuales 1 depende económicamente de ella. Ana se dedica a la venta de menús en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró arroz, papas, menestras, fideos, etc. para la preparación de sus menús.
Con su próximo crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará vajillas, cubiertos, tapers y sillas.
Ella sueña con tener un restaurante propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Melva R. G. is 52 years old. She lives in the the district of Porvenir, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad. She belongs to the community bank Creative Seeds. She completed her studies up to the 11th grade. She has four children, one of whom still depends on her economicaly. Ana works selling food from her house. With her first loan of 300 new soles she bought rice, potatoes, vegetable stock, noodles, etc. to prepare her meals. With her next loan of 1,000 new soles she will buy dishes, silverware, candles, and chairs. She dreams of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dishes, silverware, candles, and chairs

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es:
Ulises A. S., tiene la edad de 69 años, es casado, y tiene 1 hijo, que junto con su esposa son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  ganado.El negocio del ganado le ayudará a su familia a crecer como ganadero, ya que quiere el ganado para la cría.Tambien el se dedica a la agricultura. No es la primera vez don Ulises se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le brindaron muchas facilidades. 
El espera que con este proyecto crezca y pueda superarse como persona y así poder en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ulises A. S. is 69 years old, married, and has one child. His family is his highest priority. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cattle. Ulises wants to start raising cattle because he believes the livestock business will help his family grow as farmers. He also produces his own crops.

This is not the first time Don Ulises has received financing from FUDECOSUR. He says the loan committee has provided him much assistance and offered many services. Ulises hopes that his livestock project will grow and help him to develop as a person. This will enable him to provide a better future, an improved quality of life, and more financial stability for his family.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 D. Junio”, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es casada. Se dedica compra y venta D. artefactos.

La señora Rosa estudió primaria completa y  tiene 7  hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. artefactos para su negocio.

Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  D. una oveja.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprar su casa en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su organización es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a partner in the 24 D. Junio Community Bank. She lives in the district of Ilave, province of EL Callao, in the department of Puno. She is 60 years old and is married. She works buying and selling different articles. Mrs. Rosa completed primary school and has seven children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years and she used her first loan of 300 new soles from the community bank helped her buy articles for her business. She applied for a loan of 300 new soles, which she will use to purchase a sheep. Her hope for the future is to buy a house in Illave and that her children become professionals. What she likes most about the organization is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sheep

loans.name: Eliecer

texts.es:
Eliecer C. V., tiene la edad de 34 años, esta en unión libre, y tiene 3 hijos, que junto con su esposa son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  ganado de leche.El negocio del ganado le ayudará a su familia a crecer como ganadero, además él desea vender  los derivados de la vaca como lo son  la leche, quesos y otro. También él se dedica a la agricultura. Es la primera vez don Eliecer se financia con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le brindaron muchas facilidades. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y pueda superarse como persona y así poder en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Eliecer C. V., 34, is in a common-law relationship and has 3 children who, together with his wife, are his greatest priority in life. The financing he requests is to buy dairy cattle. Cattle will help his family and himself to grow as a cattleman; besides, he wants to sell the products derived from his cows like milk, cheese, and others. He also farms. This is Eliecer's first loan with FUDECOSUR. He states that the credit committee has helped him much and provided easy loan terms. He hopes to grow with this project and to excel as a person in order to offer his family a better quality of life and economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.
La señora tiene estudios  concluidos de primaria y en su poder aun tiene a 3 hijos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años atrás, su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales menores.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ganado: ovejas.
Su deseo para el futuro es abrir una tienda en Ilave.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización es el ahorro que puede hacer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia is a partner in the 24 de Junio Community Bank. She lives in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old and is married. She works buying and selling young animals. She completed primary school and still maintains three of her children. She joined the Manuela Ramos Movement more than two years ago. Her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used to purchase young animals. She applied for a loan of 500 new soles which she will use to buy sheep. Her hope for the future is to open a store in Ilave. What she likes most about the organiation are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Judith Luzmila

texts.es:
La señora Judith  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 27 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales.

La señora Judith estudio superior completa y  tiene 1  hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás, y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invertirá en la compra  de un toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es abrir una veterinaria en Ilave o Puno..

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Communal Bank "24 de Junio" (June 24th) and lives in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 27 year-old and married. She works buying and reselling animals. Judith has completed some post-secondary education and has one child. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan was for S/300.00 (nuevos soles) which she used to purchase animals. She is now asking for a loan of S/3000.00 nuevos soles, which she would use to invest in the purchase of a bull. Her wish for the future is to open a veterinary clinic in Ilave or Puno. What she likes most about this organization is the savings and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry Zuñiga M., tiene la edad de 18 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  cerdos de cría y arreglar la porqueriza de los mismos. Es la primera vez que don Henry se financia con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. El tambien estudia y trabaja en la agricultura.
El espera que con este proyecto pueda crecer y así pueda en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Henry Zuñiga M. is 18 years old, single and without children. He is requesting a loan to buy pigs (for raising) and to fix the pigpen. This is the first loan that Henry is requesting through FUDECOSUR. He says that the credit committee has been very helpful and has made it very simple for him to request the loan. Henry studies and works in agriculture. He hopes that this project will enable him to grow, to have a better quality of life and be financially stable. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and education programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs for raising.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 70 años de edad y es viuda. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
La señora Flora no estudio y  tiene 2 hijos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás, y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ganado: ovejas.
Su deseo para el futuro es poder alimentarse bien para tener salud y progresar con su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones que se dan.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Communal Bank "24 de Junio" (June 24th) and lives in the Ilave district of the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 70 years-old and a widow. She works buying and selling livestock. Flora did not attend school and has two children. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years, and her first loan was S/300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase livestock. Flora is asking for this loan of S/300.00 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of livestock: sheep. Her wishes for the future are to be able to feed herself well, to be healthy, and to make progress with her business. What she likes most about the organization is the savings and the meetings it holds.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer
