loans.use: Purchase of sheep.

loans.name: Braulio José

texts.es:
El señor Braulio José A. L. es trabajador de la alcaldía de Managua. Actualmente tiene tres personas a su cargo, su esposa y sus dos hijos en edad escolar.

Los dos créditos obtenidos con CEPRODEL han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda como es compra de materiales construcción para remodelar su cocina y baño. Este último lo utilizará para remodelar su vehículo compra de pintura y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Braulio José A. L. works in the mayor's office in Managua. He currently supports three people: his wife and his two school-aged children.

The two loans he has obtained through CEPRODEL have been used to improve his home - for the purchase of construction materials to remodel his kitchen and bathroom. He will use this new loan to repair his vehicle, to buy paint and to pay for labor costs.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of paint and labor costs for his vehicle

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente. Se dedica a la fabrica de sogas..
La señora tiene estudios  de secundaria incompleta y en su poder aun tiene a 3 hijos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses atrás, y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.700.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de materiales para la fabricación de sogas.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una casa en Ilave.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is a member of the Community Bank “24 de Junio” (24th of June). She lives in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, lives with her partner, and she makes ropes. She did not complete her high school studies, and she has three children.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for four months, and her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used for the purchase of livestock. She is requesting a loan of 700 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of materials for making ropes. Her wish for the future is to have a house in Ilave. What she likes the most about her organization are the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, wool, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Lourdes

texts.es:
Mercedes está  casada desde hace 17 años y tiene tres hijos, ha  formando  una familia muy unida  lo que les ha permito salir delante de algunos momentos difíciles por los que han tenido que atravesar; su esposo  se desempeña como albañil,  tienen  muchos años viviendo en la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco en la  ciudad de Portoviejo un sitio retirado del centro de la urbe.

Mercedes es una señora de 38 años Portovejense que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza Yanbal lleva un año realizando esta actividad y en cada pedido invierte entre 80 y 90 dólares, visita a sus clientes de manera informal puerta a puerta dejando los productos  a crédito a gente del sector donde ella vive,  además vende tarjetas para telefonía celular en su propia casa.

Nuestra socia  está muy satisfecha de formar parte del Banco Comunal Los Claveles porque gracias a la Fundación Espoir  ha podido incrementar su negocio, por ahora con el préstamo que recibirá invertirá en comprar más productos Yanbal  como perfumes, cremas, labiales, polvos compactos, rímel, etc. y además comprara un teléfono para vender recargas para móviles desde su casa, es una manera importante de poder aportar en casa con la familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes has been married for 17 years, and has three children. She has formed a very united family, which is what has allowed them to get ahead in some difficult moments which they have had to cross. Her husband is employed as a builder, they have for many years been living in the residential community Francisco Pacheco in the city of Portoviejo, which is a place out of the center of the city.

Mercedes is a 38 year old Portoviejan woman, who sells Yanbal beauty products. She has been in this business for one year, and in every order, she invests between 80 and 90 dollars. She visits her customers in an informal manner door to door, leaving the products on credit to people from the area where she lives. She also sells cell phone cards in her own house.

Our member is very satisfied to be part of the Community Bank Los Claveles (The Carnations), because thanks to the Fundación Espoir, she has been able to grow her business. For now with the loan she will receive, she will invest in the purchase of more Yanbal products, such as perfumes, creams, lip products, powder compacts, mascara, etc. She will also buy a telephone in order to sell mobile recharges from her house. It is an important way to be able to contribute in the house with the family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, lip products, powder compacts, etc. and also buy a telephone to recharge mobiles

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
El Señor Manuel Salvador E. R., labora como encargado del mantenimiento y limpieza en el mercado Roberto Huembé Managua, el tiene a su cargo tres  hijos de los cuales dos  se encuentran en edad escolar,  es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido   en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 4 Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción para cambiar el piso de la  vivienda en que habita y para el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Manuel Salvador E. R. works as the head of maintenance and cleaning in the Roberto Huembé Managua market. He cares for three children, two of whom are of school age, and he is single. He has had loans with Ceprodel for three years, and with these 4 loans, he has been able to improve his living conditions. He is an excellent client.

He seeks this loan to buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs to replace the floors in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for construction materials and labor costs to replace the floors in his home

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.es:
Geraldine M. C., tiene la edad de 21 años, es casada, y no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de cerdos de cría y arreglar la porqueriza de los mismos. No es la primera vez que doña Geraldine se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. Ella estudia y trabaja en el cuido de los cerdos.
Ella espera que con este proyecto pueda crecer como persona y pueda expandirse y así pueda en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Geraldine M. C. is 21 years old and is married with no children. She seeks this loan to purchase pigs and to set up their pigpens. This is not the first time Geraldine has received a loan from FUDECOSUR. She has said that the loan committee has helped her greatly and has made the loan process very easy. She studies and raises pigs. She hopes that with this project she can grow as a person and in the future have a better quality of life and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Olaga Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Olga  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

La señora Olga  estudió secundaria completa y tiene 1  hijo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 meses atrás, y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de lana y con esto hacer sus artesanías.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de lana, para poder hacer sus artesanías y así poder venderlos.

Su deseo para el futuro es abrir una tienda de artesanías en Ilave.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga is a member of the Community Bank “24 de Junio” (24th of June). She lives in the district of Ilave, province of El Callao, in the department of Puno. She is 30 years old and is married. She sells handicrafts. Sra. Olga completed high school, and has one son. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for 3 months, and her first loan was for 500 soles, which was used for the purchase of wool, with which she makes her handicrafts.

She is requesting a loan of 800 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of wool, in order to be able to make her handicrafts and to be able to sell them. Her wish for the future is to open a handicraft shop in Ilave. What she likes most about the organization is the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy paint and pay labor costs to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Gisella Lisbeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo en la ciudadela el Progreso se reúne el Banco comunal Los Claveles cada 15 días, la señora Gissela forma parte de este banco desde hace dos ciclos  y gracias a esta gran ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Espoir ha podido continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa.

Gissela está casada,  con apenas 17 años esta a espera de su segundo hijo, nos cuenta que se hizo de compromiso a los 16 años aun sin terminar sus estudios, se  dedica a la venta informal de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños realizando visitas puerta a puerta a sus vecinos  dando facilidades de pago,  con su trabajo aporta con los gastos de su hogar siendo de  gran ayuda para su esposo,  la abuela del niños se encarga de cuidarlo mientras ella sale a realizar sus ventas, antes de embarazarse  de su segundo niño ella  viajaba a Otavalo y Guayaquil para comprar su mercadería a los mayoristas,  debido a su estado de gestación es su tía quien viaja a realizar las compras en provincia para abastecer su negocio.

 Con el préstamo que Gissela esta solicitando surtirá su negocio  para la época de navidad y fin de año donde  tiene más pedidos por parte de sus clientes, comprará pantalones, blusas, camisas y más prendas  para damas, caballeros y niños.

El sueño de Gissela  es tener su propia casa y  su  almacén de ropa para lo cual empezará ahorrar  poco a poco, está segura de  algún día lograrlo pues  ella es una mujer muy joven y que lo que  mas le sobran son  ganas de trabajar y mas aun con la llegada de su segundo hijo en los próximos días.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, in the residential community of Progreso, the Community Bank Los Claveles (The Carnations) meets every 15 days. Sra. Gissela has been part of this bank for two cycles, and thanks to this big help that the Fundación Espoir has offered her, she has been able to continue her business of selling clothing.

Gissela is married, and with hardly 17 years of age, she is expecting her second son. She tells us that she made a commitment at 16 years of age that even without terminating her studies, she sells informal clothing for women, men, and children. She visits her neighbors door to door, and makes it easy for them to pay. With her job, she contributes to the household expenses and is a big help for her husband. The grandmother of the children is in charge of taking care of the children while she goes out to make her sales. Before getting pregnant with her second child, she traveled to Otavalo and Guayaquil to buy her merchandise wholesale. Due to her pregnant state, her aunt is who travels to make the purchases in the province in order to supply her business.

With the loan that Gissela is requesting, she will stock her business for the Christmas and end of year season, where she has more requests from her customers. She will buy pants, blouses, shirts, and more clothing for women, men, and children. Gissela's dream is to have her own house and clothing store, and for this will begin saving little by little. She is sure that someday she will achieve it. She is a young women and what she has more than anything are desires to work, and even more with the arrival of her second son in the next few days.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada.
Desde hace un año se dedica día a día a la atención de su tienda de comestibles. Su deseo de tener un negocio propio la llevó a determinar que este rubro sería rentable porque el local donde vende sus productos está ubicado cerca a un centro de estudios y eso garantiza sus ventas diarias, pues los estudiantes son sus más asiduos clientes.
Yovana atiende durante todo el día y todos los días de la semana, pues sólo así logra cubrir, no las necesidades de su hogar, sino también el pago del arrendamiento de su local.
Su deseo a futuro es tener un establecimiento comercial grande donde pueda vender diversos productos comestibles. 

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y dentro de su banco comunal se le considera como la más puntual en sus pagos y en la asistencia a las reuniones de grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en tarros de leche evaporada, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Yovana, 33, lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. For a year she has run a grocery store. Her wish to have a business of her own led her to determine that this type of business would be very profitable because the site where she has her store is located near a school and that guarantees her daily sales because students are her most regular customers. Yovana tends to her sales all day, every day of the week because only thus can she earn enough to cover not only her household expenses but also the rental of her store. Her future desire is to have a large commercial esablishment where she can sell a wide variety of food items. This is her third loan with MFP. She is considered to be most punctual with repayments and with meeting assistance by her fellow group members. The funds requested will be used to buy stock items like jars of evaporated milk, sweets, and soft-drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.es:
Grace M. Rubí, tiene la edad de 29 años, está en unión libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 8 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono para las hortalizas que tiene sembradas. El darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cultivos le va a permitir tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella tiene sembrado hortalizas y frutas, las cuales cuando estén listos para cosechar, las venderan.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le dieron.Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo y a toda su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Grace M. Rubí, 29, is in a common-law relationship and has one, 8-year-old, son who is her greatest priority in life. She wants financing to buy natural fertilizer for the vegetables she's planted. By providing her crops with proper maintenance she will have increased yields and better income. She has planted vegetables and fruits which, when they are harvested, will be sold. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the easy terms she was granted. She hopes in the future to give her son and her entire family a better quality of life with better economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural fertilizer for vegetables.

loans.name: Cinthya Gabriela

texts.es:
Cinthia es una joven madre que forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Claveles en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen en casa de una de las socias en una ciudadela Francisco Pacheco a las afueras de la ciudad.

Cinthia se caso a los 16 años de edad  tiene un  niño y esta esperando su segundo niño tiene 6 mes de gestación y junto al esposo han podido obtener su propio negocio, ella desde muy chica empezó el arte de trabajar con  su mamá, ahora tiene su negocio de comida rápida situado en un sector muy concurrido al aire libre donde acuden niños y adultos para  recrearse y hacer deporte.

Para nuestra socia no ha sido complicado preparar la comida pues tienen mucha experiencia y una vez que ya tiene todo listo se dirige hasta su lugar de  trabajo donde  a partir de las 3 de la tarde instala la carreta para atender a sus clientes hasta las 10 de la noche  una vez termiando con todo lo que llevó para  la venta, ella prepara comida rápida, sorbetes y tostadas, chuzos y más, nuestra socia invierte 45 dólares  por semana para preparar  sus platos.

Este negocio para Cinthia ha sido de gran ayuda porque puede colaborar con los gastos de su hogar y está muy agradecida con la fundación por  la ayuda que le  brinda, en esta ocasión esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo que le servirá  para remodelar su carreta, y comprar nuevas silla y mesas.

Cinthia anhela poder tener su casa y hacer crecer su  negocio en el mismo lugar que lo tiene, pero darles más opciones de comida a su exigente clientela.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a young mother who belongs to the communal bank Los Claveles, in the city of Portoviejo. They meet in the house of one of the members in the residential community of Francisco Pacheco in the outskirts of the city. Cinthia was married at the age of 16. She has one child and is 6 months pregnant with her second child. With her husband she has been able to have her own business. From the time she was very young she started working with her mother, now she has a fast food business located in a very busy outdoor area where many children and adults come for recreation and sports. For Cinthia it has not been complicated preparing the meals, since she has had a lot of experience. Once she has everything ready she goes to her place of work where, beginning at 3 in the afternoon, she sets up the cart where she attends to her customers until 10 at night. Once she finishes with everything she brought to sell, she prepares fast food: frozen desserts, tostadas, skewers of meat, and other items. She invests 45 dollars each week to prepare her dishes. For Cinthia, this business has been a great help because she can contribute to the household expenses. She is very grateful to the foundation for the help that it provides. This time she is requesting a new loan that she will use to remodel her cart and to buy new chairs and tables. Cinthia desires to be able to have her own house, and to make her business grow in the same place that she has, but to give more food options to her demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to remodel her cart and to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 57 años, vive con sus 2 hijos; Juan de 29 y Franklin de 27, en su casa propia en el distrito de San Martín de Porres de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida, prepara pasteles y variados entremeses para posteriormente salir a venderlos. Esta es una actividad que puede realizar libremente desde su domicilio, dándose el tiempo para realizar las labores del hogar. 
Rosa se encuentra feliz con su trabajo, pues siempre le agradó la cocina y preparar este tipo de bocaditos, por lo que más que un trabajo, es un pasatiempo que le gusta realizar, además obtiene buenos ingresos, lo cual la motiva a querer expandir su negocio, y es así que para el futuro quisiera tener un snack. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, menciona que es muy responsable con su trabajo por lo que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar sus bocaditos, pues comprar al por mayor le resulta más económico.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and lives with her two sons, Juan (29) and Franklin (27). Her house is located in the San Martín de Porras district in Lima.
For the past four years, she has been making and selling a variety food, pies and appetizers. She’s able to perform this business from her house, which allows her enough time to do her household duties.
Rosa is very happy with her work; she’s always liked to cook and prepare appetizers. More than a job, this is a hobby that she enjoys. It’s also good source of income, which motivates her to continue to grow her business and open her own snack bar in the future.
This is her first loan with MFP. She is very responsible with her work and she promises to make timely payments. With this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients at wholesale to lower her food preparation cost.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Karen Noemy

texts.es:
Karen Noemy H. Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 19 años, está  en unión libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 8 meses. El crédito lo quiere para al compra de abono para asistir una plantación de café. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo  para  que este le permita  tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le dieron. Doña Karen trabaja también en una soda, estudia y se dedica a la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo y a toda su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Karen Noemy H. Rodríguez, 19, is married by common law and has one son, who is her biggest priority. Her son is 8-months-old. She would like this credit to buy fertilizer to assist with her coffee crop. She wants to give her crop adequate maintenance so she will have a bigger production and therefore more income. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy with the ease with which they gave it to her. Doña Karen also works at a soda (a small restaurant), goes to school, and practices agriculture. In the future, she hopes to offer her son and all of her family a better quality of life and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Reynaldo Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Reynaldo G. tiene 4 personas a su cargo, su esposa y 3 hijos que están estudiando secundaria y universitario.

Es el primer crédito que trabaja con CEPRODEL es cual lo utilizará para cerrar parte del porche de su casa. Labora en la alcaldía de Managua como responsable de servicios generales desde hace 8 años.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por la oportunidad que le han brindado, ya que le permitirá mejorar la apariencia de su casa y por lo tanto mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Reynaldo G. has four dependents: his wife and his three children, who are studying in high school and college. This is his first loan with Ceprodel, and he will use it to close off part of the porch on his house. He works at the mayor's office in Managua and has been responsible for general services for eight years. He is thankful to Ceprodel for the opportunity they have offered him since it will let him improve the appearance of his home and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the porch on his home

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel V. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos los cuales le han ayudado a que su negocio sea mejor y tenga más ingresos y clientes.
Nuevamente está solicitando su cooperación para comprar una maquina de soldar más moderna y herramienta, ya que la que tiene actual mente esta en muy malas condiciones y no quiere que sus trabajadores tengan ningún problema para realizar los trabajos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel V. is very grateful for the past financing which was of great help to him in seeing that his business is more productive. He is again seeking financing to buy an updated welding machine and tools because the one he currently owns is in very bad shape and he doesn't want his employees to have any problems when they are doing the jobs. He plans to repay the loan with part of his business profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an updated welding machine and tools.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel A. R., tiene la edad de 58 años, está  casado, y tiene una hija que es su mayor prioridad. Ella tiene 20 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia  a una plantación de café que posee. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo  para  que este le permita  tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Israel  trabaja  desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Israel A. R., 58, is married and has a 20-year-old daughter, who is his greatest priority in life. He wants financing to buy natural fertilizer to enrich his coffee plantation. He wants to properly care for his plants so that his crop yields will be optimum thereby producing better earnings. This isn't his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms agreed upon. He has been a farmer for many years. He hopes in the future to offer his family a better quality of life and economic stability and to be able to continue to grow both as a person and as a grower. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Danny Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Danny Ernesto T. M. es promotor de deporte de la Alcaldía de Managua desde hace 3 años. Tiene dos años de ser cliente de CEPRODEL en los que ha obtenido 2 créditos, los cuales los ha pagado muy bien.

           Es un padre de familia ejemplar casado, solamente tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad preescolar.

El señor T. M. ha utilizado sus préstamos para mejorar la vivienda de su madre el primero y el segundo para cubrir los gastos arancelarios de la universidad, ya que es un joven esforzado que está buscando su superación como profesional. Así como cubrir gastos de exámenes médicos de su mamá.
texts.en:
Sr. Danny Ernesto T. M. works as a sports promoter for the city of Managua and has been in this position for three years. He has been a client of CEPRODEL for two years and has repaid two previous loans. He is an exemplary husband and father, who has a five year old son in preschool.

Sr. Danny used his first loan to make improvements to his mother’s house. The second loan was used to cover his university expenses. He is a determined young man who strives to succeed as a professional. This current loan will be used to cover his mother’s medical expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his mother's medical expenses

loans.name: Ronald Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Ronald Antonio P. M., labora como oficial de mantenimiento del mercado Mayoreo Managua, el habita con sus Cuatro  hijos y su esposa, de los cuales tres se encuentran estudiando, el esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante seis años, en ese lapso ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 11 Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción para mantenimiento y reparación del piso de la  vivienda en que habita y para el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Señor Ronald Antonio P. M. works in maintenance at the Mayoreo Managua market. He lives with his four children and his wife. Three of his children are in school. He has worked with Ceprodel for six years, and during this time, he has invested in improving his house with the eleven credits he has had. He is an excellent client. He will use this credit to buy construction materials to maintain and repair the floor of his home in which he lives and to pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain and repair the floor of his house

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 37 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Juan, de 38 años; y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de papayas, las cuales su esposo trae desde la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado (ciudad que limita con el país de Brasil). Su puesto es muy concurrido, pues las papayas que vende son frescas y muy jugosas, lo cual ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes.
Lo que más le gusta a Luz de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de venta, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir a ningún lado. Espera que con el tiempo su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Luz con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otros créditos posteriormente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Los dos mil soles que ahora solicita los invertirá en la compra de más papayas, para así implementar mejor la mercadería de su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband, Juan, 38, in their own home. Her greatest desire is to improve their quality of life. She sells papayas in the Las Mercedes (Juliaca's most important market) market. Her husband brings the papayas from the city of Puerto Maldonado (a city on the Brazilian border). Her stand is very popular because her papayas are fresh and juicy and this has attracted many customers. What Luz most likes about her job is being able to chat with her fellow merchants because that makes the long work days much more pleasant. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay at her post all day long not being able to go out anywhere. She hopes that, in time, her business will grow and produce better earnings. This is Luz's 9th loan with MFP. She knows that she must make all her repayments on time if she wants to have access to future loans and she is willing to do so. The 2000 soles requested will be used to buy more papayas in order to have better selection of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Qorimakis Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “QORIMAKIS”, El nombre banco comunal es origen de la lenguaje “Quechua” que traducido al español significa “Manos de Oro”, ellos viven en la provincia del Cusco en el distrito Wanchaq. Este banco comunal está conformado por 10 miembros, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal de la Asociación Arariwa.  

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en la ciudad del Cusco, una gran parte se dedica a la venta de ropas, comida, víveres, artesanía, etc. El socio Carlos tiene un taxi que hace el servicio de transportes en la ciudad. La socia Cristina es docente y se dedica por las mañanas a la enseñanza. La socia Dominga se dedica a la venta de ropas. Los socios Juan Pablo, Roxana, Livia tienen sus propias agencias de viajes que ofrecen paquetes turísticos por todo el Valle Sagrado de los Inca; Pisaq. Calca, Ollaytaytambo, Machupicchu y el valle de SalKantay. La socia Adriana tiene un restaurante llamado “La Esquina” donde vende comida (desayuno, almuerzo y cena). Otra socia vende verduras.   

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(Las socias Cristina y Adriana no aparecen en la fotografía porque pidieron permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal por motivos de salud y se fueron antes de tomar la foto).
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Qorimakis”, which means “Hands of Gold” in the Quecha language. They live in Wanchaq District in the province of Cusco. The group consists of 10 members who meet once a month at the main office of Asociación Arariwa.

The members divide their time between various activities and managing their small retail businesses in the city of Cusco. Most of them are devoted to selling clothes, food, groceries, and handicrafts. Carlos has a taxi and provides transportation services throughout the city. Cristina is a teacher and spends her mornings instructing children. Dominga sells clothing. Juan Pablo, Roxanne, and Livia manage their own travel agencies and offer packaged tours of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, Pisac, Calca, Ollantaytambo, Machu Picchu, and Salkantay Valley. Adriana has a restaurant called “La Esquina” where sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Another member sells vegetables.

The group is requesting a loan to use as working capital so that they can increase their products and improve their sales. This will provide a better quality of life for their families. The members value and appreciate this loan and commit to making their payments on time.

(Group members Cristina and Adriana requested permission from the Communal Bank directors not to have their photograph taken for health reasons. They were allowed to leave before the picture was taken.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 25 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Edgar) de 37 años, y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe que tiene que trabajar duro si quiere darle a su familia una buena vida, es por eso que junto a su esposo decidieron abrir dos negocios a la vez. 
Desde muy temprano atiende las cabinas donde ofrece el servicio de Internet; posteriormente llegada la noche, se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas).
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es preparar los deliciosos platillos que vende por la noche, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender sus cabinas de Internet, ya que no entiende mucho de computación y no puede ayudar a sus clientes si tienen algún problema.
Para más adelante, espera mejorar su pequeño snack, para poder brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Elizabeth con MFP y está dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco con tal de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los tres mil soles solicitados comprará más mesas y sillas para implementar mejor su local donde vende comida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 25, is a cheerful young woman who lives in her own home with her husband, Edgar, 37. What she most desires is to get ahead in life. Although still very young, she realizes that she must work if she wants to provide her family with a good life. This is why she and her husband decided to open two businesses at once. From very early in the day she tends to her Internet access booths and in the evenings she sells hamburgers and salchipapas (sausages and fried potatoes). What she most enjoys about her work is preparing the delicious meals she sells at night. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be tending to the Internet access booths because she doesn't know much about computers and can't help the customers if they encounter any problems. For later on, she expects to improve her small eatery to offer her customers improved customer service. This is Elizabeth's 7th loan with MFP and she is determined to save a little every day so that she can make her repayments on time. With the 3000 soles requested she will buy tables and chairs to better equip the area where she sells food.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hijos en Mocupe, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de comida y postres en un colegio de la zona. De lunes a viernes va durante las mañanas a ofrecer sus productos a los estudiantes que están en hora de receso. Eventualmente también les ofrece golosinas.

Sus productos siempre tienen acogida entre los niños pero el poco capital que posee no le abastece para cubrir toda la demanda de los estudiantes. Por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para expandir su negocio.

María desea seguir trabajando para terminar de construir su casa. Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y con mucho carisma y paciencia para tratar niños.
texts.en:
María, 51, lives with her two sons in Mocupe, Lagunas district, which is 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 3 years she has had a small food and dessert stand at a local school. From Monday-Friday mornings she sells her products to the students during recess. Sometimes she also sells them sweets. The children always welcome her products but her low income precludes her from stocking all the items the students ask for. This is why she is seeking financing for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the form of a 1000 new sol loan to buy stock items to expand her business. María hopes to continue working so that she can finish building her house. She is a very responsible woman with much charisma and patience for dealing with the children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Manuel Alonzo

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 20 años de edad, que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de un mes de nacido en casa de su suegra en el sector Ucupe, en el distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años trabaja como mototaxista, empezó alquilando mototaxis y desde hace un año pudo adquirir una propia gracias a su esfuerzo. Este negocio es la única fuente estable de ingresos con el que cuenta. Por otro lado trabaja eventualmente como obrero agrícola.

Debido al tiempo de uso otorgado a su vehículo Manuel está pensando en brindarle un mantenimiento general para que continue operativo por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es construir su casa propia e instalar una bodega. El es un joven trabajador y que siempre afronta responsablemente los retos que le presenta la vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 20, lives with his wife and one-month-old newborn son in his mother-in-law's house in the Ucupe sector, Lagunas district, which is 35 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a mototaxi driver for the past 3 years. He started with leased vehicles but a year ago was able to buy his own, thanks to his work effort. This work is his only stable source of income. He also works occasionally as a temporary farm worker. Due to the heavy usage of his vehicle, Manuel needs to take it in for general servicing so that it will continue to operate. This is the reason behind his first loan request of 500 new soles to Edpyme Alternativa. His greatest hope is to build his own house and install a store. He is a hard-working young man who responsibly faces the challenges that life presents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi maintenance.

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”. El nombre del banco comunal es D. origen D. la lenguaje “Quechua” que traducido al español significa “Mujer bonita”. Este banco comunal está conformado por 17 miembros, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal D. La Asociación Arariwa.  

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en la ciudad del Cusco, una gran parte se dedica a la venta D. ropa, D. productos D. belleza, D. artesanía, etc. Otras socias alquilan carros (Taxis) pues así dan trabajo a personas que trabajan haciendo el servicio D. transporte en la ciudad. La socia Georgina y Lucia son profesionales en enfermería y trabajan en el Hospital Regional del Cusco. Otras socias se dedican a la venta D. artesanía (joyas, pulseras, huacos retratos, mantos, etc.). La socia Sonia cría pollos y después D. alimentarlos los comercializa. Una socia tiene un pequeño negocio D. hacer tejidos. La socia Valentina tiene su agencia D. viajes y ofrece a los turistas paquetes turísticos para todo el Valle Sagrado D. los Incas que conforma las ciudades D.: Pisaq, Calca, Urubamba, Ollaytaytambo y Machupicchu.       

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital D. trabajo y D. esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(Las socias Vicky y Elvira no aparecen en la fotografía porque pidieron permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal y se fueron antes D. tomar la foto).
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Kusikoyllor”, which means “Beautiful Woman” in the Quecha language. The group consists of 17 members who meet once a month at the main office of Asociación Arariwa. The members diviD. their time between various activities and managing their small businesses in the city of Cusco. Most of them are devoted to selling clothing, beauty products, handicrafts, and other goods. Other members rent out taxis, thus creating employment for people who work in the city’s transportation sector. Members Georgina and Lucia are nurse practitioners who work at the Regional Hospital of Cusco. Some sell handmaD. works such as jewelry, bracelets, Huacan paintings, blankets, etc. Sonia raises chickens for use in the dishes that she sells. Another member has a small business producing fabric. Valentina has her own travel agency where she offers visitors packaged tours of the various ancient cities around the Sacred Valley such as Pisac, Calca, Urubamba, Machu Picchu, and Ollantaytambo. The group is requesting a loan to use as working capital so that they can increase their products and improve their sales. This will proviD. a better quality of life for their families. The members value and appreciate this loan and commit to making their payments on time. (Group members Vicky and Elvira requested permission from the Communal Bank directors not to have their photograph taken. They were allowed to leave before the picture was taken.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Martha Cecilia B. es una pequeña vendedora de productos varios, su pulpería o ventecita se encuentra ubicada en la parte este de la capital de Nicaragua. Tiene 19 años de tener el negocio, cuyo monto de inversión inicial fue de C$ 200,000 córdobas que le regaló su hijo, cuando la moneda estaba devaluada en los años ochenta. Las condiciones del negocio en ese entonces era precaria en una mesita de madera donde vendía frutas y verduras, la tenía en el porche de la casa.

Ella tiene 55 años de edad, nos comenta que los precios actuales de algunos productos de su negocio son los siguientes: el frescos cuesta C$ 6, pan dulce C$1, sándwich C$8, platos descartables C$15, Papel de regalo C$3. Actualmente el negocio tiene su propio espacio en la casa, de piso, con buen techo en un área aproximada de 9 metros cuadrados, como activo fijo tiene una mantenedora, 2 vitrinas y una mesa donde coloca el pan.

Ella es una señora casada, no tiene persona a su cargo, su esposo es jubilado, y nos expresa que antes de tener el negocio ella lavaba y planchaba ropa. 
Ella espera crear un buen record crediticio en nuestra institución y está agradecida con CEPRODEL, ya que este préstamo le ha permitido surtir su negocio el cual tenía mucho tiempo de no invertirle y dice “Mi Negocio Ahora Está Bonito”.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Cecilia B. has a small business selling various products. Her store is located in the eastern part of the capital of Nicaragua. She has had her business for 19 years, and she started it with an initial investment of 200,000 córdobas that her son gave her when the currency was devalued in the 1980s. Her business conditions were unstable then, and she sold fruits and vegetables from a little table that she had on the porch of her home.

She is 55, and she tells us that the current prices for some of the products in her business are as follows: juices are 6 córdobas, bread is 1 córdoba, a sandwich is 8 córdobas, disposable plates are 15 córdobas, and wrapping paper is 3 córdobas. Currently her business has its own place in her home with a good roof. The area is approximately 9 square meters. She has one refrigerator, two display cases, and a table where she puts bread.

She is a married woman and doesn't have any dependents. Her husband is retired. She told us that she used to have a business washing and ironing clothing.

She hopes to have a good credit record with our institution, and she is thankful to Ceprofel since this loan has let her stock her business that she hasn't invested in for some time. She says, "Now my business is lovely."

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like:  disposable plates, soft drinks, yogurt, toilet paper, juice, bread, sandwiches, wrapping paper, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Viviana Janet

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad. Vive junto a su familia en el sector Ucupe, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica al comercio de patos. Compra patos, los cría y luego los vende a sus clientes. Este negocio es una fuente importante de sostenimiento familiar ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero agrícola. Hace poco compró algunos patos pequeños y ya los está empezando a alimentar para que su venta resulte exitosa. 

Viviana es muy entregada a su trabajo, pero los pocos ingresos que perciben no son suficientes para lograr todas sus metas, una de ellas es terminar de techar su casa, esta acción es urgente ya que la temporada de lluvias propias del verano se acerca, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación y hacer crecer su negocio. Ella es una madre responsable y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Viviana, 30, is married and the mother of two sons, 8 and 4 years old. She lives with her family in the Ucupe sector, Lagunas district, located 35 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has sold ducks for the last year. She buys ducklings, raises them, then sells them to her customers. This is an important source of income for her family since her husband works as a temporary agricultural laborer. A short while ago she bought a few ducklings and she has begun to feed them so that their sale will be successful. Viviana is very dedicated to her work but the small income earned is not enough for her to reach her goals, one of which is to finish roofing her house. This is an urgent need because the usual rainy Summer season is fast approaching. This is why she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time requesting a 500 new sol loan. Her greatest wish is to offer her children a good education and to see her business grow. She is a responsible, very hard-working mother.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete building her roof.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa R., labora como afanadora en la Universidad de Ingeniería ( UNI ), ella habita con sus dos hijos, los cuales están en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante ochos años, en ese lapso ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 9 Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente Clienta.

El crédito solicitado es para realizar la compra de materiales para darle  mantenimiento y reparación del techo de la  vivienda en que habita y para el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en:
María Teresa R. works as a janitor at the University of Engineering. She is a single mother who lives with her two school-age children. She has worked with CEPRODEL for eight years and used the nine loans she has received to improve her housing conditions. María Teresa is an excellent client.

This loan will be used to pay for materials and labor required to repair and maintain the roof of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor needed to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Irma Luisa

texts.es:
Irma es una madre D. familia D. 45 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales dos están aún a su cargo y se encuentran estudiando, se separó D. su pareja hace un año y vive en el sector Ucupe, distrito D. Lagunas a 35 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Las ganas D. sacar a su familia adelante la llevaron a instalar en su vivienda una pequeña bodega en la que ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes, carne D. pollo y golosinas a los vecinos D. su zona. Además venD. productos D. belleza. Con los ingresos que le generan estas actividades Irma trata D. solventar la economía D. su familia.

Ella trabaja incansablemente por mantener su negocio. La demanda D. sus clientes ha hecho que desee ampliar su bodega,  por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es construir su casa D. material noble y brindarle a sus hijos estudios superiores. Ella es una madre responsable y que siempre lucha por salir adelante a pesar D. las adversidades.
texts.en:
Irma, 45, separated from her partner a year ago. She has 3 children, two of whom are in school and still dependent on her. She lives in the Ucupe sector, Lagunas district, located 35 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her wish to see her family get ahead led her to set up a small grocery store in her home. She sells such items as groceries, chicken, sweets, etc. to her neighbors. In addition, she also sells beauty products. With the profits from these activities, Irma tries to meet her household expenses. She works tirelessly to maintain her business. Growing demand has led her to expand her store which has led to the need to seek financing for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the form of an 800 new sol loan. Her greatest wish is to build her house with sturdy materials and to be able to proviD. her children with advanced schooling. She is a responsible mother who always struggles to get ahead despite adversity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For stock inventory.

loans.name: Zulema Bertha

texts.es:
Zulema es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo en el sector Mocupe Nuevo, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Está embarazaday su esposo es policía y actualmente trabaja en la selva del país.

Desde hace siete años tiene un pequeño kiosko a un costado de la carretera Panamericana, a la salida del sector en donde vive. Allí ofrece diversas frutas y bebidas a los transportistas que frecuentan la zona. Ella nos cuenta que este negocio es una ayuda importante a la economía de su familia y que la mantiene activa durante el día.

Su negocio se ha hecho conocido y siempre tiene clientes que solicitan su mercancía. Zulema desea comprar más fruta para ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital para realizar esta acción, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es instalar un negocio de venta de abarrotes para seguir sacando adelante a su hijo y al pequeño que viene en camino. Ella es una mujer alegre, bastante responsable y muy laboriosa.
texts.en:
Zulema, 35, lives with her son in the Mocute Nuevo sector, Lagunas district, which is 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She is pregnant and her husband, who is a policeman, is currently stationed in the jungle. For the past 7 years she has had a small kiosk along the Panamerican highway at the exit where she lives. There, she offers various fruits and beverages to the drivers who frequent the area. She tells us that this work is an important help to the family's economy and it keeps her busy during the day. Her business has become well-known and she always has customers who request her merchandise. Zulema wants to buy more fruit to enlarge her business but lacks the necessary capital to do so. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. Her greatest wish is to set up a grocery store to continue to provide for her son and for the child that she is expecting. Zulema is a cheerful, very responsible and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Anilistte

texts.en:
Anilistte E. is from the village of Pob 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Anilistte is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anilistte owns & operates a sewing business. While this is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing sewing services to local community members. Anilistte has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anilistte joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to conduct business. Anilistte has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anilistte is requesting a second loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina P. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora. Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Monina owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling clothing products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-one years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Monina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Monina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn B.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting cassava to sell. She is 25 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the city of Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City. Jackelyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Jackelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jackelyn is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza H. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Liza has a sari-sari (general) store from which she sells daily use products such as rice, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (about $128 US) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Liza from PMPC; she has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 pesos. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Liza is requesting a new loan of 14,900 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C.'s main source of income comes from preparing longganisa (pork sausages) to sell in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Elizabeth has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for making longganisa. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for longganisa making

loans.name: Ivy Ma.

texts.en:
A single mother of one child in the person of Ivy Ma. S. is our featured entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and a resident of Barangay III, Tangub City. With God’s help she was able to support her child, being the sole breadwinner in the family. Now her son is working in Dubai.

Even if she receives monthly support, Ivy Ma. still has the love of operating a business – a sari-sari (variety) store. Currently she is earning an average net income of not less than P6,000 from her stall located at Tangub City IBJT (Integrated Bus and Jeepney Terminal) or at Agora.

Ivy Ma. joined Paglaum MPC a year ago and is so thankful. Indeed, it’s a great honor for her being a member of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao, and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

For her 2nd loan, she is given the privilege of obtaining P10,000 to add to her capital for her existing sari-sari store business. The future income from this loan will be used for her daily expenditures and part saved for future use.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Mr. Allan O. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old, is married, and is blessed with three school-aged children. Allan owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling nata de coco in the local community (nata de coco is a chewy, translucent, jelly-like food produced by the bacterial fermentation of coconut water and carrageenan, an extract from red seaweed). In 2005, Allan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Allan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for his nata de coco business. This loan will be his 6th from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for his business

loans.name: Katty Milagros

texts.es:
La señora Katty Milagros, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella y están estudiando, y es el orgullo, para seguir trabajando.

Katty Milagros, es una mujer joven, trabajadora y luchadora, se siente muy contenta por el trabajo que realiza, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la linea Avon y Esika. Con esta actividad económica, poco a poco fue ahorrando y generando  su propio capital. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta, que esta marchando muy bien. Tiene clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y que mensualmente realizan sus pedidos, mediante catálogos, que ella misma, todos los días por las tardes, sale a ofrecer sus productos en stock. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Katty, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Katty Milagros, 30, is a member of the "10 de Agosto II" communal bank, which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children, both of whom are students and still dependent on her. They are both her greatest pride and the reason to continue working. Katty Milagros is a young, hard-working woman who is very happy with the work she does. She sells beauty products of the Avon and Esika brands. With this line of work she was able to little by little have some savings and to generate her own capital. She is currently continuing with this work and she tells us that all is going well. She has regular customers who know her and place orders from her catalogues monthly which she, herself, goes out every afternoon to show. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy stock items like perfumes for women and men, creams, powders, compacts, lipsticks, nail polish. Katty, with her maturity, is an example for many women who want to start their own business and who, through perseverance, manage to reach their goals. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and other women to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Mrs. Lydia A. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married and is blessed with four adult children. Lydia owns and operates a business buying and selling coconuts in the local community, earning 4,000 monthly. In 2003, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Sandra Margot

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Margot, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín,  Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de  02 hijas, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Sandra Margot, lleva 02 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos y manualidades, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. En la actualidad, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sandra Margot, 42, is a member of the "10 de Agosto II" communal bank which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She has a life partner and is the mother of two daughters who are in school and still dependent on her. Sandra Margot has been a dressmaker and craftsperson for the last two years since, having knowledge and skills in these areas, she didn't hesitate to set up her own workshop in her home. This is a well-equipped area where she daily tends to her regular customers who know her and require her services. She works based on prior orders from her customers. Currently, she is happy and proud of what she has accomplished. With this 600 sol loan she will buy bolts of fabric of various kinds and colors, tools like scissors and large spools of thread, sewing needles for machine and for hand use, pins, buttons, etc. Today she feels herself to be an actualized woman with even more desire to reach her goals and see her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and also the many other women who want to grow in business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La señora Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y esta estudiando.

Ludith, es una mujer trabajadora y por su espíritu optimista que siempre le ha caracterizado, por lo que hoy en día lleva 04 años, dedicándose al servicio de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con su primer préstamo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.

Ludith, Se siente muy bien al pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, que le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Ludith, 43, is a member of the "10 de Agosto II" communal bank which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has three children, one of whom is still in school and dependent on her. Ludith is a hard-working woman whose optimistic spirit has always characterized her. For the past 4 years she has provided mototaxi transportation services. Her husband is the driver and he goes to various parts of the city. She began with an initial loan from Manuela Ramos Movement and little by little saved up enough to buy replacement parts to improve the service offered to area residents. With this 1500 sol loan she will buy parts and lubricants like brake pads, spark plugs, etc. to offer better service. Ludith is happy to belong to a group of women who have helped her to know her rights and, together, have seen that they are respected. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start up in business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Exarita

texts.es:
La señora Exarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 67 años y es madre de 07 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.

Exarita, mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, sus ganas de salir adelante y cumplir parte de sus sueños, le ha valido para implementar su propio negocio de venta de adobes, ubicada en su misma casa, un ambiente especialmente para colocar sus adobes y brindar a sus clientes, una buena atención.

En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, que vienen de otras zonas a realizar sus pedidos y compras de su producto, nos cuenta que es muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así e implementarse en otro tipo de negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, comprará tierra amarilla en bolqueteadas y algunas herramientas, para cambiar lo antiguo, por unos nuevos. Parte del dinero también invertirá en el pago de sus peones, que semanalmente trabajan, para poder cumplir con los pedidos, que sus clientes lo solicitan.

Exarita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una vejez tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Exarita, 67, is a member of the "10 de Agosto II" communal bank which is in he Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has 7 children, one of whom is a student and still dependent on her. Exarita, a hard-working, enterprising woman, in her desire to get ahead in life and have her own business, sells adobe bricks in her home from an area specially equipped to display and sell the bricks and offer good customer service. She has a steady, regular clientele that come from other areas to place their orders and buy the product. She tells us that she is very responsible with her loan repayments and intends to continue thus and set herself up in another type of work. With this 800 sol loan she will buy blocks of yellow dirt and some tools to replace some outdated ones. Part of the money will be used to pay her laborers who work weekly to fulfill her orders. Exarita feels strong to continue working and to go forward to insure a tranquil old-age for herself. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her meeting her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blocks of yellow dirt.

loans.name: Besilia

texts.es:
La señora Besilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 23 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Besilia, es una mujer trabajadora y por su espíritu optimista que siempre le ha caracterizado, por lo que hoy en día lleva 06 años, dedicándose al servicio de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su pareja se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.
