Her youngest child is 7 years-old and in second grade in elementary school. Maria Antonia's house is small, but because of the need to earn money she took the initiative and decided to rent out one room to help with the basic costs of water and electricity. With the previous loan she finished building and furnishing the room. With the funds from this loan she will buy the materials to build another room: stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams, all with the goal of saving for the future. Maria Antonia is already 52 years-old, and she feels tired. She is grateful for Afodenic and the support their loans provide for poor women.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams to build a room to rent.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a rice farmer and also has a hog raising business. She is 49 years old and has three children. The income she receives is not enough to provide their needs. She would like to request a loan of 15,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to buy supplies for her business. She started her business in 2000. She is a widow but still determined to continue managing her businesses.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita, 50, is the mother of two children. She provides for the needs of her family through rice farming. With difficulty in life, she needs financial support for additional capital for her farm. She is grateful in joining Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because she is able to request a loan of 15,000 Php to provide for farm inputs such as fertilizer. This loan will be very helpful to finance her business at a low interest rate.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa is already 60 years and still has the courage to manage a rice farming business. She has a 17-year old child in her family. Her rice field is two hectares in size and is located in Surallah, South Cotabato. She heard that Community Economic Ventures, Inc. provides financial assistance to farmers like her, and that's why she joined. Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php to buy farm supplies and hopes she will have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en: Noralyn, 29, enjoys spending her time working with her rice field. She is already married and has a child that is five years old. She helps provide for the needs of her family through rice farming, raising ducks, and a small "sari-sari" store that sells household staples, drinks, and snacks. She didn't have enough enough capital for her businesses so she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to get a loan. She has requested 13,000 Php to buy farm supplies, ducks, and pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, 56, has a hog raising business. She started this business in 2006.  Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to fill the needs of her piggery.

Rosa is a widow and has 10 children. Providing for the needs of her family is not easy for her as she does not have a husband anymore on whom she can depend. She strives hard to make her business productive so she can earn more. She wants the best for her children and is determined to sustain her family so they can be together.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Juan Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Juan Leonardo V. , es un hombre agricultor desde hace mas de 40 años , gracias al apoyo que obtuvo de sus suegros que le brindaron un predio baldío para que lo trabaje y pueda apoyar a su familia , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta que, El cultivo de piña es atacada por plagas ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatir dicha epidemia , el quiere comprar los insumos necesario para sacar una buena producción y vender a un mejor precio para poder pagar el desembolso e invertir en casa de habitación que todavía le hace falta construir , don Juan habita en un barrio pobre del municipio de su familia junto a su esposa y ocho hijos todos independientes , los sueños de don Juan es poder comprar un camión pequeño para trasladar el producto al mercado ya que tiene que pagar y eso le merma la ganancia .
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Leonardo V. has been working as a farmer for more than 40 years, thanks to the support of his parents-in-law, who gave him a vacant piece of land to work and use to support his family. The biggest difficulty facing Juan is that the pineapple crop is attacked by pests as he lacks fertilizers and the materials necessary to combat such an epidemic. He wants to buy the necessary products to achieve a good harvest and sell at the best price, in order to be able to make a down payment on completing the necessary construction on his house. Juan lives in a poor neighborhood in his town with his family and their eight independent children. Juan's dream is to be able to purchase a truck to take his product to the market, as now he has to pay for this service, subtracting from his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and pesticides to protect his harvest.

loans.name: Pelayo Gil

texts.es:
El Sr.Pelayo Gil V. C. tiene 32 años de edad,vive en el caserio de Sacta, percibe ingresos trabajando como obrero de campo desde hace tres años en diferentes fundos agricolas. su unidad familiar esta conformada por su esposa quien es obrera de campo y su menor hijo en edad escolar. Tiene casa propia ubicada en Caserío de Sacta, de material noble en la parte de adelante recién construida y en la parte de atrás encerrado con esteras, el techo es de caña, con sus ingresos construyeron su casa y compraron sus artefactos, fueron afectados por el terremoto.
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y asi poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Pelayo Gil V. C. is 32 years old, and lives in the small village of Sacta. For 3 years he has made a living working as a farm-hand on different farms. His family unit is comprised of his wife, who is also a farm worker, and his school-aged son. He has his own house located in the village of Sacta. The front of the house was recently built of solid materials, but the back of the house is enclosed only by woven mats. The roof is made of cane. With his income, they built the house and bought the household appliances. They were affected by the earthquake. His dream is to improve his house, and in this way be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: housing improvements

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El joven José Luís García, desde hace diez años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, el rubro que mas cultiva es la piña, gracias al apoyo de su abuela que le heredo una parte de las tierras donde actualmente tiene la producción, la mayor afectación que presenta son las plagas y enfermedades por la falta de fertilizantes e insumos que requiere para poder estar en buen estado, si logra aplicar todos los fertilizantes va a tener un cultivo el cual va a tener calidad y tamaño para poder ser vendido en un mejor precio en el M., a la vez  poder pagar el préstamo y con las ganancias ir poco a poco mejorando las condiciones de vida , él habita en un barrio pobre de la comarca San Ignacio , juntos a sus abuelos , los planes futuros es poder construir su casa y después hacer una familia con su actual novia , la cual labora como comerciante en el M. de Masaya . Agradece a Afodenic que a través de los fondos Kiva, son muchos los agriculturas que se benefician y logran mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
José Luís García has been doing agricultural work for ten years. He mostly plants pineapple, thanks to his grandmother’s support. She gave him part of the land where he now has his production. The biggest problems are the plagues and diseases from the lack of fertilizers and supplies that he needs to be able to keep them in good condition. If he is able to apply all of the fertilizer, he will have a good crop. It will be of good quality and size to be able to be sold at a better price in the market. He will be able to repay the loan, and with the earnings he will be improving his living conditions little by little. He lives with his grandparents in a poor neighborhood in the San Ignacio region. His future plans are to be able to build a house and later have a family with his present girlfriend. She works as a merchant in the Masaya market. He is grateful to Afodinic, who through Kiva funds, has helped so many farmers improve their crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and supplies for his crops to get good quality fruit production

loans.name: Apolonio Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Apolonio T. tiene 42 años de edad vive en casa propia en el Caserío Puno distrito de Santiago junto a su esposa y sus dos menores hijos. Trabaja en una Empresa Agrícola denominada Agro Victoria desempeñando la labor de encargado de almacén desde hace ocho años.Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales de granja en su casa. Son personas muy trabajadoras que se vieron afectadas por el terremoto ya que su casa es de caña y adobe. Actualmente han sido beneficiados con la construcción de un módulo de material noble gracias a ONG  Caritas del Perú y requiere apoyo para cubrir gastos de mano de obra para la colocación de puertas y ventanas. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de financiamientos para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Apolonio T. is 42 years old and lives in his own house in the Puno settlement, District of Santiago, with his wife and his two young children. He works in the Agro Victoria Agricultural Enterprise, in charge of a warehouse for the past 8 years. His wife raises farm animals at home.

They are hard working people who were affected by an earthquake and their house is made of cane and mud. At present, they have benefited from the construction of a modular home with decent materials, thanks to Caritas of Peru, and require help to cover the costs of labor to install doors and windows.

His dream is to finish construction of this house in order to offer a better quality of life to their children. Both are grateful for the help they may receive by means of financing for improvements on their home.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVEMENTS TO THEIR MODULAR HOME

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes A. es natural de Ayacucho.Actualmente vive en el Caserío de San Antonio, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago,junto a su menor hija de 8 años. Está separada de su esposo desde hace 6 años, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos viven con su padre ya que su ex esposo actualmente tiene un nuevo compromiso, en su casa propia vive junto a la familia de su hermana y entre las dos se ayudan con los gastos de su unidad familiar. Su casa tiene una parte construida de caña y un pequeño módulo de material noble el cual está sin techar ya que fue beneficiada con un bono del estado peruano después del terremoto pero no pudo concluir dicha construcción. Labora como obrera de campo desde hace tres años en una empresa agrícola de la zona. Solicita financiamiento para continuar con construcción del módulo y lograr mejorar su vivienda. Su sueño es poder brindar un mejor hogar para sus hijos y ayudarlos en su educación. La Sra. A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from Ayacucho. She currently lives with her eight year old daughter in the San Antonio village, which belongs to the Santiago district. She has been separated from her husband for six years. She is the single mother of four children. Three of them live with their father. Her ex-husband is now in a new relationship. She lives in her own house with her sister’s family. Between the two of them, they help with their families’ expenses. Part of her house is made of reeds, and a small unit is from strong material. It does not have a roof. After the earthquake she received a voucher from the Peruvian state, but she could not finish the construction. She has worked for three years as a field worker for a regional agricultural business. She is asking for a loan to continue construction of the unit and improve her house. Her dream is to be able to give her children a better home and to help them with their education. A. is grateful for the support we can give her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to her home

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO SE DEDICA LA PINTURA, COMO CONTRATISTA, SON MAS DE 8 AÑOS QUE TIENE DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO DE LA PINTURA, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS 3 HIJOS, EL SEÑOR AHORA TRABAJA EN LOS CONDOMINIOS COBOCE, FIRMO UN TRABAJO BASTANTE GRANDE, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MATERIAL DE PINTURA , BROCHAS, ESCALERA , Y OTROS. EL YA ES CLIENTE ANTIGUO DE EMPRENDER EL CUAL ACCEDIO AL CREDITO POR SER UN BUEN CLIENTE.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco works as a painter by contract. He has more than 8 years of experience with this work. He lives in his own home with his wife and 3 children. Right now he is working at hte Coboce Condominiums. He signed a rather large project. He will use this credit to be able to buy more painting materials like paint, brushes, a ladder, etc. Since he is an old client of Empreder, he was able to access this credit because he is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Betzabeth Felicidad

texts.es: LA SEÑORA BETZABETH SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS, PARA ELLO ADQUIRIO UN AUTOMOVIL, CON EL CREDITO OTORGADO POR EMPRENDER, LA SEÑORA ANTES SE DEDICABA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA CUAL LO DEJO POR DEDICARSE AL TRANSPORTE, ACCEDIO AL CREDITO POR SER UNA BUENA CLIENTE, EL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR REPUESTOS PARA SU AUTOMOVIL. ELLA VIVE EN SU CASA CON SU ESPOSO Y  SUS 4 HIJOS EN LA ZONA DE CAPACACHI.
texts.en:
Señora Betzabeth transports passengers for a living. To do this, she acquired a car with the credit offered to her by Emprender. She used to sell food, but she stopped doing this to work in transportation. She was able to access this credit because she is a good client. She will use it to buy parts for her car. She lives in her home with her husband and four children in the Capacachi area.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her car

loans.name: Naty Aleja

texts.es: La señora Naty se dedica ala venta de hamburguesas y refrescos en la calle aniceto arce, en el centro de la ciudad de cochabamba, tiene un pequeño kiosco, el cual le dejo su suegra, ya lleva vendiendo mas de 8 años en ese lugar, que antes solo era un puesto pequeño, ahora ya paga impuestos por ese pequeno kiosko que tiene. La señora vive en casa de sus suegros, vive con su esposo y pronto con su niño que viene en camino. Accedio al credito la señora por ser una buena clienta y trabajar con Emprender, El destino del credito fue para comprar mas refrescos y mas viveres para poder cocinar y preparar esos ricos sandwich de chorizo y pollo.
texts.en:
Sra. Naty sells hamburgers and soft drinks along Aniceto Arce Street in central Cochabamba. She has a small kiosk that was left to her by her mother-in-law. Naty has been selling food from this location for 8 years. She only had a small vending stand when she started, but now she has to pay taxes because she owns a kiosk.

Naty and her husband live in the house of her in-laws and are expecting a child soon. She has been able to access loans through Emprender because she is a good client with an excellent work record. Naty will use her loan proceeds to buy more soft drinks and ingredients for preparing her delicious chorizo and chicken sandwiches.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & soft drinks

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Rodolfo, tiene aproximadamente 30 años de experiencia con el servicio de torneria, el comenzo teniendo solamente un torno donde actualmente tiene ya 4 tornos. El trabaja realizando muñones para automoviles y accesorios de ese tipo para automoviles grandes y pequeños, gracias a este negocio el logro sacar profesionales a sus dos hijas y una que ya esta por concluir su carrera. El credito destinara a la compra de fierro fundido para la fabricacion de piezas.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo has approximately 30 years of experience in providing lathing services. He started his business with only one machine, but he now has 4 lathes. Most of the items he produces are automobile parts and accessories for both large and small vehicles. Thanks to his business, his two daughters are close to finishing their degrees and able to become professionals. This loan will be used to buy cast iron for making parts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cast iron for making parts

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra Maria Beatriz junto con su esposo tienen una venta de abarrotes y productos de belleza. ubicado en el barrio Los olivos , cuentan con casa propia y tiene 3 hijos que estan en el colegio.   La Sra Maria beatriz tambien trabaja como maestra en un colegio turno noche. Solicitaron el credito para surtir su venta ya que llega la epoca de vacaciones y se entregara por completo a este negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Beatriz and her husband have a store in the neighborhood of Los Olivos where they sell groceries and beauty products. They live in their own home and have three children attending high school. Sra. Maria Beatriz also teaches night classes at the high school level. She is requesting a loan to restock her store for the holiday season and plans to devote herself completely to this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lloid

texts.es:
La señora Lloid, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Unión y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Lloid, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Lloid, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Lloid is a member of the Union and Labor Communal Bank, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Departament of San Martín. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of two dependent children.

Lloid is a hardworking and determined woman who decided to start her own business selling soft drinks. Her store is located in her house, which is well-equipped for managing her business. She neither works on a set schedule nor reports directly to anyone. Lloid says her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy 5 packs of soda. She did very well, so she gradually invested in more merchandise. Lloid continues to manage her business to this day and is known among her customers who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she plans to buy packs of sodas of different flavors, sizes and brands. In addition, she will purchase both carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Lloid has many goals ahead of her and is motivated to achieve all of them. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing assistance when she needed it. She has been responsible with her loan payments and plans to continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Ruth Claribel

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Claribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Unión y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 36 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella y están etapa escolar.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia, con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su negocio de venta, donde ella los atiende con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Ruth Claribel, se siente aun con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth Claribel is a member of the Union and Labor Communal Bank, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Departament of San Martín. She is 36 years old, single, and the mother of three dependent children who attend school.

Confident in her knowledge of preparing different types of food, Ruth Claribel decided to start her own business. She used her first loan of 300 soles to begin selling prepared foods out of her house, which is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. As time passed, she was able to build up a loyal customer base and continues to manage her business to this day. She welcomes each customer with her warm and charismatic personality.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as sacks of rice, sugar, packets of oil, cases of chicken, as well as utensils to help her continue her business and provide better service to her customers. Claribel Ruth feels strong enough to continue working in a successful manner so that she can secure a peaceful retirement for herself. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing food

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 71 años y es madre de 07 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes hace varios años atrás, con un capital de S/. 500.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente, aun con fuerzas y muy feliz por la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 71, married, and has seven grown and independent children. Facing the need to contribute income to the household, she was self-motivated in setting up a small business selling groceries several years ago. She started with 500 PEN, and she got good results because of the quality of her products, her reasonable prices, and the good attention she gives her customers. She currently continues with the same business, which is located in her own house. Her primary customers are her neighbors. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will stock her store with the purchase of more products like kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, personal hygiene items, household cleaners, packs of soft drinks, sweets, and other products to keep her customers happy. She still feels that she has the strength to work. She is very happy with the work and service that is offered. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue this way for a long time and that they help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 58 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

Camila, anteriormente trabajaba en Essalud, dejo de ejércelo por motivos familiares. Posteriormente, con la seguridad y optimismo que siempre le ha caracterizado, por iniciativa propia implemento su propio negocio de venta de refrigeR., ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Lleva 08 años, en el negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado, ya que le va muy bien.

En la actualidad, cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes moradores y amigos conocidos, que ya conocen el tipo de actividad que realiza,  que a diario acuden a su puesto, donde ella los atiende con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará: paquetes de galletas en diferentes sabores, kekes, chifles en docenas, chocolates como: cañonazos, sublimes,  para aumentar sus productos y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.  Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de frutas, para la preparación de sus jugos.

Camila, esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Camila belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 58, married, and has three children. One child is still dependent upon her. Camila previously worked for Essalud. She left for family reasons. Later, with the confidence and optimism that has always characterized her, and on her own initiative, she started her own business selling refreshments. Her business is located in the Mercado Central of her district. Her place is very well equipped to take care of her customers. She has been in this business for eight years, and she is very happy with what she has achieved. It is going very well for her. She currently has loyal customers. Her primary customers are local inhabitants and friends. They know the type of job she does, and they go to her place daily. She waits on them with her characteristic charm and friendliness. She will use this loan for 2,500 PEN to buy packets of different flavored crackers, “kekes” (typical Peruvian pastry), dozens of “chifles” (fried plantain chips), and various chocolates to increase her products and give her customers better service. She will use part of the money to buy fruit to prepare juice. Camila is prepared for everything, and she still feels that she has lots of strength to keep working and get ahead. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make her refreshments

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 69 años y es madre de 02 hijos, ya independientes. 

Elsa, mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, por iniciativa propia, decidió acondicionar algunos ambientes de su casa, para el alquiler mensual de habitaciones, la cual el servicio los brinda a estudiantes y conocidos que llegan de otros lugares para quedarse a trabajar en el Distrito de Tarapoto. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y cuenta con 05 habitaciones. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará ladrillos, cementos, triplay, para la construcción de mas habitaciones. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios, para los baños, para mejorar el servicio e higiene,  de esa mañera sus inquilinos queden   satisfechos y contentos.

Elsita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the El Tiempo es Oros Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 69, single, and has two independent children. Elsa, a hard-working woman, on her own initiative decided to set up some rooms in her house to rent out monthly. She offers this service to students and people she knows who arrive from other places to stay and work in the Tarapoto district. She currently continues with the same business, and she has five rooms. She will use this loan for 2,000 PEN to buy bricks, cement, and three layered plywood to build more rooms. She will use part of the money to buy bathroom accessories to improve the service and hygiene. That way her tenants will feel satisfied and happy. Elsita, as she is affectionately called, feels like a very fulfilled woman. She has more desires to achieve and make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and for helping so many women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y es madre D. 03 hijos,  ya independientes.

Lucia, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, se inicio desD. muy joven por iniciativa propia y hoy lleva 18 años aun ejerciendo este tipo D. actividad, se encuentra ubicada, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, donD. atienD. a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, venD. en las mañanas y tardes. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como: arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Lucia, se siente llena D. vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar más su restaurante al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia belongs to the Communal Bank “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Gold), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children who are independent.

As a young woman, Lucia started selling prepared meals and has been in business for the past 18 years. Her business can be found at a location that is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. She says that her daily sales have been good due in part to the rich flavor of her dishes.

Lucia continues to manage her business. She is very pleased with the work that she accomplishes day after day, both in the mornings and afternoons. Lucia personally welcomes her customers with her charismatic personality.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as rice by the kilo, sugar, oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, cases of chicken, and vegetables. Part of the money will be used to buy replacement utensils so that she can proviD. better service to her customers.

Lucia is full of life and eager to move forward. She has many dreams and goals in life, such as expanding her restaurant. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & utensils

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Margarita, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio D. ventas D. bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 06 paquetes D. gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes D. gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Margarita, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas D. pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Gold), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three dependent children.

Margarita is a hardworking and determined woman who decided to start her own business selling soft drinks out of her home, which is a well-suited location. She manages her business without a set schedule and does not have to report to a boss. Margarita says that she started her business with 300 soles and bought six packs of sodas. Her products sold very well so she gradually invested in more merchandise. Today she continues to manage this same business and is known among her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase packs of sodas in different flavors, sizes, and brands. Margarita will also use part of the money to buy both carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. She has several goals ahead of her and feels motivated to fulfill all of her dreams. Margarita is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing assistance in her time of need. She has been responsible in making her payments and plans to continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La señora Lucy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de 07 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas vivas, con un capital de S/. 300.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas, pavos, patos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucy is a member of the Communal Bank “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Gold), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 7 children of whom 3 are school-age dependents.

Lucy needed to find a way to help her children move forward. Thanks to her energy and her enterprising spirit, she started a business selling live chickens. She started with capital of 300 soles and gradually became known among her customers, who are now well-acquainted with her business.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy more poultry such as chickens, turkeys, and ducks. Part of the money will be used to buy nutritionally balanced feed and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free of disease.

Lucy is very happy with what she has accomplished. Even though the work is hard and she has to wake up early, she believes it is worth the sacrifice to fulfill the dreams and goals that she has set forth for herself. She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing support to her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, turkeys, and ducks to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie C. is 35 years old Kaing maker, happily living with her husband Rodolfo C., 40 years old, a fisherman. A Kaing is a kind of basket storing for goods, especially for fruits). In the long years of their marriage they were given three children: Lessie Rose, 13 years old; Zyra Rose, 12 years old and Bea Unice, 9 years old. Her children are all students.

The business is in demand, so they will be able to send their children to school. Naturally, Melanie and Rodolfo don’t want their children to experience what they experienced in the past. They want them to be a professional in the future. Melanie, in her own little way, helps their children to provide their needs in education. She has run a Kaing making business for three years, and she really wants this to continue and to grow more.

In 2007 she joined the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), and as a member she is entitled to loans. Every loan that she received was always used in improving her Kaing making business. Now her loan will be used to expand her business, because she will buy all the necessary things needed by her business like bamboo shoot, a roll bamboo strip and many more and sell it at a good price to the others in town.

She is hoping that her business will continue growing, Not only for Kaing making but she also wants to be involve in different businesses to provide good life for her siblings and family. In that way, she could help her children in sending to school, and also help them improve their status in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her Kaing (basket) making business

loans.name: Rup Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Rup Laxmi S. is a tailor in the town of Tikhidewal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband works in a government office, and her sons are now studying in the higher secondary school. 




She opened her tailoring shop two years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs. S. took a 6-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her home.




She plans to use the loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income to improve her standard of living and for her son's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama K. is a married woman who has two sons. Both of her sons are now studying in university. Her husband, Mr. Madan K., is a farmer.  Mrs. K. already owns one cow and she has been selling milk in her area.

In Nepal, pure and fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition.  Rama K. lives in Bhashipati and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing.

She carries her milk containers and sells door to door daily in the morning and in the evening.  Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production.  So Mrs. K. is requesting a Rs 30,000.00 loan to purchase a Jersey cow which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: To buy a young cow.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina K. lives in a Bhakapati Village, located in Kathmandu district. It is one of the developing villages of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. K. is a grocery shopkeeper in her village. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks and cold drinks. Her husband also helps her in the shop.

Now Mrs. K. is requesting an Rs 25,000 loan to expand her business by purchasing different varieties of grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Mrs. Subdra K. lives in Bhaishipati. Bhaishipati is located in Kathmandu district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work. Subdra K. is engaged in a goat raising business. She sells goats and goat milk in the local market. She already owns five goats and sells their goat milk in the local market. Now she is requesting a Rs 20,000.00 loan to buy baby goats for her business. She grows baby goats and sells in the local market.

Mrs. K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband works in a private office. She is the mother of one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 12 and daughter is in grade 10.

loans.use: To buy baby goats

loans.name: Indra

texts.en:
Mrs. Indra T. has one daughter who attends pre-primary school. Her husband, Mr. Dil Kumar T., is a taxi driver.

Indra T. owns one cow and she sells the cow’s milk in her area. She carries milk containers and sells door to door in the morning and evening every day. In Nepal, pure fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition. Indra T. lives in growing neighborhood and, in that area, the demand for the milk is increasing constantly. To meet the rising demands of her customers, she is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to purchase another young cow.

loans.use: To buy a calf for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, lalitpur. She lives with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Sahadev K., is a farmer and her son is studying in grade 7.

Mrs. Jamuna K. owns a cow and sells cow’s milk in her neighborhood. She carries milk containers and sells door to door every day in the morning and evening. To meet her rising demand, she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 loan to purchase a young cow.

loans.use: To buy a calf for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Kavita

texts.en:
Mrs. Kavita A. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Dipendra A., is an electrician. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 3 and daughter is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. Kavita A. owns a cow and sells cow’s milk in her neighborhood. She carries milk containers and sells door-to-door every day in the morning and evening. To meet the increasing demand of her customers, she is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 loan to purchase a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Krishna Kumari M. lives in Thecho, which is located in Lalitpur District of Kathmandu Valley. Thecho is one of the less developed areas of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are farmers. Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband, son and daughter. Her son is studying in grade 7 and her daughter is in primary school. 

Her husband, Ganu Ratna M., a carpenter, and opened a furniture shop one year ago. Her husband makes different varities of furniture like beds, tables and chairs to sell. All of the family's requirements are fulfilled by the shop's income. Therefore, Mrs. M., seeks a loan of Rs 30000 to buy wood so her husband can make more furniture to sell and meet his customer's demands.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Nikita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nikita M., age 27, lives in Tarankhel, Thecho (Nepal). Thecho is a village in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people here are farmers. Mrs. M. has four members in her family including herself. Mrs. M. has two sons. Her elder son is 14 and is studying in class 7 and her younger son is 10 and is studying in class 4. 

Goat farming is the only profession that Mr. and Mrs. M. have, so they rely on it to support their family. They need a loan of Rs10000.00 to buy corn flour and other feed for their goats.

loans.use: To buy goats for their goat-raising business

loans.name: Krishna Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Krishna Devi M. lives in Thecho, which is located in Lalitpur District. Thecho is one of the less-developed villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are farmers.

Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Narayan M., is a driver. Her older son is studying in grade 8 and younger son is in primary school.

Mrs. M. is a farmer. She owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening. She uses her income for her sons' education.

Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizers for her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, age 47, is an entrepreneur who raises pigs. She is married to Rito and has 4 children. She also sells vegetables to earn additional income. She would like to buy additional pigs and more feed for her pig business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because she has limited capital.

Rosana has requested a loan of 15,000 Php. This loan will enable her to continue raising pigs and earn income for her family.

loans.use: Pigs and feed

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rice farming is the source of living of Rosie from Surallah, South Cotabato. She is 39 years old and has three children, her eldest being 19 years old. She wants her children to finish their studies to enable them to have a better life.

Rosie joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan for her business. She would like to request 15,000 Php to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Amicolé

texts.fr: Amicollé S. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2 depuis deux ans et demi et y a eu cinq expériences avec le crédit. Elle vend divers produits tel que de l'oignon, de la pomme de terre, du poivre, de l'arachide, du mil, des haricots etc. dans sa cantine au marché. Elle participe financièrement dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amicollé S. is a 51-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2 for 2½ years and has had a record of five loans there. Amicollé sells a variety of goods, such as onions, potatoes, black pepper, peanuts, millet, beans, etc. in her stall at the market. She takes part financially in supporting the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 29 years old and has a business selling clothing at his shop, “Ibra Collections”. He's been in business for seven years and employs one person. He also works as an accountant and bookkeeper. He describes himself as hardworking, faithful, and focused. In the future, he hopes to become an importer and wholesale supplier, providing employment to others.

Ibrahim has successfully repaid six previous loans through Faulu. He says that his businesses have experienced drastic growth since he joined Faulu and that his income has increased from Kes 20,000 to 80,000 per month.

Ibrahim requested this loan of Kes 80,000 from Faulu to purchase a laptop computer for his accounting business (Kes 30,000) and to restock his shop (Kes 50,000).

loans.use: To buy a laptop for his accounting business and stock for his shop

loans.name: Roggers

texts.en:
Roggers has a tailoring business in the Kayole area of Nairobi. He sells materials and ready-made suits to local residents. He's been in business for four years and has three employees.

Roggers requested this loan of Kes 60,000 from Faulu to purchase sewing machines. He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious and hopes to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 41-year-old single mother of a daughter named Jane. She has run the P&C Beauty Zone and Executive Barber Shop since 2003. She has four employees and says her business is competitive. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a facial machine. 

Hellen describes herself as hardworking and smart in her work and says that since joining Faulu, a Kiva partner, she has made better decisions on matters pertaining to her business. In the future, she hopes to open several more branches of her salon and become a leader in her profession.

loans.use: Purchase a facial machine

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and married with two children, who are both attending school. She has a tailoring and dress-making business and has been in business for three years. She employs one person in her busy shop and says she mainly sells dresses and suits. She also earns some income from small-scale farming. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu, a Kiva partner, and requested this loan for Kes. 60,000 to buy material and one sewing machine. 

Rose says she is hardworking and in the future, she would like to buy water tanks for irrigation and become an importer of materials and accessories.

loans.use: Buy materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 30 years old and married with two children, who are both attending school. She has a boutique in the Kayole area of Nairobi and sells new clothes and cosmetics. She's been in this business for three years and previously worked as a waiter.

She requested this loan for Kes. 50,000 to increase her inventory. She describes herself as hardworking, and she hopes to open up a hairdressing school in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old and married with two children, who are both attending school. She has a hardware business in the Kayole area of Nairobi and sells cement, mabati (iron sheets), and household fixtures. She has been in business for five years and employs one person. She also operates another retail shop. She requested this loan of Kes. 50,000 from Faulu to add more items to her hardware store.

Jane describes herself as hardworking and creative. In the future, she hopes to be a multi-supplier of hardware items.

loans.use: Add stock to her hardware store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and married with three children. She has a building and construction business. She's been in this business for 10 years and has 22 employees. She was previously employed as a secretary. She requested this loan of Kes. 50,000 to add a stock of paints for painting Komarock buildings.

She describes herself as industrious and hardworking and says that in Faulu she has been trained to succeed in business. In the future, she would like to buy plots of land and build more houses to increase her income.

loans.use: Add a stock of paints to her construction business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 36 years old and married with two children. She has a salon and has been in business for ten years, employing three people. She says the business is in a very busy location. She describes herself as hardworking and says that through loans from Faulu, she has been able to increase her monthly income.

Emily requested this loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase chemicals, seats and a hair dryer for her salon. She hopes to continue to improve her living standard and to expand her business to multiple salons.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, seats and a hair dryer for her salon

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 25 years old and is married with two school-age children. She has a shop called “Glory Suppliers” in which she sells snacks like groundnuts (peanuts) and provides a battery charging service. She's been in business for five years and employs three people.

Anne requested this loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu to buy more groundnuts.

Anne describes herself as creative and hardworking and says that in Faulu, she has benefited by being able to interact freely with people from different communities. In the future, she hopes to expand her shop into a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts

loans.name: Orfith

texts.es:
La señora Orfith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años, tiene 01 hijo que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, razón por la cual, pone mucho esfuerzo con el trabajo que realiza.

Orfith, es mujer joven trabajadora y luchadora, que decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de salchipapas/pollos y lleva varios años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las tardes de 6:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Orfith is a member of the Communal Bank “La Marginal II”, which is located in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married, and has a dependent school-age child, who is the reason behind everything she does.

Orfith is a hardworking and determined young woman who decided to start her own business selling salchipapas and salchipollos (local versions of fast food). She has been in operation for several years at her location that is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. Orfith says that her daily sales have been very good, due in part to the rich flavor of the food that she prepares. Her main customers are residents of the city, pedestrians, and regulars who know her well.

Her business continues to this day and she is very pleased with the work she has accomplished. She begins selling food in the evenings at 6pm. Orfith personally welcomes her customers with warmth and charisma.

With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy supplies for daily food preparation such as oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, cases of chicken, vegetables, as well as utensils to help her continue her business and provide better service to her customers. Orfith is eager to move forward and has many dreams and goals in life, such as opening a grocery store. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & utensils

loans.name: Nitzi Mariella

texts.es:
La señora Nitzi Mariella, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 22 años y no tiene hijos.

Su espíritu luchador, que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de artesanías, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado en la feria Central, donde vende todo el día.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará materiales como: tinajitas, adornos de diferentes culturas; y otros de semillas y productos propio de la región como: aretes, pulseras, collares. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando ropas, y juguetes tanto para niños y niñas.   

Nitzi Mariella, es muy joven y se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Nitzi Mariella is a member of the Communal Bank “La Marginal II”, and lives in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 22 years old, single, and does not have children.

Nitzi Mariella is known for her fighting spirit and her desire to succeed, which helped her start her own business selling handicrafts. She is gradually becoming well-known among her customers and her business is currently doing very well. Her business is located at the Central Fair where she sells all day.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase merchandise such as earthenware jars, seeds, and ornaments from different cultures. In addition, she will acquire products from the local region such as earrings, bracelets, and necklaces. Another portion of the money will be used to buy clothing and toys for both boys and girls.

Nitzi Mariella is a young woman who is content and at peace with what she has accomplished. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts to add to her inventory

loans.name: Lilia Flor

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilia Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 20 años y no tiene hijos.

Lilia Flor, es una mujer joven que le gusta trabajar, nos cuenta que anteriormente vendía cosméticos de la línea Avon y luego por iniciativa propia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de hamburguesas, con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos, con su primer prestamo en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 y con el apoyo de su pareja compraron su carrito sanguchero, posteriormente fue comprando sus utensilios y materiales para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Actualmente, sigue con la venta de hamburguesas, fuera de su casa donde hay bastante movimiento y cuenta que le va muy bien  en sus ventas, empieza a vender  a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde, ya que a esa hora ya hay clientes que desean probar un aperitivo, es ella misma quien los atiende con esa amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará insumos: papitas al hilo, a diario compra 25 panes especialmente para las hamburguesas, embutidos como: jodoc, jamonadas quesos, chicharrones, carnes, huevos y  pollos, en cuestión de verduras comprara tomates y lechugas en kilos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando mesas, sillas y paraguas, para dar una mejor imagen a su negocio y así atraer mas a sus clientes.

Lilia Flor, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lilia Flor, 20, is a member of the "La Marginal II" communal bank which is located in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has no children. Lilia Flor is a young woman who enjoys working. She tells us that she used to sell Avon cosmetics but then, through her own initiative, began to sell hamburgers in order to earn her own income. With her initial, 300 sol, loan from Manuel Ramos Movement and with her partner's support, they bought a sandwich cart. Later on she bought utensils and materials needed for better customer service. Currently, she continues to sell hamburgers outside her house where there is a lot of pedestrian traffic and she tells us that her sales are good. She starts selling at 6pm which is when many customers want a snack and she herself serves them with her characteristic good humor and charisma. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy ingredients: french fries, her daily supply of 25 hamburger buns, ham, cheese, pork rinds, cured meats, eggs, chicken, tomatoes, lettuce. Part of the money will be used to buy tables, chairs and umbrellas to provide a more appealing appearance to her business and attract more customers. Lilia Flor is very sure that her business will progress more than now and is grateful to Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her reaching her goals and seeing her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Duke

texts.en:
Duke is 24 years old. His wife is a software developer and they have two young children. Duke runs a grocery store and sells vegetables and mali mali (household items). He's been in business for five years and has one employee. He also occasionally works as a manual laborer or driver for extra income. 

He requested this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu to purchase the following items:
- 2 crates of tomatoes: 8,000 KES 
- 2 sacks sukuma (kale): 3,000 KES
- 2 sacks charcoal: 3,000 KES
- 50 trays of eggs: 11,000 KES
- 2 sacks of Irish potatoes: 10,000 KES
- mali mali items: 5,000 KES

Duke describes himself as hardworking, focused and willing to grow. Since joining Faulu, he says his business has changed drastically and his vision of the future has changed. In the future, he hopes to continue to expand his businesses and to buy a plot of land for his family.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Celestina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Celestina del Carmen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de 06 hijos, todos ellos que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. 

Lleva 15 años dedicándose a la Venta de Almidón, producto elaborado a base de yuca se inicio con S/. 100.00 y junto con su esposo, emprendieron su negocio, que se encuentra ubicada, en su misma; donde cuenta con una huerta grande, espacio que le permite rallar, cernir y secar el producto, antes de ser vendidos.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de Venta de Almidón que sirve para la preparación de dulces regionales, cuenta con clientes fijos y también trabaja con panaderías y bodegas, que hacen sus pedidos mensualmente y diariamente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará 01 tonelada de yuca.
Con parte del dinero también comprara planchas de calamina y plásticos, herramientas principales para secar al sol el almidón que produce, cuidando siempre la higiene y limpieza.

Ella y su esposo, son quienes toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, tranquila, capaz y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Celestina, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Celestina del Carmen belongs to the communal bank “La Marginal II,” La Banda de Shilcayo District, San Martin Province, San Martin Department. She is married, 40 years old, and has six children, all of whom are still dependents and are in school. For fifteen years, she has sold starch produced from cassava. She started with 100 nuevo soles and, along with her husband, began their business at home. There they have a large garden, with space to grate, sift, and dry the product before selling it. At present, Celestina continues to sell starch, which serves in the preparation of regional sweets. She has regular clients and also works with bakeries and grocery stores that make monthly and daily orders. With this loan of 3,000 nuevo soles, she will buy one ton of cassava. With part of the money she will also buy corrugated metal and plastic sheets, main tools for drying the starch in the sun, while always paying attention to hygiene and cleanliness. Celestina and her husband make the decisions about business profits. Personally, she feels more independent, calm, capable, and responsible toward paying their dues. Celestina thanks Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a business person and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing one ton of cassava

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 41 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has a salon where she offers weaving and braiding services. She's been in this business for six years and employs two people. She previously worked as a cashier in the city of Kisumu.

She requested this loan for KES 50,000 to purchase salon products. Since joining Faulu, Hawa says she has been able to pay her children's school fees and meet her day-to-day obligations. She describes herself as hardworking and committed.  In the future, she hopes to expand to a chain of hair salons.

loans.use: To purchase salon products.

loans.name: Maria Carolina

texts.es:
La señora María Carolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y 06 hijos, 03 de ellos que están bajo su responsabilidad.

María Carolina, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito y lleva varios años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 9:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Carolina, 40, is a member of the "La Marginal II" communal bank which is in Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has 6 children, 3 of whom still are under her care. María Carolina has been selling prepared meals for the past two years in her area's Central Market. She has a well-equipped area to see to her customers. She tells us that her daily earnings are good due to the unique taste of her meals. Her main customers are residents of the city, passersby, and regular customers that know her; she is well received. Currently, she continues with this line of work and happy with her daily tasks. She works in the mornings form 9-2. She personally attends to her customers with her characteristic good humor. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy ingredients that she needs for her meal preparation such as, rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, chickens, vegetables, as well as some utensils to provide better customer service. She continues to want to get ahead in life and has many dreams and goals to achieve, like having her own, well-stocked, grocery store. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años, 03 hijos, 02 que aun estudian y depende de ella.

Teresa de Jesús, es una mujer trabajadora, que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace varios años, que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Y con su primer préstamo que Manuela Ramos, le brindo; implemento mucho más su negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en la actualidad ya cuenta con  mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Teresa de Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús, 42, is a member of the "La Marginal" communal bank which is in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school and still depend on her. Teresa de Jesús is a hard-working woman who feels capable of meeting her goals and dreams. For several years she has sold groceries. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she equipped her store, which is located in her home; it is a very well organized site. Currently, she is very experienced in her line of work and well-known and liked by her customers. She has a faithful, regular clientele who come to her daily to buy from her where they know they will find everything the housewife needs. She, herself, waits on them with the good humor and charisma that is so typical of her. With this 2500 sol loan she will buy rice, sugar, pasta, milk, preserved fish, household cleaning utensils, and personal hygiene items to continue to provide better customer service. Teresa de Jesús is today an accomplished woman who wants to continue to get ahead and see her dreams become reality. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business as well as other women who want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años, 02 hijos 01 que aun depende de ella y le ayuda en sus ventas.

Martha, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Martha, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Martha, 38, is a member of the "La Marginal II" communal bank which is in Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has two children, one of whom still depends on her and helps her with her sales. Martha is a hard-working woman. She decided to set up her own soft-drink selling business in a well-apportioned area of her home. She administers her store with no boss nor schedule. She tells us that she began with 300 soles and bought 5 packages of soft-drinks. She saw that she did well and, little by little, started to invest more. Currently, she is in the same line of work and is well-known by her customers who are her neighbors, family members, and friends. With this 1500 sol loan she will buy more soft-drinks: packages of soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes, and brands, as well as mineral water, both sparkling and still. Martha has many goals ahead and is very motivated to see her dreams come true. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help. She is responsible with regard to repayments and intends to continue being so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Éxito II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Rosa Victoria, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta D. ropas usadas, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben D. su negocio. También se traslada por los diferentes lugares D. las zonas, a ofrecer su mercadería.
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará  más mercadería D. ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosa Victoria belongs to the “Mujeres con Exito II” Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín province, department of San Martín. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children, all of them adults. Rosa Victoria is a persistent and capable woman. She makes a living selling second-hand clothing in a location that is very well equipped; her business is located in her own home. She tells us that her business is going well—she has customers who know her and who know about her business. Rosa Victoria also travels to different places in the area to sell her merchandise. Her strength and perseverance have helped her to grow as an independent woman who is very proud of her achievements. She will use this loan of 800.00 soles to purchase more second-hand clothing so that she can stock up on items such as trousers, shorts, blouses in all sizes and styles, polo shirts, and dresses for women and girls. Rosa Victoria feels that she is an established and hardworking woman. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the opportunity it has offered her, which will help her to develop further as a woman and as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Lesli

texts.es:
La señora Lesli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Éxito II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun depende de ella.

Lesli, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de colchones, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio.
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  más colchones en cantidades, en diferentes marcas y tamaños.

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lesli belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres con Éxito II" (Women with Success II), in the District la Banda de Shilcayo, Province San Martin, and Department of San Martin. She is married and is 38 years old. She is the mother of 3 children, who still depend on her. Lesli is a persevering and capable woman. She sells mattresses in a very well kept area, located in her house. She says that it is going well for her. She has customers who are already familiar with and know about her business. The strength and perseverance that characterizes her helped her grow as an independent woman and she is very proud of her achievements. With this loan of S /. 1,000.00, she will buy more mattresses in different brands and sizes. She feels like an established and hard-working woman.
